excerpts: Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake.
Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups.
Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite.
green onion pancake.author: Sarah B.
green onion pancake.review:
My go to chinese delivery now!


Have ordered twice, and both times the food was very good, and with prompt delivery. Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns. Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake. Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups. Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite. Not big pieces, but just those little bites that make you think twice about what you just ate. 

Also, we've ordered a couple entrees at once and not gotten the free stuff everyone else is raving about. How do I get on that??

excerpts: Green onion pancake: SKIP!
This dish is definitely not worth the caloric intake nor is it worth your money.
They only put the tasty green onion mixture in the middle of the pancake and it only covered approximately 25% of the pancake innards.
green onion pancake.author: Christina B.
green onion pancake.review:
My Chinese food palate is quite extensive, especially living in San Francisco, growing up Chinese and constantly being surrounded by Chinese food.

I got delivery from this place last night and it wasn't horribly bad nor was it excellent either. The delivery time was standard, about 40 minutes. The food came warm which is always a plus in my book.

FOOD:
Green onion pancake: SKIP! This dish is definitely not worth the caloric intake nor is it worth your money. They only put the tasty green onion mixture in the middle of the pancake and it only covered approximately 25% of the pancake innards. Therefore, when they fry it up and serve it to you, you eat mostly fried batter without the yummy insides.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings: Not bad. I am a huge chicken wing enthusiast, especially salt and pepper wings, so I may be a bit critical when it comes to this dish. I've definitely had much tastier salt and pepper wings, but it isn't the worst I've had. It's fairly average and I would order it again if ordering from this place.

Chicken Chow Fun: Meh. Honestly, I don't think there was enough soy or sauce on it because the noodles were not brown but a tan color, which is an indication that there isn't enough soy. When tasting, it was a bit bland for what the dish could have been. I would skip this dish or maybe try the beef chow fun next time.

Bok Choy and Shiitake mushrooms: It's hard to ruin this dish so this dish gets my thumbs up especially if you're trying to eat healthy.

Wor Won Ton Soup: The broth was a bit plain and everything in it was just meh. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. 


In conclusion: just a "meh" restaurant. If I am craving Chinese, I might order from here again but I'd probably be more inclined to trying another place just because their food is just average. I'm not really sure why they have such a high rating. Is it the neighborhood they are in? If they were in the sunset or a more Chinese populated neighborhood, I have a feeling they wouldn't have such a high rating. If I were you, I'd skip on this place and try somewhere else.

excerpts: The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.
green onion pancake.author: Kris B.
green onion pancake.review:
I used their takeout and have eaten at the restaurant. Food comes out  fairly quick and the servers are nice.

Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein

the list goes on...

Almost anything I order is great. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.

excerpts: Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.
fried wonton skin.author: Valeria R.
fried wonton skin.review:
Until this past Friday, in my almost 15 years here I had never found a Chinese delivery place that I would try again. So, basically, all this time I've been ordering once from here, once from there, etc. If only Hunan Homes delivered...that would have solved my problem a long time ago.

But, recently, my BFF started raving about Yum Yum Hunan. I checked out my fellow Yelpers' reviews and Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise! When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein. Nice! Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.

The food arrived, nice and hot, in about 30 minutes. The wontons blew me away...they were simply amazing. Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.

The chow mein was simple and satisfying.

The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.

The walnut prawns, again, weren't as good as Hunan Homes', but I would order them again. They give you a baker's dozen, by the way.

I expected the prawns to come on the usual bed of shredded lettuce, but the beef was served that way as well, which I don't care for because it reheats horribly. Next time I'll ask them to leave out the lettuce on everything so that I don't have to pick it off.

So, all told, for about $30 including tip, I got almost 5 meals. Yum Yum, indeed, and economical! Friendly service too.

Yum Yum is going on the speed-dial for sure!

P.S. I swear I didn't eat all 5 of those meals in one night.

excerpts: Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns.
crab rangoon.author: Sarah B.
crab rangoon.review:
My go to chinese delivery now!


Have ordered twice, and both times the food was very good, and with prompt delivery. Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns. Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake. Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups. Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite. Not big pieces, but just those little bites that make you think twice about what you just ate. 

Also, we've ordered a couple entrees at once and not gotten the free stuff everyone else is raving about. How do I get on that??

excerpts: The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix.
The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess.
But otherwise, everything was quite good -
I'd order from here again.
crab rangoon.author: Lisa K.
crab rangoon.review:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.

excerpts: the crab rangoon and egg rolls were good,but the pork spareribs were waaaaaay too salty and nearly inedible.
a c+
At best
crab rangoon.author: Jack B.
crab rangoon.review: the general tsao chicken watery and bland ..the  broccoli was ok but it made the rest of the dish super wet and meh. the crab rangoon and egg rolls were good,but the pork spareribs were waaaaaay too salty and nearly inedible. a c+ At best

excerpts: Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.
Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.
crab rangoon.author: Megan J.
crab rangoon.review:
We are new to the Pac Hts neighborhood so I jumped on Yelp to figure out where to grab bomb Chinese food.  Yum Yum came highly recommended from the majority of Yelpers and STILL managed to exceed our expectations. The prices are surprisingly reasonable and the food is insanely flavorful and fresh.  Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.  Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.  Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!) and Yum Yum just added 4 devotees to their customer base. 

The service was also uber-friendly.  Since we placed our order during a World Series game (aka they were slammed with orders), they suggested that we pick up in 15 minutes rather than wait the 45-60 mins for delivery.  And, then, when we arrived at the restaurant, thanked us profusely for making the effort to come to them.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant.
The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent.
I've always had a great experience.
crab rangoon.author: Caroline N.
crab rangoon.review: It's hard to find a tasty decent Chinese food place in the city. I am so happy to find Yum Yum Hunan! The prices are reasonable and the food is very good. I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant. The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent. I've always had a great experience.

excerpts: I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken.
crab rangoon.author: Edwin M.
crab rangoon.review:
Very good - perfect grease factor. 

The service was average, and the pricing was a little higher than average, but hey, it's Pac Heights, what are you going to do?

I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken. My friend ordered Garlic Chicken. They both came with an egg roll - it was very reminiscent of generic Chinese food from home, but altogether, a nice place to eat.

excerpts:
Pot stickers - got good, not bad
Crab Rangoon - very flavorful, lots of crab, pretty good overall
crab rangoon.author: Anya W.
crab rangoon.review:
Standard chinese food.  Fast delivery.  String bean with beef was very good (no weird chewy pieces that you often get in beef dishes)  Flavor was good, not to salty, and I didnt sense any MSG.
Pot stickers - got good, not bad
Crab Rangoon - very flavorful, lots of crab, pretty good overall

The reason that I gave it only 3 stars, and not 4, was because of the lunch menu.  The menu advertised soup and appetizer...but you dont get to chose.  Only hot and sour, and fried wonton skins (yes the cheapest item, and I dont like hot and sour)  It is still affordable at $6, BUT they wont deliver for under $15.  So you have to order more than the just lunch, so you might as well order off the regular menu.  
The fact that they make this slightly difficult, they lost a star.

Besides that, solid basic chinese food

excerpts: I really really enjoy there lover and cashew walnut prawns and they have a new take on crab rangoon.
I love it as well as my dog who I feed to her for treats.
GREAT FOOD FAST AND AMAZING PRICES.
Portions are big.
Friendly staff
crab rangoon.author: Jen L.
crab rangoon.review: Amazing food. I have tried take out which only took 6 minutes to prepare and dine in which came out almost instantly . There mongolian chicken off the chain. As well as sesame chicken. I really really enjoy there lover and cashew walnut prawns and they have a new take on crab rangoon. I love it as well as my dog who I feed to her for treats. GREAT FOOD FAST AND AMAZING PRICES. Portions are big. Friendly staff

excerpts: We ordered: dim sum sampler (I give it 1 out of 5 stars), apps sampler (the Crab Rangoon and potstickers were a 3 out of 5, but the fried shrimp and the egg roll were beyond greasy, with an aftertaste.. negative two stars).
crab rangoon.author: Rachel D.
crab rangoon.review:
Oh Nuh Uh!

I had just today told my Sweetie that finally I was learning to like Chinese food (a special shout out & a thx to Nan King Road Bistro for making that possible). We like to occasionally order in on Sunday nights & got flyered by YYH. Their menu was appealing so we thought to give them a try.
Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees. The man who took my order was nice. The food came fast too.
We ordered: dim sum sampler (I give it 1 out of 5 stars), apps sampler (the Crab Rangoon and potstickers were a 3 out of 5, but the fried shrimp and the egg roll were beyond greasy, with an aftertaste.. negative two stars). The chow mein was decent, though bland. The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it. The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess.. 
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place. We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad- I hate to waste. However, the fortunes in the cookies were auspicious.

Pros: Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
Cons: The food.

Yuk Yuk Hunan- good for diet, bad for me.

excerpts: Crab Rangoon - 5 stars, delicious, star shaped generous filling.
I would never have order this except one of the reviews here talked about it
and I am very very glad I did.
It's a good execution of Crab Rangoon even if it may be crab-less.
crab rangoon.author: Christina C.
crab rangoon.review:
As far as Americanized Chinese foods go, this place is...here.  It has some lovely things that I would never have ordered were it not for the reviews on this site, and then it had some things that I craved which were also mentioned on this site.  Let's start off with the good news, shall we?

Crab Rangoon - 5 stars, delicious, star shaped generous filling.  I would never have order this except one of the reviews here talked about it and I am very very glad I did.  It's a good execution of Crab Rangoon even if it may be crab-less.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings Entree - 5 Stars.  Came on a bed of shredded lettuce with jalapeno, peppers, some other stuff.  Batter was tasty and seasoned.  A bit heavy, but that's like saying the cone shape of carrots detracts from the taste.  

Ma Po ToFu - 3 stars.  Ths sauce was not undelicious, and the flavor was not offensive.  My preferance is for it to be made with soft tofu whereas this was made with medium or firm.

Buddha's Delight Vegetable Clay Pot - 3 stars.  The taste was rather fresh.  I enjoyed the thin glass noodles at the bottom and the pleasing array of veg, wood ear mushroom, and tofu.  Again, I would have like soft tofu, not medium or firm.  

Pork Chow Mein - 5 stars because it was FREE!!  I ordered so much food that my tummy is groaning right now.  Maybe tomorrow after the laxative eat works its magic, I'll have some.  But for now, Chinese food:1, Christina:0.

Let's talk about the lovely young man who delivered it.  He was so considerate and concerned that my apartment door would close and lock me out (it does and did), he voiced his concern.  Ah.  What a nice young man.

Final thoughts: I've come to the conclusion that ordering chinese food as a chinese person who does not live in NYC is like eating at a cafeteria (maybe even a public school cafeteria) after having grown up on home cooking, on the farm, grandmother makes her own bread, cooks her own jellies.  I'm not disappointed because that would be like being disappointed that watermelons are not poisonous.  I am merely...enlightened.  And I know that for $36 I have enough food to last me the rest of the week through finals, if only I can bring myself to eat it.

excerpts: We had the crab rangoon which was good, not the best I've had
but okay.
crab rangoon.author: Erin H.
crab rangoon.review:
Friday night.  Hungry. Lazy.  Needed a little help from Yelp to get me some Chinese delivery.

Staff was courteous on the phone & our order was delivered quickly.  For the price, we were surprised at the amount of food we had.  Things were looking good...

The food was edible, but not good by any means.  We had the crab rangoon which was good, not the best I've had but okay.  We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.  Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.  Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.  They were also a little on the greasy side.  I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.  Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.

excerpts: Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).
crab rangoon.author: TC C.
crab rangoon.review:
Same great Yum Yum's that was loved on Valencia St.

I ate fried food for dinner with white rice and LOVED every bite!  
Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).

I also recommend their Basil Tofu and Mango Chicken.

Extremely friendly service!  Nice to see some of the same familiar faces.

excerpts: They also do the classic dishes great such as their crab rangoon or sesame chicken.
crab rangoon.author: King D M.
crab rangoon.review:
Its between this place and Tai Chi for chinese delivery for me.  (I haven't actually ever been there)  

As many others have said, the mongolian lamb is amazing; it has great flavor.  They also do the classic dishes great such as their crab rangoon or sesame chicken.

excerpts: Crab rangoon and my undying love of anything soupy particularly seafood.
crab rangoon.author: jubi l.
crab rangoon.review:
I had become a fan of this restaurant, my fav. Crab rangoon and my undying love of anything soupy particularly seafood. 

It's cheap, fast, yummy, clean and the service is good. Trust me when you are working in the hospital, every minute counts.

I feel bad though, coz I always drag my Secretary to come eat with me. I have a tiny stomache, & she helps me finished what I order. No wonder, Mr gain weight :(

excerpts: For 3 people, we ordered 2 entrees, an order of spring rolls (3), order of crab rangoon (6), and a large egg drop soup (which has yummy mushrooms and veggies in it), all for $35 and delivered in 45 min.
And we still had enough for a seconds.
I won't be getting delivery chinese from anywhere else.
I'm sold!
crab rangoon.author: Meg G.
crab rangoon.review: Yum Yum Hunan is great!!  The meatless chicken general tso and kung pow tofu is great, healthy, light - great vegetarian options!  Spring rolls are also pretty tasty.  For 3 people, we ordered 2 entrees, an order of spring rolls (3), order of crab rangoon (6), and a large egg drop soup (which has yummy mushrooms and veggies in it), all for $35 and delivered in 45 min.  And we still had enough for a seconds.  I won't be getting delivery chinese from anywhere else.  I'm sold!

excerpts: The crab rangoon appetizer was bomb...
it's like a deep fried wonton with crab and cream cheese inside.
crab rangoon.author: Melissa D.
crab rangoon.review: Good if you're looking for in-authentic, fast and somewhat greasy (in a good way) chinese food. The crab rangoon appetizer was bomb... it's like a deep fried wonton with crab and cream cheese inside.

excerpts: Also had the crispy deep fried chicken wings, which were amazingly tender.
Best part was the batter was still crispy.
fried chicken wings.author: Sophie P.
fried chicken wings.review: yum yum, indeed!  Just finished stuffing my belly with super delicious and FRESH chinese food.  I ordered the veggie deluxe which came with broccoli, mushroom, snow peas, and baby corn that were still crispy and fresh, which is a huge surprise considering other take out places.  Also had the crispy deep fried chicken wings, which were amazingly tender.  Best part was the batter was still crispy.  And thank you fellow yelper for posting about the free chow mein with a 2 entree order.  I asked the guy on the phone (who was super friendly) if they still offered this special and he said yes without any hesitation.  The chicken chow mein was so good, I couldn't stop talking about how good it was while I was eating it.  Oh, and the craziest part was the food got to me in 15 minutes!  I had to check my call log to make sure that was right.  I felt like the guy was at my door the second I hung up.  I'm so deliriously happy right now, I wanted to call them up and tell them how good the food was and that they made my night.  So excited I found this place, I'm always wary of chinese delivery, but I'm happy to say I've found my go to chinese spot.  Woot!

excerpts: Their wonton soup is amazing and has so many fresh vegetables in it.
wonton soup.author: Mickey A.
wonton soup.review: I can't get enough of this place! Their wonton soup is amazing and has so many fresh vegetables in it. The five flavor chicken is ridiculously good!

excerpts: The soups are delicious, I recommend the wonton soup.
wonton soup.author: Tyler K.
wonton soup.review:
SECRET TIP: use the online system to find what you want and then call in the order over the phone - It's cheaper!

Best chow fun in town! Absolutely to die for, just the right noodles, perfectly dressed, the vegetable is my favorite. Orange chicken is a perfect mix of American and traditional style. The soups are delicious, I recommend the wonton soup. 

Only downside (hence the 4 stars) would be the online order system. I often use the online system as a convenience and end up having to call in my order after I place it online because the system closes out when you try to complete and place your order. BUT upon calling in the order my total is usually $5-$10 cheaper than the online system. Delivery is good but takes about 45 mins

excerpts: We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids.
wonton soup.author: Alexis M.
wonton soup.review:
Yum Yum is well...Yum Yum.


We headed here after a show at The Fillmore based on reviews on Yelp.

Very fresh and non greasy. The restaurant was empty but the phone was ringing of the hook and the delivery guys were in and out like crazy. I enjoyed hearing the old man answer the phone, "Hello, Yum Yum".

Everything was wonderful and fresh. When I walked by to use the bathroom I saw them cutting up a ton of fresh zucchini and carrots and onions. Nothing frozen. All super fresh vegetables.

We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids. 

So glad we stumbled upon this gem of a Chinese restaurant. Plus we got to end the night with a tour of Pac Heights with it's beautiful homes all decorated for Christmas.

excerpts: The dinner started off nicely with wonton soup that had an excellent broth and veggies that were so fresh they still crunched, and good-sized wontons.
wonton soup.author: Maximillian M.
wonton soup.review:
The dinner started off nicely with wonton soup that had an excellent broth and veggies that were so fresh they still crunched, and good-sized wontons. Our entrees included combo chow fun noodles that was standard but full of flavor and assorted meats and veggies, a seafood on sizzling rice dish that didn't really need the sizzling rice, and the "Yum Yum Delicatessen" that had nearly the same ingredients (sans celery and plus calamari) as the former but seemed to be the consensus favorite.

Definite minus was the brown rice, that tasted like it had been left out in the open for way too long. It was pretty much wasn't edible.

Overall, a pleasant experience, cloth napkins (always appreciated), fast service, nice decor. Bonus: they had NBA games on the TV... which suspiciously looked like it was taken from a kid's bedroom...

excerpts: Wor Wonton Soup:  Excellent.
I'd like more shrimp, though.
Yum Yum Hunan Pork:
wonton soup.author: Ally C.
wonton soup.review:
Szechuan String Beans:  Excellent!
Wor Wonton Soup:  Excellent.  I'd like more shrimp, though.
Yum Yum Hunan Pork:  Good.

Very friendly and efficient service.  :)

excerpts: Wor Wonton Soup - broth is just okay.
Shrimps floating around were overcooked, chicken tasteless.
Wontons had large grounded chunks of meat inside - didn't like the taste or texture.
The meat floating around (like the pork and chicken) tasted like they cooked it a while ago separate from the soup and just threw it in there last minute before packaging it for delivery.
wonton soup.author: Ali G.
wonton soup.review:
Not Yum Yum!

Ordered delivery.  Quoted 1 hour, came in 25 min!  Love it when businesses do that - underpromise and overdeliver always makes me happy.

Wor Wonton Soup - broth is just okay.  Shrimps floating around were overcooked, chicken tasteless.  Wontons had large grounded chunks of meat inside - didn't like the taste or texture.  The meat floating around (like the pork and chicken) tasted like they cooked it a while ago separate from the soup and just threw it in there last minute before packaging it for delivery.  Soup doesn't have any form of yummy smell to it either.

Chicken with mixed vegetables in light sauce - dissapointing.  Chicken was rubbery chunks of dark meat - my fault for not specifying/asking if i could get white meat in my starving rage when ordering.  Sauce was alright, but had a distinct chemical taste to it which ruined the flavor - i suspect msg overload, esp now w/ my stomach not so happy.  Half the veggies were good, half were too soggy in the sauce.

Nothing terrible to mention, just that I was dissapointed with both dishes I ordered since you can get these things elsewhere that actually taste yummy!  And the fact that I am seriously considering throwing out my leftovers really says that I do not like this food enough to eat it again when I'm hungry.  So I will not be getting food from here again, and wouldn't recommend this place.

Try Wok Shop cafe for delivery/take out - I ordered pick up from them for chicken and vegetables not too long ago, and it was really, really good!  So as of now they are my go-to for chinese in pac heights.

excerpts: I always order the Mongolian beef (which has a bit of a kick to it), Sweet and sour chicken, and wonton soup.
Don't waste your time with the pot stickers or the crab rangoons.
wonton soup.author: Jenee Y.
wonton soup.review: This is my go-to Chinese Food restaurant. I usually order for delivery and my food always arrives hot and in a timely fashion. The prices are very decent and the dishes are never too greasy like most local Chinese food restaurants. I always order the Mongolian beef (which has a bit of a kick to it), Sweet and sour chicken, and wonton soup. Don't waste your time with the pot stickers or the crab rangoons.

excerpts: I was home sick and the only thing I thought would make me better was some wonton soup and mongolian beef.
The soup was perfect and soothing, and the mongolian beef fresh and exactly what I wanted.
The guy was mean.. but I will put up with it to get the food.
wonton soup.author: Sam A.
wonton soup.review:
I created a Yelp account, JUST so I could write a review about this place. The guy on the phone was sooo mean! I was home sick and the only thing I thought would make me better was some wonton soup and mongolian beef.

The soup was perfect and soothing, and the mongolian beef fresh and exactly what I wanted. The guy was mean.. but I will put up with it to get the food.

excerpts: I almost wept sucking down the warm seaweed soup.
Seriously.
As for the food quality - I mean, this is your typical delivery Chinese food, and it tasted like one.
If I were to rate this place solely based on the food quality, it would have gotten a lower rating.
But the point here is, they accomodate your very desperate and selfish needs for a very reasonable price.
For those who place more importance on quantity over quality, this place will deliver.
They gave me a free Chow Main.
As I said earlier, the bag weighted almost 20 lbs
...that's a lot of food for about $30.
seaweed soup.author: Nana N.
seaweed soup.review:
Disclaimer: this is a review of a Chinese restaurant, not of an AA meeting.

I don't mix beer and hard alcohol.
I don't do happy hours with my coworkers.
I never, ever do anything that's called ___bombs (at least since 2002). 
I never drink without putting some food in my stomach first.
I never drink any mixed drinks made of non-top shelf liquer. 

....All this wisdom was obtained through close to a couple of decades of solid drinking experiences (we start drinking very young in my home country, OK? I mean, very young) to avoid the unbearable pain called hangover the morning after.

But why, why, why, did I do all of the above this Friday??? 

Didn't I learn never to do anything out of my style/character?

WTF was I thinking, killing car bombs with 20 somethings?

Needless to say, I woke up with a horrific hangover. In an attempt to put something in my stomach to ease the pain, I opened the fridge just to find a bottle of Thai chili sauce, milk, butter, 1/2 onions, and rockfort cheese....

I miserably crawled towards my laptop and logged on to Yelp. I clicked "Find Reviewes" to identify any restaurant that would deliver me a bowl of soup at 11:12 in the morning. 

Yum Yum Hunan, that is. They, together with Yelp's sophisticated search functions, saved my life this Saturday. Within half an hour, 20lbs of warm Chinese food was delivered to my apartment before noon. ----Priceless. 

I almost wept sucking down the warm seaweed soup. Seriously. As for the food quality - I mean, this is your typical delivery Chinese food, and it tasted like one. If I were to rate this place solely based on the food quality, it would have gotten a lower rating. But the point here is, they accomodate your very desperate and selfish needs for a very reasonable price. For those who place more importance on quantity over quality, this place will deliver. They gave me a free Chow Main. As I said earlier, the bag weighted almost 20 lbs...that's a lot of food for about $30. The service is courteous and efficient. 

Bookmark now. I know you will have one of these painful mornings that will require a warm soup.

excerpts: Wor Wonton Soup:  Excellent.
I'd like more shrimp, though.
Yum Yum Hunan Pork:
wor wonton soup.author: Ally C.
wor wonton soup.review:
Szechuan String Beans:  Excellent!
Wor Wonton Soup:  Excellent.  I'd like more shrimp, though.
Yum Yum Hunan Pork:  Good.

Very friendly and efficient service.  :)

excerpts: Wor Wonton Soup - broth is just okay.
Shrimps floating around were overcooked, chicken tasteless.
Wontons had large grounded chunks of meat inside - didn't like the taste or texture.
The meat floating around (like the pork and chicken) tasted like they cooked it a while ago separate from the soup and just threw it in there last minute before packaging it for delivery.
wor wonton soup.author: Ali G.
wor wonton soup.review:
Not Yum Yum!

Ordered delivery.  Quoted 1 hour, came in 25 min!  Love it when businesses do that - underpromise and overdeliver always makes me happy.

Wor Wonton Soup - broth is just okay.  Shrimps floating around were overcooked, chicken tasteless.  Wontons had large grounded chunks of meat inside - didn't like the taste or texture.  The meat floating around (like the pork and chicken) tasted like they cooked it a while ago separate from the soup and just threw it in there last minute before packaging it for delivery.  Soup doesn't have any form of yummy smell to it either.

Chicken with mixed vegetables in light sauce - dissapointing.  Chicken was rubbery chunks of dark meat - my fault for not specifying/asking if i could get white meat in my starving rage when ordering.  Sauce was alright, but had a distinct chemical taste to it which ruined the flavor - i suspect msg overload, esp now w/ my stomach not so happy.  Half the veggies were good, half were too soggy in the sauce.

Nothing terrible to mention, just that I was dissapointed with both dishes I ordered since you can get these things elsewhere that actually taste yummy!  And the fact that I am seriously considering throwing out my leftovers really says that I do not like this food enough to eat it again when I'm hungry.  So I will not be getting food from here again, and wouldn't recommend this place.

Try Wok Shop cafe for delivery/take out - I ordered pick up from them for chicken and vegetables not too long ago, and it was really, really good!  So as of now they are my go-to for chinese in pac heights.

excerpts: also tried the combo noodle soup - very fat noodles (-) but
a lot of great meats and veggies in it (++).
combo noodle soup.author: Kimberly S.
combo noodle soup.review: Best chinese food delivery! Prices are cheap, delivery is quick, and the food is delicious. If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice... the FREE chicken fried is awesome!! i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies. the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it. also tried the combo noodle soup - very fat noodles (-) but  a lot of great meats and veggies in it (++). for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00..... i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout :)

excerpts: Chicken salad, for example, is now $10.
The much better chicken salad at R & G Lounge is $7.
chicken salad.author: John N.
chicken salad.review: Decent food, but nothing special, and the prices are high for what you get. Chicken salad, for example, is now $10. The much better chicken salad at R & G Lounge is $7.

excerpts: I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point.
I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time.
It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.
chicken salad.author: Jasmine F.
chicken salad.review:
I'm a bit surprised seeing so many low ratings for this place over the past few months! For me, Yum Yum has been the best Chinese delivery I've experienced in the city, hands down...and I've been looking for a "go to" spot for a looooooooooong time. The only thing that has gone wrong for me: they have forgotten items a couple times and brought the wrong order once, but they always make it up to me, so it's all good.

I consistently order the hot and sour soup, the kung pao tofu, and the brown rice. Always solid, and generally not too greasy (though once the tofu was REALLY greasy...but still oh sooooo tasty & flavorful). I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point. I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time. It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.

excerpts: the best salt and pepper fried rock cod the Szechuan beef delicious prawn fried rice amazing this will be my go-to place all the time...
just had this for dinner yummy yum yum
szechuan beef.author: Lorellie S.
szechuan beef.review: I love this place it has the best salt and pepper fried rock cod the Szechuan beef delicious prawn fried rice amazing this will be my go-to place all the time... just had this for dinner yummy yum yum

excerpts: Shout out to the Szechuan Beef as my favourite so far.
The spices aren't particularly hot though, so if you like it spicy ask for extra hot.
szechuan beef.author: Amaya B.
szechuan beef.review: This is our new "go to" takeout place; it's within walking distance so we usually pick up but they also deliver to our area. Everything we've tried so far has been delicious, not to sweet or greasy as I have found a lot of Chinese food in the US. The dumplings are really nice and seem to be made on site, the green beans are a great side and *huge* easily serves 4. Shout out to the Szechuan Beef as my favourite so far. The spices aren't particularly hot though, so if you like it spicy ask for extra hot.

excerpts: Finally found the best Mongolian Beef in the city.
After our favorite restaurant closed last year it was difficult looking for a restaurant with the similar taste of cooking.
This is definitely the one that hits the spot.
If you are looking for a good Hunan food, this is the place.
mongolian beef.author: JJ M.
mongolian beef.review: Finally found the best Mongolian Beef in the city. After our favorite restaurant closed last year it was difficult looking for a restaurant with the similar taste of cooking.  This is definitely the one that hits the spot. If you are looking for a good Hunan food, this is the place.  Try the sesame chicken as well.  The place is very clean as well

excerpts: Ordered the Mongolian Beef and Salt and Pepper wings for delivery.
The Mongolian beef didn't look right (missing the typical looking sauce and covered in black pepper) and I could tell the wings were going to be soggy.
The beef tasted like they dumped an entire pepper shaker into it
and I could only manage 3 bites before I threw it out.
The salt and pepper wings should have just been called pepper wings, they weren't crunchy at all, and they were mostly fat.
mongolian beef.author: Amanda P.
mongolian beef.review: Ordered the Mongolian Beef and Salt and Pepper wings for delivery.  The Mongolian beef didn't look right (missing the typical looking sauce and covered in black pepper) and I could tell the wings were going to be soggy. The beef tasted like they dumped an entire pepper shaker into it and I could only manage 3 bites before I threw it out.  The salt and pepper wings should have just been called pepper wings, they weren't crunchy at all, and they were mostly fat.

excerpts:
- crispy salt and pepper black cod
- mongolian beef (tasty with sautéed onions)
- chicken with green beans (v. generous with the green beans)
mongolian beef.author: Amelia C.
mongolian beef.review:
Great for take-out/ delivery. Also, if you order over $25 worth of food, you get a free lo mein or fried rice (but you have to order over the phone; no free stuff if you order online due to take rates from the websites). 

Highly recommend:
- vegetable fried rice (not too oily and has lots of veggies in it, including zucchini!)
- crispy salt and pepper black cod
- mongolian beef (tasty with sautéed onions)
- chicken with green beans (v. generous with the green beans)

excerpts: My dad said he wanted Mongolian beef
so I searched Yelp and found Yum Yum.
The Mongolian beef had the perfect amount of spices and the beef was cooked to perfection.
The delivery was fast and the driver came into the hospital and waited for me in the lobby downstairs.
I'm sure he would have came up to the waiting room where we were at
but I told the man on the phone to have them call me
and I would meet them down there in the main lobby.
They were fast and the food was super hot.
Convenient and delicious.
It left us wanting more.
I will definitely order again.
mongolian beef.author: Dema S.
mongolian beef.review: This place is great. My dad, sister and I were tired and hungry at CMPC in the waiting room at the Critical Care unit. My dad said he wanted Mongolian beef so I searched Yelp and found Yum Yum. The Mongolian beef had the perfect amount of spices and the beef was cooked to perfection. The delivery was fast and the driver came into the hospital and waited for me in the lobby downstairs. I'm sure he would have came up to the waiting room where we were at but I told the man on the phone to have them call me and I would meet them down there in the main lobby. They were fast and the food was super hot. Convenient and delicious. It left us wanting more. I will definitely order again.

excerpts: The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality.
mongolian beef.author: Lisa K.
mongolian beef.review:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.

excerpts: The Mongolian beef with veggies was tasty and satisfying.
I would eat here again.
mongolian beef.author: David S.
mongolian beef.review: My co-workers talked me into Chinese today.  Not typically my first choice for lunch but it was actually really good. We ordered take out and ate at work. The Mongolian beef with veggies was tasty and satisfying. I would eat here again.

excerpts: We ordered the scallops with broccoli, mongolian beef and hot and sour soup.
mongolian beef.author: farah b.
mongolian beef.review:
I like to try new places and the menu looked good enough.

All night we had hot flashes and not good at all the next day.

We ordered the scallops with broccoli, mongolian beef and hot and sour soup. The soup was good everything else was sloppy with sauce and really spicy. 

That could of been part of the hot flashes but either way..it wasnt for me.

I wouldnt order take out from here again. I should of listened to everyone's reviews. 

They were really friendly on the phone and when they dropped off the food.

excerpts: I got the spare ribs, chicken wings, and mongolian beef.
mongolian beef.author: Le T.
mongolian beef.review:
I came here twice. The first time, the food was pretty bland. I got the spare ribs, chicken wings, and mongolian beef.  While the food was edible, it wasn't very spectacular. 

The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.  This time, the food was surprisingly tasty. 

I suggest going around lunch time to get the lunch special.  Otherwise, the dinner prices can add up especially if you order a rice dish and a meat dish and a vegetable dish.

excerpts: The mongolian beef there is spicy for me, but it was still very good.
Usually my boyfriend picks out all of the meat and leaves all the veggies, but he actually started EATING the veggies cause of the sauce!
It was amazing.
mongolian beef.author: Bella C.
mongolian beef.review:
OMG I miss really good Chinese food.  I can't seem to find anything good in San Diego!

So went home for the weekend and wanted to stay in and order food.  Had a pile of take out menus and finally decided on Chinese... then narrowed it down to Yum Yum Hunan.  I'm so happy with my choice!!

I ordered Pork Chow Fun and it was so good!!! Barbecued pork was amazingggg, but it was SLIGHTLY dry.  But it was still SOOO goodddd.  Ahhh. Not greasy at all!! =DD

The mongolian beef there is spicy for me, but it was still very good.  Usually my boyfriend picks out all of the meat and leaves all the veggies, but he actually started EATING the veggies cause of the sauce! It was amazing.  Then we had the brilliant idea of mixing the sauce with my chow fun to give it a little bit more flavor and I was so happy!!! Yummmmm.  Now I just need to find the suitable replacement in San DIego.... SO hard to find one that's reasonable in price and wonderful in taste =(.

The only thing that sucked was that it took like an hour to get it delivered, but I'm not sure what standard delivery time, so that was the only downside.

But it was SO worth the wait. I want more!!!

excerpts: I have had their Mongolian Beef (spicy!) and their Garlic Pork (holy deliciousness batman!) and their Hot and Sour Soup (ok, needs more sour).
mongolian beef.author: Kathy K.
mongolian beef.review:
Does the fact that I have gone here once a week for the last few weeks say anything?

I LOVE their honey walnut prawns. SO delicious and they give you at least a dozen which is more than I can say for some *ahem* places where they charge you more and give you 5 prawns thinking they are doing you a favor.

I have had their Mongolian Beef (spicy!) and their Garlic Pork (holy deliciousness batman!) and their Hot and Sour Soup (ok, needs more sour).

But this place is clean, service is friendly and it is cheap.

I haven't done their delivery (I live a few blocks away but I have pizza delivered from 3 blocks away so go ahead judge me) but I hear it is quick and friendly from my neighbors.

Happy to find a local place to fulfill my Chinese food cravings!

excerpts: Wor won ton soup and Mongolian beef are great as well.
mongolian beef.author: Lauren C.
mongolian beef.review: A lot of people phone in won ton soup, and that is not the case here! Super fresh, great flavor, and they arrived within 30 minutes both times I've ordered. Only $15 delivery minimum. Wor won ton soup and Mongolian beef are great as well.

excerpts: We usually order Mongolian beef and pork fried rice and broccoli a la carte (special request)
I've gotten scallops. before.
mongolian beef.author: Nia N.
mongolian beef.review:
My great aunt loves this place because its close to our apartment and because they deliver. Delivery is super fast and the food is still hot. We usually order Mongolian beef and pork fried rice and broccoli a la carte (special request) I've gotten scallops. before. All in all the food is pretty tasty. 

Only complaint: One night, my aunt and I decided to place our order for pick up since they were 15 mins away from closing. My great aunt walked in ahead of me and told them how much she loved their food and how she's been coming for years and they completely ignored her comment and asked how they could help me since I walked in a little after her. I waited a minute to see if he would comment back to her but he didn't he just asked how he could help me. I told him I had an order for pick-up and as he turns to get it, my aunt asked for a cup of water (she was pretty winded by the walk there) and he glances at her then completely ignores her again. It wasn't until I asked again for her that he got the water for her... From the sink, at that! I guess the guy figured maybe my aunt wasn't spending any money, just coming in to make a comment but either way it was extremely rude. I would've considered giving another star but after that experience I just couldn't, plus the food is just OK anyway. What makes it even worse is I don't think My great aunt even noticed how rude they really were to her. Smh

excerpts: Even though I am one fourth Chinese, my pallet for Chinese delivery food is pretty poor; so I have to say that the food quality is as good as any Chinese delivery I have ever had; possibly better because their Mongolian beef actually has lots of beef, unlike some places I have ordered from where there is more onion than anything else.
This will now be the place where I buy my Chinese delivery from now on.
mongolian beef.author: Kimberly H.
mongolian beef.review:
Here is where you can find their menu: http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurantdetails?restaurantid=7632

Last night we ordered dinner from here; wow! The phone service is the best that I have ever called when ordering delivery of any kind of food, he answered my questions nicely and didn't put me on hold or rush me. I even had a short conversation with him about how they recently moved from Valencia St. It was so obvious he had a smile in his voice. Because I have never been there before he said he will put a menu in my bag. Their new divisadero location was the home to my old Chinese delivery place. 

After I ordered our dinner he asked if I wanted free fried rice because we ordered 2 entrees. I was so surprised because usually when you are able to get something free you have to ask them for it by saying you have a coupon or tell them you see it on the menu. 

I placed my order at 6:48pm and it arrived at 7:00pm. Can you believe that, 12 minutes! I am not even lying because I knew that I would be giving them a yelp review while I was talking on the phone with him because he was so nice. I wanted my review to have all the information that mattered so I wrote down the times. Mind you, I live 7 blocks from this place so I can't guarantee you that you will be getting your order that fast. It could have also been that their delivery guy was there at the exact time my food was ready. However, I will say that the Chinese restaurant that used to be at this location never delivered my food this fast. 

Even though I am one fourth Chinese, my pallet for Chinese delivery food is pretty poor; so I have to say that the food quality is as good as any Chinese delivery I have ever had; possibly better because their Mongolian beef actually has lots of beef, unlike some places I have ordered from where there is more onion than anything else. This will now be the place where I buy my Chinese delivery from now on.

excerpts: I have to say their Mongolian beef is pretty good, as well as their combination fried rice, potstickers and green beans.
Extra stars for being one of the only Chinese restaurants I've ordered from that has Har Gow (shrimp dumplings) available all day!
Delivery is faster than almost anywhere (except Amici's of course), so it's a great option for a last-minute dinner.
mongolian beef.author: Nancy O.
mongolian beef.review:
We used to order from Ben Wa just down the street.  However, the declining quality of the meat and taste of the food has pushed us to Yum Yum.
I have to say their Mongolian beef is pretty good, as well as their combination fried rice, potstickers and green beans.  Extra stars for being one of the only Chinese restaurants I've ordered from that has Har Gow (shrimp dumplings) available all day!
Delivery is faster than almost anywhere (except Amici's of course), so it's a great option for a last-minute dinner.

excerpts: I always order the mongolian beef with rice to go.
Order arrives in 10 minutes or less.
I'm not sure whats in the sause
but Im addicted.
A little disapointed that sometimes the fortune missing from the cookie !
mongolian beef.author: Cup C.
mongolian beef.review: I always order the mongolian beef with rice to go. Order arrives in 10 minutes or less. I'm not sure whats in the sause but Im addicted. A little disapointed that sometimes the fortune missing from the cookie !

excerpts: The Mongolian Beef was tasty.
mongolian beef.author: Jean P.
mongolian beef.review: I ordered delivery.  It was super fast and on time.  The portion sizes were great (american style).  The Mongolian Beef was tasty.  The Chicken Fried rice was decent as well (needed salt and pepper as per usual).  BUT the General Tsao's Chicken NOT GOOD, and NEEDS ALOT of improvement - it was deep fried until it was poofy, and then sogged down in a pile of thin watery sauce in the box (a puddle), and it was nearly flavorless.  Tell Chef Yum Yum to try PF Changs "Changs Chicken", or even Panda Express! Something a little more sticky, less water, and less deep friend - or change the deep fry recipe to include a sticky sauce mixture like bbq ribs.  I've had alot of General Chicken in my life and this was the worst, I'm not angry, just disappointed.  Please fix this Chef Yum Yum!

excerpts: I have ordered the kung pao tofu and chicken, mongolian beef, meatless chicken general tsao, hot and sour soup, and vegetable chow main.
Everything was yummy (with the exception of the hot sour soup, lacking in the flavor department)!
None of the dishes were greasy,  all the ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies, and the portions were generous.
My meat loving, i hate organic and vegan anything bf really liked the meatless chicken general tsao.
mongolian beef.author: danielle l.
mongolian beef.review:
Yum Yum Hunan is a name well deserved.  I have ordered delivery here twice now and both times have been pleasantly surprised.  I have ordered the kung pao tofu and chicken, mongolian beef, meatless chicken general tsao, hot and sour soup, and vegetable chow main.  Everything was yummy (with the exception of the hot sour soup, lacking in the flavor department)!  None of the dishes were greasy,  all the ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies, and the portions were generous.  My meat loving, i hate organic and vegan anything bf really liked the meatless chicken general tsao.  He couldn't tell it wasn't real chicken! 

Delivery was fast.  They pack their food in compostable containers(way to be green YYH). Yum Yum Hunan is my go to place now for Chinese delivery.

excerpts: Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.
Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.
mongolian beef.author: Megan J.
mongolian beef.review:
We are new to the Pac Hts neighborhood so I jumped on Yelp to figure out where to grab bomb Chinese food.  Yum Yum came highly recommended from the majority of Yelpers and STILL managed to exceed our expectations. The prices are surprisingly reasonable and the food is insanely flavorful and fresh.  Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.  Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.  Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!) and Yum Yum just added 4 devotees to their customer base. 

The service was also uber-friendly.  Since we placed our order during a World Series game (aka they were slammed with orders), they suggested that we pick up in 15 minutes rather than wait the 45-60 mins for delivery.  And, then, when we arrived at the restaurant, thanked us profusely for making the effort to come to them.

excerpts: I ordered Mongolian beef which comes with soup of the day, salad, rice, and an egg roll.
All for $7!!!!
All was very tasty and I couldn't even finish it.
Awesome deal, the only thing is is that make sure you have cash.
$10 minimum for credit cards.
Ill definitely be back here.
P.S.
If you are having lunch by yourself
like I did, they do have a TV you can watch.
mongolian beef.author: Lana K.
mongolian beef.review:
Yum Yum is right! My coworkers have been telling me to go and I thought it was one of those buffett places but I was wrong! I walked in, seated right away. It's a nice place with white table cloths. I ordered Mongolian beef which comes with soup of the day, salad, rice, and an egg roll. All for $7!!!! All was very tasty and I couldn't even finish it.
Awesome deal, the only thing is is that make sure you have cash. $10 minimum for credit cards. 
Ill definitely be back here.
P.S. If you are having lunch by yourself like I did, they do have a TV you can watch.
:)

excerpts: Him: Mongolian beef.
We also split an order of vegetable egg rolls.
mongolian beef.author: Liz S.
mongolian beef.review:
My husband are in town to hang out with a family member who is recovering from surgery at the Kaiser hospital a few blocks away. Of course, I don't want hospital food, so I turn to Yelp to guide me to the best in local cuisine.

Being close to the Chinese New Year, I looked for Chinese food and find wonderful reviews for Yum Yum Hunan. Could there really be THIS MANY good reviews? Yes, there are. 

Thank you to whomever said this place was "clean," and used "fresh vegetables." These are always key terms for me deciding where to go when it comes to Chinese food.

After walking just a few blocks (in the rain, no less) we find Yum Yum's--which is a cute, well decorated, modern-looking establishment. Sitting just a food tables away was an employee shelling peas from pods in the main room. Immediately I was sold on this place.

My husband and I both ordered lunch specials. Me: sweet and sour chicken. Him: Mongolian beef. We also split an order of vegetable egg rolls. Hot tea was complimentary, and the ice water was slightly lemon flavored.

Here's what sold me on this place for a 4-star review...

You know when you order an appetizer for two people, but it comes served in an odd number (in our case, three egg rolls for two people)? It is always weird when you get down to remaining rolls. "Oh, you can have it." "No, you have it!" "No you, I insist!"

Whether this was on purpose or not, I don't know, but the Yum Yum staff cut our egg rolls in half--essentially leaving us with six mini-egg rolls. This was perfect for the two of us to share.

Score!

excerpts:
What we ordered:
Pork Pot Stickers
Hot & Sour Soup
Mongolian Beef
Walnut Shrimp
Chicken Chow Mein (free since I ordered 2 entrees!)

Mongolian Beef - spicy and tasty

Walnut Shrimp - delicious - fried and the sauce was perfect!

Chicken Chow Mein
mongolian beef.author: Janine L.
mongolian beef.review:
Yum Yum Hunan is Chinese American food delivery, moderate grease. I think we received our food within 30 min.

What we ordered:
Pork Pot Stickers
Hot & Sour Soup
Mongolian Beef
Walnut Shrimp
Chicken Chow Mein (free since I ordered 2 entrees!)

Pot Stickers - tasty - not the best I have had, but not the worst. Good ratio of meat to wrapper. Wrapper was not too thick.

Hot & Sour Soup - meh. but nourishing.

Mongolian Beef - spicy and tasty

Walnut Shrimp - delicious - fried and the sauce was perfect!

Chicken Chow Mein - I love noodles and these were free, am a fan

Looking forward to the leftovers for dinner tonight!

excerpts: Our staple:  Everything fried rice (w/out shrimp), Mongolian Beef, and Chicken Chow Fun.
Enough for dinner  for 2 and lunch the next day.
mongolian beef.author: Alexis M.
mongolian beef.review:
Prompt, yummy, and you can understand what they say over the phone!

Never actually been, but when in need of a Chinese food fix, Yum Yum is who we call.

Our staple:  Everything fried rice (w/out shrimp), Mongolian Beef, and Chicken Chow Fun.    Enough for dinner  for 2 and lunch the next day.

excerpts: You may have changed your name and address but your Mongolian beef is still fantastic and the five flavored chicken, wow...
I have no idea what the five flavors are
mongolian beef.author: Alex S.
mongolian beef.review:
Yum Yum is back! I was afraid I'd lost you forever! That day when I found out you were no longer open at your Valencia St. location, I felt truly alone for the first time. I didn't know what I would do. And then a miracle happened. As I walked past your window on Divisadero and saw that familiar Yum Yum name, I felt a my skin start tingling with anxious anticipation. I opened the door and there you all were, the wonderful staff of Yum Yum House. You may have changed your name and address but your Mongolian beef is still fantastic and the five flavored chicken, wow... I have no idea what the five flavors are but they sure are good! 

4 stars for the food, 1 star lost for the service.

excerpts: The mongolian beef was not good - overcooked and poor quality beef.
mongolian beef.author: Evan M.
mongolian beef.review:
Pretty good not great.  Delivery was relatively quick - 40 minutes into the presidio.  Food was a mixed bag.  The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.  The mongolian beef was not good - overcooked and poor quality beef.  Won ton soup also good.

I might try this again but will look for other places in the neighborhood to try first.

excerpts: AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB).
Enjoy! -
We always Do!
Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.
mongolian beef.author: Tara M.
mongolian beef.review: This is our GO-TO Chinese food spot. Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice. AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB). Enjoy! - We always Do! Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.

excerpts: I also tried the Mongolian Beef and Pot Stickers to get a feel for it.
The Mongolian Beef didn't have much of the rice noodles that come as a filler, which is a good thing.
mongolian beef.author: Michael M.
mongolian beef.review:
Two of the best possible combinations ... Kung Pao, and Fried Rice can be had here. 

I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much. So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum. They deliver too, which was another reason to try. I also tried the Mongolian Beef and Pot Stickers to get a feel for it. I had plenty for lunch the next day. 

The Pot Stickers were OK, and not filled very much with pork and cabbage goodness, but the sauce that came with it, was very good. The Mongolian Beef didn't have much of the rice noodles that come as a filler, which is a good thing. It was spicy, and not too full of green onions which I have a hard time chewing. 

The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good. You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish. You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable. Try it! It's not as spicy as it could be, but throw in some chile sauce if you want.

Delivery was quick. I think I'll order Kung Pao Beef this time!

excerpts: I had their Mongolian beef lunch special.
It came w/
an eggroll, nothing special, a hot n sour soup, bleh...
yuk...patuwee!
The beef was alright.
I like the fact that you have the option of brown or white rice; the brown rice needed more water.
I'd give the beef 3 stars, but overall it's a 2.
Extra credit:
Whenever the guy answers the phone, it sounds like he was hoping that it was "Yum Yum" on the other end, "Hello...
Yum Yum?
"  Lol.
mongolian beef.author: Jay M.
mongolian beef.review:
My 1st time...I had their Mongolian beef lunch special. It came w/ an eggroll, nothing special, a hot n sour soup, bleh... yuk...patuwee! The beef was alright. I like the fact that you have the option of brown or white rice; the brown rice needed more water. I'd give the beef 3 stars, but overall it's a 2.
Extra credit:
Whenever the guy answers the phone, it sounds like he was hoping that it was "Yum Yum" on the other end, "Hello...Yum Yum?"  Lol.

excerpts: I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken.
Both entrees are in the trash.
I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.
mongolian beef.author: Allison S.
mongolian beef.review: I ordered from Yum Yum tonight for delivery. I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken. Both entrees are in the trash. I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.  Even the chicken fried rice was bad - the chicken was chewy and again, I had to spit it out. I will not be ordering from here again.

excerpts: Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice.
All of it was amazing.
I want to come back and try more of their menu.
mongolian beef.author: Bobby P.
mongolian beef.review:
Finally, I try somewhere I have had bookmarked forever. I would like to Holla at Rita C. for suggesting this place weeks ago. I wish I would have heeded her advice earlier because this place is really good. 

The food was yum, yum and then some. And on top of that it was Hunan. The name really does sum the place up. I went with a friend after happy hour at Fishbowl and we couldn't have been happier. We ordered the appetizer platter that came with pot stickers, egg rolls, crab ragoon, and some shrimp thing. We also got sesame chicken, Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice. All of it was amazing. I want to come back and try more of their menu. It was so damn good. 

Yum Yum is up there on my list of favorite Chinese places for sure. Thanks Rita!

excerpts: Mongolian beef and szechuan broccoli were yum!
mongolian beef.author: Jessica P.
mongolian beef.review: Good lunch spot. I love that their food comes out piping hot. Mongolian beef and szechuan broccoli were yum!

excerpts: The mongolian beef was decent, though.
Big portions, timely service, decent prices.
But what I really like about this place is how nice the people are!
I visited this restaurant with a huge group of people:
13ish, maybe?
That's much more than they have room for [without splitting us up.]
But it was maybe 5pm-ish, so before any dinner rush, and the place was pretty empty.
They actually rearranged the tables and allowed us to squeeze as many chairs in as we wanted.
And then they carried out as many sets of dishes/chopsticks as we needed, patiently waited for all of us to decide what to order, and took our orders without missing a single one.
The staff was very courteous and pleasant the whole time, even with a crowd of teenagers who ended up paying the bill with a stack of rumpled bills.
I definitely think this is a good place to return to!
mongolian beef.author: Delia Z.
mongolian beef.review:
I only tasted one dish, so I can't really judge the food overall. The mongolian beef was decent, though. 
Big portions, timely service, decent prices. 
But what I really like about this place is how nice the people are! I visited this restaurant with a huge group of people: 13ish, maybe? That's much more than they have room for [without splitting us up.] But it was maybe 5pm-ish, so before any dinner rush, and the place was pretty empty. They actually rearranged the tables and allowed us to squeeze as many chairs in as we wanted. And then they carried out as many sets of dishes/chopsticks as we needed, patiently waited for all of us to decide what to order, and took our orders without missing a single one. The staff was very courteous and pleasant the whole time, even with a crowd of teenagers who ended up paying the bill with a stack of rumpled bills. I definitely think this is a good place to return to!

excerpts: I always order the Mongolian beef (which has a bit of a kick to it), Sweet and sour chicken, and wonton soup.
Don't waste your time with the pot stickers or the crab rangoons.
mongolian beef.author: Jenee Y.
mongolian beef.review: This is my go-to Chinese Food restaurant. I usually order for delivery and my food always arrives hot and in a timely fashion. The prices are very decent and the dishes are never too greasy like most local Chinese food restaurants. I always order the Mongolian beef (which has a bit of a kick to it), Sweet and sour chicken, and wonton soup. Don't waste your time with the pot stickers or the crab rangoons.

excerpts: The mongolian beef is the second best I have ever had.
Probably the best chinese food I have had in the city.
mongolian beef.author: Darius A.
mongolian beef.review: This place is freakin delicious. I went here a few years ago, it was delicious, but I forgot about them. 2 weeks ago I was at a job site in Pacific Heights and was craving chinese. I used the Yelp app and searched chinese and this place was the closest. I called, placed my order and within 5 minutes it was ready. The mongolian beef is the second best I have ever had. Probably the best chinese food I have had in the city.

excerpts: lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.
mongolian beef.author: Laura M.
mongolian beef.review: still my favorite chinese delivery in sf... lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.  my favorite is the garlic eggplant. fast delivery

excerpts: Mongolian beef, semi spicy and tender too.
mongolian beef.author: Katherine B.
mongolian beef.review: Overall the food was tasty- but pretty standard Chinese food. We live kind of far away and they delivered, which was pretty cool. I would say that we'd order again. We ordered hot n sour soup, which was delicious, the sweet and sour chicken was OK, not too saucy. There was a good amount of food and veggies as well! :) Mongolian beef, semi spicy and tender too.

excerpts: We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight.
Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea.
A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.
mongolian beef.author: Brandi W.
mongolian beef.review: Exceptional. Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, excellent dishes. We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight. Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea. A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: and I wanted some more chili pepper to add spice to my Mongolian beef which was really good except for a bit to much black pepper.
I settled for the sugar and sweet/sour sauce because I didn't want to be a bother
but I really wish they would have asked if I needed anything else.
I started feeling like I was on some conveyor belt.
mongolian beef.author: Kalifornia S.
mongolian beef.review:
I walked in and the place was very clean and quaint. Before I had a chance to order, tea and soup were placed in front of me and once I ordered, my lunch was there with in 5 minutes. Very quick place to grab food and it was very cheep. My dish came with rice, a small salad and an egg roll all for under 7 dollars which included the tea and soup. 

The only issues I had is the initial waiter forgot to bring me water and sugar for my tea. And it made me feel even more uncomfortable when they didn't bring it because by then I wanted some sweet/sour sauce and mustard with my egg roll and I wanted some more chili pepper to add spice to my Mongolian beef which was really good except for a bit to much black pepper. I settled for the sugar and sweet/sour sauce because I didn't want to be a bother but I really wish they would have asked if I needed anything else. I started feeling like I was on some conveyor belt.

excerpts: The mongolian beef is to die for!
mongolian beef.author: Rod A.
mongolian beef.review:
I think there is like only 3 chinese restaurants on Divisadero St and since we(I) didn't want to lose my parking spot, we walked the 7 blocks to Yum Yum in the awful rain.
The place is pleasantly well light with a decent modern decor(for a chinese restaurant).
Hunan cuisine is spicy hot. Think Brandy Ho.

The mongolian beef is to die for! 

Definitely will come back again, might even try the take-out option as it seems to be very popular!

excerpts: I ordered the Mongolian beef, my friend ordered the garlic prawns.
Everything was so good.
But the prawns came out late, when we were already finished with the Mongolian beef dish!
If you're patient, then go for it!
mongolian beef.author: Lady E.
mongolian beef.review: The lunch specials are great deals! The food here is so delicious too! I ordered the Mongolian beef, my friend ordered the garlic prawns. Everything was so good. But the prawns came out late, when we were already finished with the Mongolian beef dish! If you're patient, then go for it!

excerpts: i ordered Mongolian Beef Lunch Special, way too much pepper, and MSG!
I can normally tolerate MSG, but here my jaw stiffened and i started getting chest pains.
Luckily i stopped and after drinking lots of water
i was ok.
If you eat here, dont eat the mongolian beef and check that the amount on your credit card is correct.
mongolian beef.author: Shane J.
mongolian beef.review:
We ate here the other day and it was a bad experience. 

i ordered Mongolian Beef Lunch Special, way too much pepper, and MSG! I can normally tolerate MSG, but here my jaw stiffened and i started getting chest pains. Luckily i stopped and after drinking lots of water i was ok.  I think you can not see the MSG, but I could see the extreme amount of pepper in the beef. 

Today when looking at our credit card account online, we found that they added money on our credit card. They charged us more than we approved. We feel that we gave a good tip (30%) and no business should overcharge on people's credit cards. 

If you eat here, dont eat the mongolian beef and check that the amount on your credit card is correct.

excerpts: Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef.
You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices.
Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.
mongolian beef.author: Jerry C.
mongolian beef.review: This place is very close to where I work at, UCSF, so it's a common place for all my co workers and I to head out to for a quick lunch of good solid chinese food. For about 6  bucks, you get an entree, with your choice of white rice, fried rice OR brown rice. I love that they have brown rice, and it doens't come at an extra cost either. Maybe they know that there are serveral hospitals in the area, and they smartly want to cater to the health conscoius crowd. Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef. You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices. Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.

excerpts: I was home sick and the only thing I thought would make me better was some wonton soup and mongolian beef.
The soup was perfect and soothing, and the mongolian beef fresh and exactly what I wanted.
The guy was mean.. but I will put up with it to get the food.
mongolian beef.author: Sam A.
mongolian beef.review:
I created a Yelp account, JUST so I could write a review about this place. The guy on the phone was sooo mean! I was home sick and the only thing I thought would make me better was some wonton soup and mongolian beef.

The soup was perfect and soothing, and the mongolian beef fresh and exactly what I wanted. The guy was mean.. but I will put up with it to get the food.

excerpts: Awesome---I really like the pork pot stickers, the Spicy Mandarin eggplant, and the Mongolian Beef
mongolian beef.author: Raman R.
mongolian beef.review: Awesome---I really like the pork pot stickers, the Spicy Mandarin eggplant, and the Mongolian Beef

excerpts: We got the broccoli beef ($11) which had this addicting, delicious sauce.
broccoli beef.author: Linda X.
broccoli beef.review:
I was craving Chinese food and this place really hit the spot. The prices aren't cheap like in Chinatown but the service was great and the serving sizes were super generous. The restaurant is nice and clean too.

We got the broccoli beef ($11) which had this addicting, delicious sauce. The garlic eggplant ($10) had great texture and strong garlic flavor. I loved it. The beef fried rice ($9) was the perfect comfort food. It's all pretty salty though so make sure to drink plenty of tea or water.

I definitely enjoyed my meal. Huge plus that they were extremely quick with getting the food to our table. We had barely just ordered and already had the food in front of us!

excerpts: For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein
I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that.
The food was serviceable.
broccoli beef.author: Marty J.
broccoli beef.review:
I ordered delivery from here through Eat24.com last night. It was nice to see some comments mostly mixed about the food. For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein but it came as pork.

The food was filling. Pretty greasy. I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that. The food was serviceable. I'd probably order from here again.

I like that they are not the standard take out boxes and they are plastic with a lid so they are easy to refrigerate. It came with 2 soy sauce packets and 2 fortune cookies. My girlfriend got the cookie with no fortune in it. LOL.

excerpts: We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids.
broccoli beef.author: Alexis M.
broccoli beef.review:
Yum Yum is well...Yum Yum.


We headed here after a show at The Fillmore based on reviews on Yelp.

Very fresh and non greasy. The restaurant was empty but the phone was ringing of the hook and the delivery guys were in and out like crazy. I enjoyed hearing the old man answer the phone, "Hello, Yum Yum".

Everything was wonderful and fresh. When I walked by to use the bathroom I saw them cutting up a ton of fresh zucchini and carrots and onions. Nothing frozen. All super fresh vegetables.

We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids. 

So glad we stumbled upon this gem of a Chinese restaurant. Plus we got to end the night with a tour of Pac Heights with it's beautiful homes all decorated for Christmas.

excerpts: A feast of sweet & sour pork, honey walnut prawns, broccoli beef, chicken chow mein, and steamed rice was at my doorstep less than 1/2 hour after I called.
{Note: you don't need this much food for two people.
I will have leftovers for weeks.
Hilariously, they included 5 fortune cookies, as if to say "no way this is for a couple.
broccoli beef.author: Kelly B.

excerpts: Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.
And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery.
broccoli beef.author: Matthew C.
broccoli beef.review:
Yum Yum's name is a perfect fit. Consistent good quality, fast delivery and great price. 

Possibly the best Chinese delivery we have had. We live in the Inner Richmond and have tried MANY different Chinese restaurants. More than I can recall.
