They do all the traditional dishes, plus many original creations. Try the Lovers Shrimp or the Yum Yum Delicatessen, both winners. Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.

And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery. Makes it easy and less expensive to please the whole family, kids and neighbors.

With so many for-to-go options, it's nice to find one I have no qualms about calling again & again.

Glad we "found" out about Yum Yum. Now you know about them too.

excerpts: I ordered americanized staple food: Chow Mein, Sweet&Sour Chicken, and Broccoli Beef for $24.
I know:
boring, but I wasn't feeling adventurous.
The Chow Mein was excellent and the S&S chicken was actually quite good.
They use large pieces that are heavily fried, but are more meat than dough, which is good.
The broccoli was delish' as well.
broccoli beef.author: T. M. B.
broccoli beef.review:
Ordered take-out from Yum Yum last night.  I called at 930pm and when I got there at 9:45pm, the food was ready to go.  They don't ask for your name or number or anything, but that's OK as they have call-ID, and identify your order using that.  Their restaurant smelled great and the dining atmosphere was very nice.

I ordered americanized staple food: Chow Mein, Sweet&Sour Chicken, and Broccoli Beef for $24.  I know: boring, but I wasn't feeling adventurous.  The Chow Mein was excellent and the S&S chicken was actually quite good.  They use large pieces that are heavily fried, but are more meat than dough, which is good.  The broccoli was delish' as well.  Plenty of food, I'll be eating this for at least 3 meals.

All in all the food was super quick, sorta cheap, hot, and tasty.  Would eat there again.

excerpts: This is our go to neighborhood delivery spot... we admittedly always get the generic Chinese menu options like broccoli beef, garlic chicken and chow mien, but it's reliably yummy and very reasonably priced.
It's a cheaper alternative to Eliza's just a few blocks away, but the food quality reflects the lower price.
Still a good neighborhood Chinese food option though.
broccoli beef.author: Adriana P.
broccoli beef.review: This is our go to neighborhood delivery spot... we admittedly always get the generic Chinese menu options like broccoli beef, garlic chicken and chow mien, but it's reliably yummy and very reasonably priced. It's a cheaper alternative to Eliza's just a few blocks away, but the food quality reflects the lower price. Still a good neighborhood Chinese food option though.

excerpts:
Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise!
The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.
orange beef.author: Valeria R.
orange beef.review:
Until this past Friday, in my almost 15 years here I had never found a Chinese delivery place that I would try again. So, basically, all this time I've been ordering once from here, once from there, etc. If only Hunan Homes delivered...that would have solved my problem a long time ago.

But, recently, my BFF started raving about Yum Yum Hunan. I checked out my fellow Yelpers' reviews and Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise! When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein. Nice! Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.

The food arrived, nice and hot, in about 30 minutes. The wontons blew me away...they were simply amazing. Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.

The chow mein was simple and satisfying.

The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.

The walnut prawns, again, weren't as good as Hunan Homes', but I would order them again. They give you a baker's dozen, by the way.

I expected the prawns to come on the usual bed of shredded lettuce, but the beef was served that way as well, which I don't care for because it reheats horribly. Next time I'll ask them to leave out the lettuce on everything so that I don't have to pick it off.

So, all told, for about $30 including tip, I got almost 5 meals. Yum Yum, indeed, and economical! Friendly service too.

Yum Yum is going on the speed-dial for sure!

P.S. I swear I didn't eat all 5 of those meals in one night.

excerpts: Love the Mongolian Lamb, orange chicken and sesame beef.
sesame beef.author: Dennis M.
sesame beef.review: Love this place. Food is always very flavorful and delivery to my place is fast (about 20min). Love the Mongolian Lamb, orange chicken and sesame beef.

excerpts: i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.
sesame beef.author: Roshni R.
sesame beef.review:
i wasn't a fan of hunan china at all.  in fact, my co-worker and i used to refer to it as "dirty chinese" as opposed to "clean chinese" which is eliza's around the corner.

what a delight when yum yum replaced hunan china.  the food is just as cheap but infinitely better.  i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.  some of my co-workers swear by the string bean salmon.

the lunch special, for most items, is a mere $6 including tax for an entree, rice (white or brown), soup, and an appetizer of their selection.  great lunch spot if you work in the neighborhood.

excerpts: The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables.
mu shu pork.author: Lisa K.
mu shu pork.review:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.

excerpts: + Mu Shu Pork - Solid.
mu shu pork.author: Talia G.
mu shu pork.review:
They changed their deal. I'm so sad. Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

Still...$34 for 4 entrees isn't bad:
+ General Tsao Chicken - Decent. Not at all spicy though.
+ Mango Broccoli Prawn - My favorite. Going to order it every time.
+ Mu Shu Pork - Solid.
+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!

Yum Yum, I may be a bit put off by your policy change, but your delivery is still speedy and you still taste delicious, so I will forgive and forget.

excerpts: Food was good, especially the mu shu pork.
It  arrived when they said it would and was really affordable.
It was really hot temperature wise which is not always the case with delivery
so that was impressive.
HUGE portions.
I had 2 medium sized portions and I had only made a small dent in the container.
Dishes do not come in standard folded boxes, they come in full huge square containers.
Would definitely recommend!
mu shu pork.author: Deja B.
mu shu pork.review: FAST, PIPING HOT DELIVERY! First time here. Food was good, especially the mu shu pork. It  arrived when they said it would and was really affordable.  It was really hot temperature wise which is not always the case with delivery so that was impressive. HUGE portions. I had 2 medium sized portions and I had only made a small dent in the container. Dishes do not come in standard folded boxes, they come in full huge square containers. Would definitely recommend!

excerpts: bf got mu shu pork and he said it was ok.
mu shu pork.author: Josie M.
mu shu pork.review:
i wanted to like this place because when we picked up our takeout, i peeked inside and the restaurant looked unusually clean and bright.

all i got was the crab meat rangoons, and they were BLECH!  way too much pepper and tasted old.  i ate around the cheese and consumed the fried won ton skin

but it was no use!  i got a horrible stomach ache anyway! 

bf got mu shu pork and he said it was ok.

excerpts: Got the sweet and sour pork, a side of rice and the chicken chow mein to share with a friend
and it's more than enough food for the both of us.
sweet and sour pork.author: Sierra S.
sweet and sour pork.review: Great food at a decent price. Got the sweet and sour pork, a side of rice and the chicken chow mein to share with a friend and it's more than enough food for the both of us.

excerpts: I got green onion pancakes, a small container of hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork with rice, and two cans of 7-Up for around $17.
sweet and sour pork.author: Annette E.
sweet and sour pork.review:
Had this delivered today and I thought it was great!  They have a good variety of menu items and have some good lunch deals.  I got green onion pancakes, a small container of hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork with rice, and two cans of 7-Up for around $17.

I was in need of some food to help out my hangover after a day of drinking at SantaCon yesterday, and this definitely did the trick.  Will be ordering from here again.

excerpts: We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids.
sweet and sour pork.author: Alexis M.
sweet and sour pork.review:
Yum Yum is well...Yum Yum.


We headed here after a show at The Fillmore based on reviews on Yelp.

Very fresh and non greasy. The restaurant was empty but the phone was ringing of the hook and the delivery guys were in and out like crazy. I enjoyed hearing the old man answer the phone, "Hello, Yum Yum".

Everything was wonderful and fresh. When I walked by to use the bathroom I saw them cutting up a ton of fresh zucchini and carrots and onions. Nothing frozen. All super fresh vegetables.

We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids. 

So glad we stumbled upon this gem of a Chinese restaurant. Plus we got to end the night with a tour of Pac Heights with it's beautiful homes all decorated for Christmas.

excerpts:
Beef and broccoli, sweet and sour pork
Avoid:
Hot and sour soup
Must do:
sweet and sour pork.author: Brian L.
sweet and sour pork.review:
My favorite go-to delivery/take-out Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Delivery is free and pretty fast. The food satisfies every time. They do the standard dishes well. The best part about ordering from Yum Yum is when you call and they answer - "HELLO!! YUM YUM!!!"

Our favorites: Beef and broccoli, sweet and sour pork
Avoid: Hot and sour soup
Must do: Order 3 (used to be 2) entrees and get a free chow main or fried rice. Only available for delivery orders

excerpts: Love the ribs, pork fried rice, Royal pork is great as well.
Deep fried prawns, egg rolls!
These guys are faster if you call them instead of using some delivery app...
royal pork.author: Kirk M.
royal pork.review: Great delivery from these guys! Love the ribs, pork fried rice, Royal pork is great as well. Deep fried prawns, egg rolls! These guys are faster if you call them instead of using some delivery app...

excerpts: I have had their Mongolian Beef (spicy!) and their Garlic Pork (holy deliciousness batman!) and their Hot and Sour Soup (ok, needs more sour).
garlic pork.author: Kathy K.
garlic pork.review:
Does the fact that I have gone here once a week for the last few weeks say anything?

I LOVE their honey walnut prawns. SO delicious and they give you at least a dozen which is more than I can say for some *ahem* places where they charge you more and give you 5 prawns thinking they are doing you a favor.

I have had their Mongolian Beef (spicy!) and their Garlic Pork (holy deliciousness batman!) and their Hot and Sour Soup (ok, needs more sour).

But this place is clean, service is friendly and it is cheap.

I haven't done their delivery (I live a few blocks away but I have pizza delivered from 3 blocks away so go ahead judge me) but I hear it is quick and friendly from my neighbors.

Happy to find a local place to fulfill my Chinese food cravings!

excerpts: I called them up, and ordered the garlic pork, beef Hong Kong style noodles, steamed rice and some hot and sour soup.
Quoted a 45 minute delivery time, and a price around $20 bucks.
The dishes - particularly the garlic pork, were chock full of fresh veggies, while still having plentiful amounts of meat,
And the last +1 goes to the taste and overall quality.
The Hong Kong noodles were slightly crispy, with a bit of sauce getting them to just the right consistency.
garlic pork.author: Jonathan M.
garlic pork.review:
I don't know what it is about me and writing reviews of restaurants with "Yum Yum" in their names, but hey...

So it is Chinese New Year, and I didn't even have that cross my mind prior to putting in my order at YYH. I called them up, and ordered the garlic pork, beef Hong Kong style noodles, steamed rice and some hot and sour soup. Quoted a 45 minute delivery time, and a price around $20 bucks. So far so good.

The food was here in about 30 minutes, +1. The portions were ridonculoid huge, +1. The dishes - particularly the garlic pork, were chock full of fresh veggies, while still having plentiful amounts of meat,  +1. And the last +1 goes to the taste and overall quality. The Hong Kong noodles were slightly crispy, with a bit of sauce getting them to just the right consistency. Everything tasted great, and the quantities were large enough to stock up the fridge for some lunch time action tomorrow. 

Yum Yum Hunan is my new go-to for delivery in the Western Addition. Would recommend - and the delivery minimums / credit card minimums are really reasonable - $15 and $10, respectively.

excerpts: Walnut shrimp, garlic pork, hongkong style chow mein was tasty and traditional.
garlic pork.author: J K.
garlic pork.review:
Smaller place with friendly staff. We were the only ones in the place so cooks came out to watch the NBA playoffs with us lol! Walnut shrimp, garlic pork, hongkong style chow mein was tasty and traditional. Soup was below satisfactory.

Pricing $7-10 per dish for dinner. Standard Chinese delivery, good value for the price.

excerpts: I always order the basil chicken white meat
but I also have had most of all the other entrees.
basil chicken.author: Pam P.
basil chicken.review: Steve and his crew are awesome.  I always order the basil chicken white meat but I also have had most of all the other entrees.  The Kung poa fried rice is delicious and they can make it as hot as you like.  I have good to this place since Valencia street and it's still Great!!! Gets crowded during lunchtime.

excerpts: We had the Sun Flower Chicken and Basil Chicken, both of which were quite good.
The chicken was VERY tender.
The hot and sour soup was much better than most others I've had: nice and peppery (but not too hot), not turned into jello with cornstarch, and had some delicious little mushrooms (enoki I think).
The potstickers were good, not great, but hey, they're potstickers.
Over all, very reasonably priced, clean, good atmosphere, and good service too.
basil chicken.author: John M.
basil chicken.review: Definitely one of the better Chinese restaurants that I've been to in San Francisco. We had the Sun Flower Chicken and Basil Chicken, both of which were quite good. The chicken was VERY tender. The hot and sour soup was much better than most others I've had: nice and peppery (but not too hot), not turned into jello with cornstarch, and had some delicious little mushrooms (enoki I think). The potstickers were good, not great, but hey, they're potstickers. Over all, very reasonably priced, clean, good atmosphere, and good service too.

excerpts: My friend ordered Garlic Chicken.
They both came with an egg roll - it was very reminiscent of generic Chinese food from home, but altogether, a nice place to eat.
garlic chicken.author: Edwin M.
garlic chicken.review:
Very good - perfect grease factor. 

The service was average, and the pricing was a little higher than average, but hey, it's Pac Heights, what are you going to do?

I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken. My friend ordered Garlic Chicken. They both came with an egg roll - it was very reminiscent of generic Chinese food from home, but altogether, a nice place to eat.

excerpts: We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.
Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.
Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.
They were also a little on the greasy side.
I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.
Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.
garlic chicken.author: Erin H.
garlic chicken.review:
Friday night.  Hungry. Lazy.  Needed a little help from Yelp to get me some Chinese delivery.

Staff was courteous on the phone & our order was delivered quickly.  For the price, we were surprised at the amount of food we had.  Things were looking good...

The food was edible, but not good by any means.  We had the crab rangoon which was good, not the best I've had but okay.  We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.  Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.  Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.  They were also a little on the greasy side.  I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.  Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.

excerpts: Got the Garlic Chicken lunch special.
Hot and Sour soup was good, though not the best I've ever had.
Came with some fried won tons (no meat) which were nice, though a bit salty.
Sauce was very good and nice amount and quality of chicken.
Vegetables consisted of zucchini, red onion, green onion, and mushrooms (which I would ask to leave off next time.)
Place is very clean, water refill service was attentive, service fast, nice classy square plates.
Fairly uncrowded at 11:30 on a Wednesday.
I would return to try some of their other items.
Good fortune cookie and nice toothpick quality.
garlic chicken.author: Marc S.
garlic chicken.review: Got the Garlic Chicken lunch special.  Hot and Sour soup was good, though not the best I've ever had.  Came with some fried won tons (no meat) which were nice, though a bit salty.  Sauce was very good and nice amount and quality of chicken.  Vegetables consisted of zucchini, red onion, green onion, and mushrooms (which I would ask to leave off next time.)  Place is very clean, water refill service was attentive, service fast, nice classy square plates.  Fairly uncrowded at 11:30 on a Wednesday.  I would return to try some of their other items.  Good fortune cookie and nice toothpick quality.

excerpts: I ordered the "Garlic Chicken."
My girlfriend ordered the "Beef with Tofu.
I really liked my Garlic Chicken.
The chicken itself was pretty good.
The thing I liked MOST was the fact that the Garlic Chicken came with fresh vegetables.
garlic chicken.author: Ben W.
garlic chicken.review:
"07/19/08 (Saturday):

YUM YUM YUMMY get in my tummy!  

I ordered the "Garlic Chicken."  My girlfriend ordered the "Beef with Tofu."  Both were lunch specials, which was great especially since it was a Saturday.

We both got complimentary hot-and-sour soup to start off the meals.  They were okay.  I thought the soup was a little watered down, but it surprisingly was still spicy.

When our meals came out, we each had a full plate that came with a side of rice, egg roll, side salad and our main entree.

I really liked my Garlic Chicken.  The chicken itself was pretty good.  The thing I liked MOST was the fact that the Garlic Chicken came with fresh vegetables.  

Let me emphasize the fresh vegetables.  These weren't your pre-packaged, frozen, perfectly cut vegetables.  These were definitely freshly cut and cooked today.  It included green onions, mushrooms, zucchini and carrots.  It was a very colorful meal.  I actually came here on Friday too for my first time and ordered their "Cashew Chicken."  Their Cashew Chicken was just as good, but also came with heads of broccoli mixed in as part of the vegetables.

Totally enjoyable meal.  My girlfriend liked her Beef with Tofu, but couldn't finish it so brought the leftovers home.  Honestly, the portions are very large.

Best part...the price.  With tax, each entree came out to $6 even.  So lunch for the both of us today came out to be an even $12.

Amazing.  I will definitely be back for lunch again soon.

Positives:
1.  Lunch specials (even on Saturday)
2.  Large Portions
3.  Fresh vegetables in meal
4.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating
5.  Interior is decorated well and appears very clean
6.  They deliver

Negatives:
To be honest, I can't think of any as of now.  If I find some later, I'll update this, but so far so good.

excerpts: I ordered the garlic chicken w/ brown rice lunch combo and a side of egg rolls.
Silly me, I didn't think I'd be able to finish it all in one sitting.
I did.
Oh!
I DID bring the soup home....which I promptly inhaled in 2 minutes.
The garlic chicken was really good and mixed in w/
it were onions and zucchini.
The egg rolls were killer and again the soup was amazing.
Can't wait to eat here again!
garlic chicken.author: Andrea B.
garlic chicken.review: Again, I owe this review to my co-worker.  She came into work yesterday with this box that was just oozing this wonderful aroma.  She opened her box and the food practically exploded onto her desk, like it was trying to escape the box.  Wide-eyed, I wheeled my chair over to her and never making eye contact w/ her but molesting her food w/ my eyes, asked her where she got her food from.  She told me about this place and I was even more impressed that they had brown rice.  She ordered off of their lunch menu and I was really amazed at the amount of food she had for a relatively decent price ($7).  A sweet and sour wonton like soup w/ tofu is included with every lunch.  She gave the soup to me because she knew she wouldn't be able to eat everything.  This soup was so so so good.  I don't even like tofu.  Usually tastes like marinated sponge, but this was really good.  I proceeded to eat her leftovers because I'm a pig like that, and lo and behold, more tofu!  Apparently she got the veggie combo.  Again, the tofu was really really good.  Everything was really well seasoned.  I found myself even drooling over their fried wonton crisps.  I decided to go there today since I was craving it.  I probably only waited 5 minutes for my food to come out.  I ordered the garlic chicken w/ brown rice lunch combo and a side of egg rolls.  Silly me, I didn't think I'd be able to finish it all in one sitting.  I did.  Oh!  I DID bring the soup home....which I promptly inhaled in 2 minutes.  The garlic chicken was really good and mixed in w/ it were onions and zucchini.  The egg rolls were killer and again the soup was amazing.  Can't wait to eat here again!

excerpts: This is our go to neighborhood delivery spot... we admittedly always get the generic Chinese menu options like broccoli beef, garlic chicken and chow mien, but it's reliably yummy and very reasonably priced.
It's a cheaper alternative to Eliza's just a few blocks away, but the food quality reflects the lower price.
Still a good neighborhood Chinese food option though.
garlic chicken.author: Adriana P.
garlic chicken.review: This is our go to neighborhood delivery spot... we admittedly always get the generic Chinese menu options like broccoli beef, garlic chicken and chow mien, but it's reliably yummy and very reasonably priced. It's a cheaper alternative to Eliza's just a few blocks away, but the food quality reflects the lower price. Still a good neighborhood Chinese food option though.

excerpts: The garlic chicken, however, was rather bland, though it did have fresh vegetables, as someone else pointed out.
All in all, I'll probably be ordering from them often.
garlic chicken.author: Michael G.
garlic chicken.review: This is surprisingly decent Chinese delivery food. While it's not the best in SF, this place earns props due to the overall experience. The guy was extremely friendly and efficient on the phone. He even told me that the rice was free after I declined it. They also happily take credit cards. I didn't even have to ask. The food arrived in less than twenty minutes. The hot and sour soup hit the spot, and the salt and pepper chicken wings weren't too bad. The garlic chicken, however, was rather bland, though it did have fresh vegetables, as someone else pointed out. All in all, I'll probably be ordering from them often.

excerpts: Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms.
kung pao chicken.author: Lilian C.
kung pao chicken.review:
I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice). 

Delivery time was fast!

We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice! Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms. The Chow Fun was O.K. It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts). Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork... I would've chosen a different meat if I knew.

Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!

excerpts: My Kung Pao chicken however was really tasty.
Fortune cookies were stale.
kung pao chicken.author: Christy B.
kung pao chicken.review: Ordered delivery today. Food was good, but found an egg shel the size of a quarter in the veggie fried rice. Also none of the dishes come with white rice? Glad we ordered a separate fried Rice or we wouldn't have had rice for our entrees. The orange chicken wasn't good, soft sponges texture.  My Kung Pao chicken however was really tasty. Fortune cookies were stale.

excerpts: I got the kung pao chicken lunch and some other things and was very excited because the reviews on here are great.
The food came quickly which was nice but that the only good thing.
My kung pao lunch had a nasty hair in it (see picture).
kung pao chicken.author: dr r.
kung pao chicken.review:
Fast delivery but tasteless food with hair in it. Gross. 

I got the kung pao chicken lunch and some other things and was very excited because the reviews on here are great. The food came quickly which was nice but that the only good thing. My kung pao lunch had a nasty hair in it (see picture). Yuck!

I did not try anything else. Kudos to eat24 who rock and gave me a full refund. Never again yum yum. No way.

excerpts: some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers.
kung pao chicken.author: Connie S.
kung pao chicken.review:
this place is appropriately named because their food is yum yum. the ingredients taste fresher and look higher quality than comparable chinese delivery restaurants. the guy who answers the phone is always super friendly and very accommodating of my hatred of bell peppers. and they deliver to my house even though i live fairly far away. what's not to love?!

some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers. bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.

yum yum, enjoy!

excerpts: We got the kung pao chicken, the dish where you get 2 kinds of prawns (the walnut and the other kind), and basil beef if i'm not mistaken.
kung pao chicken.author: Inez J.
kung pao chicken.review:
At first I was skeptical reading the reviews from yelp because it was coming from a majority of white people but I decided to give it a try because it has good reviews. When I came in, there were only white people. Sorry, not being racist or anything, but it's a known fact that a restaurant is good when it's crowded with its own kind of people.

We got the kung pao chicken, the dish where you get 2 kinds of prawns (the walnut and the other kind), and basil beef if i'm not mistaken. Everything was good and very tasty like how a hunan dishes are supposed to be.

I'm giving a 4 star because the girl didn't hear that we ordered a lunch menu, she brought out the dinner dish. Will be coming back again if we're around the area.

excerpts: The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.
kung pao chicken.author: Le T.
kung pao chicken.review:
I came here twice. The first time, the food was pretty bland. I got the spare ribs, chicken wings, and mongolian beef.  While the food was edible, it wasn't very spectacular. 

The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.  This time, the food was surprisingly tasty. 

I suggest going around lunch time to get the lunch special.  Otherwise, the dinner prices can add up especially if you order a rice dish and a meat dish and a vegetable dish.

excerpts: Kung pao chicken, specifically, is the worst I've ever had.
Borderline spoiled food.
kung pao chicken.author: jameson s.
kung pao chicken.review: Terrible, terrible quality. Kung pao chicken, specifically, is the worst I've ever had. Borderline spoiled food.

excerpts: Large portions - good Kung Pao chicken.
Wait staff friendly and food quickly prepared.
Recommended.
kung pao chicken.author: Richard D.
kung pao chicken.review: Nice neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Large portions - good Kung Pao chicken. Wait staff friendly and food quickly prepared. Recommended.

excerpts:
As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. 
I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.
kung pao chicken.author: Daniela R.
kung pao chicken.review:
A friend and I were up studying late and called in to order Chinese delivery here; I was worried that we'd get DENIED because it was probably ten minutes before the closing time listed on their website. 

However, the guy who took our order (and I second the reviewer on here who compared him to a Chinese Grandpa!) was extremely accommodating and friendly.

I was expecting the delivery in probably half an hour or something, but I got a call from the delivery guy less than fifteen minutes later. 

Now, if I'd known about the FREE RICE that would've come with ordering two entrees for delivery, I might've saved myself some money. As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

Not only was the food plentiful, but it was RIDICU-LICIOUSLY NOMSOME. It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.

I'm almost certainly going to call Yum Yum Hunan again when I want Chinese food delivered....and next time I'm going to take advantage of the free rice/chow mein. ;D

excerpts: Kung Pao Chicken:
The veggies in this were amazing!
So perfectly cooked and tons of them!
kung pao chicken.author: R D.
kung pao chicken.review:
This was some good Chinese Delivery.  The guy on the phone was really nice and helpful and we got our food in the time that he specified.  Huge portions and fresh vegetables - not overcooked!

We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!  Lightly fried (not greasy) and very tasty!  Obviously made with real orange.  I ordered this for me, but my boyfriend ate most of it!

Kung Pao Chicken: The veggies in this were amazing!  So perfectly cooked and tons of them!  The chicken, however, was a bit rubbery and fatty...thus the boyfriend eating my chicken!

Kung Pao Fried Rice: I know, I know - Why more Kung Pao?  I don't know.  But the rice was great!  So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.  Alas, the chicken in this was the same as the chicken in the previous dish.

I will order from Yum Yum again, just not the Kung Pao Chickens.

excerpts: The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.
kung pao chicken.author: Evan M.
kung pao chicken.review:
Pretty good not great.  Delivery was relatively quick - 40 minutes into the presidio.  Food was a mixed bag.  The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.  The mongolian beef was not good - overcooked and poor quality beef.  Won ton soup also good.

I might try this again but will look for other places in the neighborhood to try first.

excerpts: I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much.
So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum.
They deliver too, which was another reason to try.
The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good.
You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish.
You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable.
Try it!
kung pao chicken.author: Michael M.
kung pao chicken.review:
Two of the best possible combinations ... Kung Pao, and Fried Rice can be had here. 

I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much. So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum. They deliver too, which was another reason to try. I also tried the Mongolian Beef and Pot Stickers to get a feel for it. I had plenty for lunch the next day. 

The Pot Stickers were OK, and not filled very much with pork and cabbage goodness, but the sauce that came with it, was very good. The Mongolian Beef didn't have much of the rice noodles that come as a filler, which is a good thing. It was spicy, and not too full of green onions which I have a hard time chewing. 

The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good. You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish. You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable. Try it! It's not as spicy as it could be, but throw in some chile sauce if you want.

Delivery was quick. I think I'll order Kung Pao Beef this time!

excerpts: I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken.
Both entrees are in the trash.
I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.
kung pao chicken.author: Allison S.
kung pao chicken.review: I ordered from Yum Yum tonight for delivery. I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken. Both entrees are in the trash. I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.  Even the chicken fried rice was bad - the chicken was chewy and again, I had to spit it out. I will not be ordering from here again.

excerpts: We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.
Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.
Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.
They were also a little on the greasy side.
I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.
Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.
kung pao chicken.author: Erin H.
kung pao chicken.review:
Friday night.  Hungry. Lazy.  Needed a little help from Yelp to get me some Chinese delivery.

Staff was courteous on the phone & our order was delivered quickly.  For the price, we were surprised at the amount of food we had.  Things were looking good...

The food was edible, but not good by any means.  We had the crab rangoon which was good, not the best I've had but okay.  We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.  Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.  Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.  They were also a little on the greasy side.  I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.  Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.

excerpts: As for the kung pao chicken, that was pretty good but nothing special.
I probably won't order from Yum Yum again.
kung pao chicken.author: J D.
kung pao chicken.review: I ordered delivery - and the service was great... very prompt, but the food was just ok.  I found the won ton soup to be way too salty (and I love salt), and the pork fried rice was just so-so.  As for the kung pao chicken, that was pretty good but nothing special. I probably won't order from Yum Yum again.

excerpts: I decided on the staple of Kung Pao Chicken and w/ fried rice, but you do have a choice of steamed and even brown rice (which is great)!
kung pao chicken.author: Eric R.
kung pao chicken.review:
Took a shot at Yum Yum for the first time today based on the reviews and because it is closer then my regular haunts on Clement. I have to say, I was very pleased. First off, this place is clean, bright and friendly. Service was real quick and the staff had a cup of Hot and Sour soup, fresh tea w/pot and water in front of me within a minute of seating. I went for the lunch special which was a great value at $5.50. I decided on the staple of Kung Pao Chicken and w/ fried rice, but you do have a choice of steamed and even brown rice (which is great)! 

The food plate arrived piping hot and extremely quick. Yes, they weren't that busy now at 2:30, but still, very impressive. It was a generous lunch portion and even came with a nice side salad with a light sweet dressing and a free egg roll. Now we are talking. The dish was pleasantly spiced, great sauce (NO MSG) and everything was extremely fresh and the veggies were all properly cooked and retained their natural flavor. I was getting full about 1/2 to 3/4's of the way through the dish and that generally never happens with Chinese lunch specials. However, I couldn't put down the fork. It definitely hit the spot. 

I will be going here again for dinner with friends to order more of my favorites and continue to sample the menu. Btw - even the bathroom was extremely clean, well decorated, stocked and nice hand soap :) That is a good sign of the overall attention to detail and cleanliness of a restaurant.

excerpts: Especially my newfound favorite the Kung Pao Chicken.
Really good portions to
kung pao chicken.author: Anastasia K.
kung pao chicken.review: Everything Ive tried here has been very tasty and well priced. Especially my newfound favorite the Kung Pao Chicken. Really good portions to

excerpts: Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef.
You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices.
Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.
kung pao chicken.author: Jerry C.
kung pao chicken.review: This place is very close to where I work at, UCSF, so it's a common place for all my co workers and I to head out to for a quick lunch of good solid chinese food. For about 6  bucks, you get an entree, with your choice of white rice, fried rice OR brown rice. I love that they have brown rice, and it doens't come at an extra cost either. Maybe they know that there are serveral hospitals in the area, and they smartly want to cater to the health conscoius crowd. Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef. You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices. Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.

excerpts: The lemon chicken was good.
lemon chicken.author: Aracely S.
lemon chicken.review: Ordered take-out from here and it was okay. The lemon chicken was good. The seafood chow fun for the price was not that great. Kinda bland. Had to add chili & soy sauce for flavor. Its conveniently located to where I'm staying temporarily so it worked out but I'm sure there's better spots to satisfy the Chinese food craving.

excerpts: Lemon chicken - essentially a huge chicken nugget with tangy lemon sauce on top.

I liked it, but the crowd I was with was busy munching on other items
3)
lemon chicken.author: Ed P.
lemon chicken.review:
I'm from Sacramento, where the chinese food choices are limited. Went here with a group of people and i LOVED the food.

1) Mushu noodles, vegetarian - absolutely phenomenal, my favorite dish. Get that plum sauce in there!
2) Lemon chicken - essentially a huge chicken nugget with tangy lemon sauce on top. I liked it, but the crowd I was with was busy munching on other items
3) Mongolian Lamb - great sauce, lamb was tasty but it was my least favorite dish
4) Green beans & shrimp - my second favorite - the sauce on the green beans was amazing!

I would definitely come back here... vegetarians and non vegetarians, everyone enjoyed!

excerpts:
Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
lemon chicken.author: Kris B.
lemon chicken.review:
I used their takeout and have eaten at the restaurant. Food comes out  fairly quick and the servers are nice.

Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein

the list goes on...

Almost anything I order is great. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.

excerpts: I thought I'd given up lemon chicken when I became a vegetarian, but Yum Yum Hunan ensures I get my fix more often than I probably ever should.
lemon chicken.author: Lindsay J.
lemon chicken.review: This place is on the short list of our go-to neighborhood takeout options, in no small measure because of their delicious faux meat entrees and the amazing veggie chow mein (which you get gratis if you order two or more entrees - yay!) I thought I'd given up lemon chicken when I became a vegetarian, but Yum Yum Hunan ensures I get my fix more often than I probably ever should.

excerpts: the lemon chicken is pretty good too, and they will make most regular meat dishes with meatless chicken--i had them made me basil meatless chicken and it was yummy.
however, this is not a health food place.
the tastiest meatless chicken is the kind that's fried.
the basil meatless chicken wasn't breaded and fried, and it looked like diced ham--
lemon chicken.author: kate s.
lemon chicken.review:
i was so happy when this place reopened where hunan china used to be.  why?  because yum yum hunan serves meatless chicken!  i am a huge tofu fan but sometimes your mouth just needs that extra chewiness.  it's so good even my husband orders it, and he is usually not very vegetarian-friendly.  it's great because now we can actually SHARE OUR DISHES!  this happened maybe twice a year previously.  now it can be a weekly event.  he always orders the same thing--the general tsao's meatless chicken--but that's okay because so far it's the best thing we've tried on the menu.  the lemon chicken is pretty good too, and they will make most regular meat dishes with meatless chicken--i had them made me basil meatless chicken and it was yummy.  however, this is not a health food place.  the tastiest meatless chicken is the kind that's fried.  the basil meatless chicken wasn't breaded and fried, and it looked like diced ham--while it tasted good, it was a bit strange.

also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.  you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.  i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.

excerpts: I wish the curry chicken was a bit spicier tho.
curry chicken.author: Linda S.
curry chicken.review: Had some food delivered. They were fast, everything we ordered was there, even a special request or extra sauce. The food was warm and delicious. No left overs :). I wish the curry chicken was a bit spicier tho.

excerpts: My favorite is the string bean chicken because the string beans are soft and cooked but not over oily.
Their meats seemed a cut above some of the other local spots.
Service is quick but not always the friendliest
string bean chicken.author: Lauren K.
string bean chicken.review:
This used to be my good-to because of the proximity to my place. This was sometimes a bi-weekly affair. I feel that the quality of this Americanized Chinese is above average. 

My favorite is the string bean chicken because the string beans are soft and cooked but not over oily. Their meats seemed a cut above some of the other local spots. Service is quick but not always the friendliest

excerpts: String bean chicken shouldn't have sliced bell peppers in it... just my two cents.
string bean chicken.author: Kristen S.
string bean chicken.review:
They should consider changing their name to So So Hunan.

The fried rice is more moist than average.  

String bean chicken shouldn't have sliced bell peppers in it... just my two cents.

excerpts: The majority of their menu consists of pieces of chicken/beef/fish deep fried with a sticky sauce poured over them :( but there are a few gems like the vegetarian hong kong style noodle and string bean chicken that I totally love.
string bean chicken.author: Krystle S.
string bean chicken.review:
On the whole, the food is A-OK.  The majority of their menu consists of pieces of chicken/beef/fish deep fried with a sticky sauce poured over them :( but there are a few gems like the vegetarian hong kong style noodle and string bean chicken that I totally love.

The service is what makes me a fan.  They are lightning fast, will deliver to your house if you're lazy, and offer a free container of tasty fried rice (I prefer vegetable) if you order 2 or more entrees (noodles, sadly, are not considered entrees).

excerpts: I particularly like the string bean chicken lunch special.
string bean chicken.author: STEVE L.
string bean chicken.review: I normally get take-out from here.  They're fast.  The food is normally ready within 10 minutes.  Like almost all Chinese restaurants, their food is made with lots of oil.  Everything is tasty.  I particularly like the string bean chicken lunch special.

excerpts: Get the shanghai chicken.
MMMMM MMMM
shanghai chicken.author: Amir B.
shanghai chicken.review: Outstanding!  Good food to say the least and even better, friendlier service than I expected.  Get the shanghai chicken. MMMMM MMMM

excerpts: I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).
I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.
shanghai chicken.author: Annalise V.
shanghai chicken.review: Yum Yum Hunan was recommended to me by my half Asian friend who is super picky about Asian cuisine of any kind.  She also has very expensive taste so I was surprised to find that Yum Yum (as we now affectionately refer to it) is very reasonable (cheap actually).  I have loved everything I have ever ordered.  And for nights spent in, ordering Yum Yum Hunan delivery is the best thing in the entire world.  It's hot, fresh, tasty, and even when I eat a lot of it (which I do quite often) I don't feel like I overdid it as I normally do with inexpensive Chinese food restaurants in the city.   For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.  Translation:  For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.  Good food too.  Seriously.  I love this place.  I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).  I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.

excerpts: The five flavor chicken is ridiculously good!
five flavor chicken.author: Mickey A.
five flavor chicken.review: I can't get enough of this place! Their wonton soup is amazing and has so many fresh vegetables in it. The five flavor chicken is ridiculously good!

excerpts: The five flavor chicken was amazing.
The salty, spicy,crispy pork spareribs were TO DIE FOR!!!
five flavor chicken.author: Melissa E.
five flavor chicken.review: I ordered delivery from these guys last night and it was some of the best chinese food I've ever had. The five flavor chicken was amazing. The salty, spicy,crispy pork spareribs were TO DIE FOR!!! The chow fun was very good and the eggs rolls were so fresh and tasty I couldn't get enough. Definitely worth the price. Only issue I had was the delivery driver wouldn't find a place to park and deliver the food to my hotel room. Other than that, YUM YUM is RIGHT!!

excerpts: Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things
but it is pretty pricy.
five flavor chicken.author: Sydney W.
five flavor chicken.review: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.

excerpts: Seriously, the general's chicken and the five flavor chicken here are off the hook.
five flavor chicken.author: Erica W.
five flavor chicken.review:
My go to Chinese place to order delivery from.

Seriously, the general's chicken and the five flavor chicken here are off the hook. It's not too expensive, the delivery is fast, and the food is good for what you want.

The reason it only has 4 stars is that the chicken isn't typically spicy enough for my taste. Also, I'm not a big fan of the eat-in experience here-- I don't really like the environment and it's always completely empty. The four star rating is for the delivery experience and the food.

Still going to remain my go to delivery place though! Yum.

excerpts: We decided to try the The Five Flavor chicken - it  was delicious!
five flavor chicken.author: Leslie K.
five flavor chicken.review:
Wish we had one in L.A.! 

For a late lunch, we drove by and found this spot. We decided to try the The Five Flavor chicken - it  was delicious! We had the fried rice and basil beef - so good! We also ordered the sesame scallops and some appetizers. We had leftovers for a party of four,  and took the rest to go (asked for some forks & they even gave us more fortune cookies!) After hanging out at the Exploratorium for a while we scarfed the rest down before leaving to catch our flight home. 

Good food, and not at all oily. Will be back next time we are in town!

excerpts: The orange chicken wasn't good, soft sponges texture.
orange chicken.author: Christy B.
orange chicken.review: Ordered delivery today. Food was good, but found an egg shel the size of a quarter in the veggie fried rice. Also none of the dishes come with white rice? Glad we ordered a separate fried Rice or we wouldn't have had rice for our entrees. The orange chicken wasn't good, soft sponges texture.  My Kung Pao chicken however was really tasty. Fortune cookies were stale.

excerpts: Always order the Orange chicken, sesame chicken, green onion pancakes, crab rangoons, and walnut prawns.
Want something different?
The orange prawns are pretty rad too.
orange chicken.author: Wendy K.
orange chicken.review:
Go-to chinese food delivery spot. They're fast, consistent, cheap, and really delicious. 

Dim sum is on point. Always order the Orange chicken, sesame chicken, green onion pancakes, crab rangoons, and walnut prawns. Want something different? The orange prawns are pretty rad too.

excerpts: Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things
but it is pretty pricy.
orange chicken.author: Sydney W.
orange chicken.review: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.

excerpts: We ordered on the Yelp app: crispy noodles, Orange chicken and steamed rice.
We were at the SPCA and they delivered with in less than 30 minutes!
Everything was delicious!
orange chicken.author: Izzyjenn K.
orange chicken.review: We ordered on the Yelp app: crispy noodles, Orange chicken and steamed rice. We were at the SPCA and they delivered with in less than 30 minutes! Everything was delicious!

excerpts: Go here if you want fried batter with orange chicken sauce.
There is a reason why I haven't been back to this place in over a year, although I work a few doors down.
But I had a craving for Chinese food.
Big disappointment.
They are worse than ever now.
orange chicken.author: chari b.
orange chicken.review: Go here if you want fried batter with orange chicken sauce.  There is a reason why I haven't been back to this place in over a year, although I work a few doors down. But I had a craving for Chinese food.  Big disappointment.  They are worse than ever now.

excerpts: Love the Mongolian Lamb, orange chicken and sesame beef.
orange chicken.author: Dennis M.
orange chicken.review: Love this place. Food is always very flavorful and delivery to my place is fast (about 20min). Love the Mongolian Lamb, orange chicken and sesame beef.

excerpts: Fried Rice & Chicken, Lo Mein & Orange Chicken are our favorites, with some wontons.
orange chicken.author: Suzy G.
orange chicken.review:
My husband and I order out from Yum Yum's probably 1-2 times a month and we love it! 

Delivery is usually 20-30 minutes, and the delivery man is always friendly. The portions are huge, we always have leftovers. 

They usually throw in egg rolls for us too. Fried Rice & Chicken, Lo Mein & Orange Chicken are our favorites, with some wontons. 

Super yummy, cheap, and friendly. We love it!

excerpts: I ordered meatless orange chicken with "spicy" heat and vegetable pot stickers.
The veg pot stickers tastes OK (they seldom ever do, at any restaurant.. not sure why I was hoping this would be any different), and didn't get soggy from the car ride at all.
The meatless orange chicken was a bit mushy and soft, not from the car ride.
I think that's just how their meatless chicken is.
orange chicken.author: Jacquelyn T.
orange chicken.review:
Oh, Yelp. When will you finally install the ever requested half star ratings? 3.5 stars

Ordered delivery with a $15 minimum, cheaper than most delivery prices! Came on time (40 minutes) with a very nice delivery man. 

The prices are fair for the portion you get (pretty big). I ordered meatless orange chicken with "spicy" heat and vegetable pot stickers. The veg pot stickers tastes OK (they seldom ever do, at any restaurant.. not sure why I was hoping this would be any different), and didn't get soggy from the car ride at all. The meatless orange chicken was a bit mushy and soft, not from the car ride. I think that's just how their meatless chicken is. A little salty, but enjoyable with rice. 

Of course... as a vegetarian, I appreciate the nice variety of vegetable and meatless "meat" dishes! 

Overall, affordable place, quick service, and decent food. Nothing impressive, but still a good option for cheap delivery. Would order again if I felt like vegetarian chinese.

excerpts: Orange chicken is a perfect mix of American and traditional style.
orange chicken.author: Tyler K.
orange chicken.review:
SECRET TIP: use the online system to find what you want and then call in the order over the phone - It's cheaper!

Best chow fun in town! Absolutely to die for, just the right noodles, perfectly dressed, the vegetable is my favorite. Orange chicken is a perfect mix of American and traditional style. The soups are delicious, I recommend the wonton soup. 

Only downside (hence the 4 stars) would be the online order system. I often use the online system as a convenience and end up having to call in my order after I place it online because the system closes out when you try to complete and place your order. BUT upon calling in the order my total is usually $5-$10 cheaper than the online system. Delivery is good but takes about 45 mins

excerpts:
Recommend:
Salt & pepper tofu
Vegetarian Orange Chicken
Veggie Pot-stickers

Will return soon!
orange chicken.author: Jana C.
orange chicken.review:
Some of the best Chinese I have had. Great for vegetarians.

Came to Yum Yum for a GrubWithUs dinner last night. The place was a ghost town, but the food was anything but. I gather this place gets a lot of its business from take-out and delivery service.

The dinner we had was completely vegetarian and there were more than enough choices.

Recommend:
Salt & pepper tofu
Vegetarian Orange Chicken
Veggie Pot-stickers

Will return soon!

excerpts: Sesame/orange chicken was pretty soggy, wouldn't order again.
orange chicken.author: Emily S.
orange chicken.review: Ordered delivery which was fast. Sesame/orange chicken was pretty soggy, wouldn't order again. Chow fun was good but pretty basic and a little too greasy.

excerpts: I had orange chicken and it had so much weird breading on it and wasn't crispy at all, and the chicken didn't taste like chicken.
Everyone else got veggie dishes and they were ok, so
I'm guessing it was the gross chicken.
orange chicken.author: Phoenix W.
orange chicken.review: I currently am laying in bed experiencing food poisoning from the "chicken" I ate from my first order from this restaurant. I had orange chicken and it had so much weird breading on it and wasn't crispy at all, and the chicken didn't taste like chicken. Everyone else got veggie dishes and they were ok, so I'm guessing it was the gross chicken.

excerpts: Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice.
Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.
orange chicken.author: Lauren C.
orange chicken.review: Awesome dim sum / chinese food delivery. Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice. Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.

excerpts: The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible.
The pork buns were ok.
orange chicken.author: Summer M.
orange chicken.review: Got an order from Grub Hub. The food was only ok. The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible. The pork buns were ok.

excerpts: Their orange chicken in particular is so bomb!
orange chicken.author: Naveen S.
orange chicken.review: One of the best hunan places in the city and I have tried a lot. Their orange chicken in particular is so bomb!

excerpts: One can never go wrong with the orange chicken.
Once here one must try their spring rolls.
The staff is very friendly.
I'm a regular here
so they know exactly how I like my food.
The best place around for good Chinese Food.
Must try it !!!
orange chicken.author: Jazmine A.
orange chicken.review: The best Chinese food. I drive out to the city at least once a week to satisfy my cravings for some tasty Chinese food. One can never go wrong with the orange chicken. Once here one must try their spring rolls. The staff is very friendly.  I'm a regular here so they know exactly how I like my food. The best place around for good Chinese Food. Must try it !!!

excerpts: This is definitely my go-to Chinese delivery place, I love the orange chicken and the pork potstickers!
orange chicken.author: Meera A.
orange chicken.review: This is definitely my go-to Chinese delivery place, I love the orange chicken and the pork potstickers!

excerpts: Ordered the green beans, orange chicken, and mongolian? beef.
Orange chicken was too much on the sweet side.
However, I'd have to say the actual quality of the food was 5 star.
Very fair quality of food to price ratio.
orange chicken.author: Mary P.
orange chicken.review: Yay for being open late! Ordered the green beans, orange chicken, and mongolian? beef. Got white rice and fried rice. Could not help but devour the green beans and fried rice. The beef was good. Orange chicken was too much on the sweet side. However, I'd have to say the actual quality of the food was 5 star. Very fair quality of food to price ratio.

excerpts: The basic Amercanized Chinese foods... general tso, orange chicken,  etc.
all taste the way they should.
orange chicken.author: Rona Y.
orange chicken.review:
This place is clean, fast, cheap, and delicious! All things I would want at my local Chinese restaurant. 

For about $20 bucks you can get two entrees + a free Chow Mein (but make sure you ask the guy for it, they wont offer you the deal if you don't mention it). The amount of food usually lasts me about 3-4 meals .. which in my mind means this is an awesome deal. 

The basic Amercanized Chinese foods... general tso, orange chicken,  etc. all taste the way they should. But some of the less traditional dishes like the asian fried chicken are so addicting! 

Pick up and delivery are pretty speedy - but I usually go late at night when it's pretty dead.

excerpts: I ordered the orange chicken and hunan beef - and found both dishes to be ok at best.
orange chicken.author: Brian D.
orange chicken.review:
Stopped in for lunch on Sunday October 2nd, 2011 - around 4 PM to an empty restaurant. I ordered the orange chicken and hunan beef - and found both dishes to be ok at best. I found both dishes to be less than expected - especially when compared to other neighborhood spots.

The cream cheese wontons, another dish I ordered, were some of the best that I have eaten in town though.

excerpts: This is probably the first time I've ever had orange chicken that was made using real orange and orange zest (no neon-orange flavorless goop!)
They even garnished it!
orange chicken.author: L. L.
orange chicken.review:
Ha! I have no affiliation with Yum Yum Hunan, just a coincidence we chose the same name!

I have been ordering delivery from this place for a couple years. Their service is lightning fast, always courteous, and the food is great!

I'm very picky about my Chinese food yet I'm the kind of person that will eat at the scary, dirty, hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurants my friends are too afraid to try. I usually shy away from Hunan style food because I think the sauces are too rich for me. I hate dishes where my food is swimming in gloppy sauce! But for some reason, Yum Yum's Hunan I find delicious and the sauces are not overwhelming.

They have all the classics but make them especially well. They also have a very long list of "Specials" with unique gourmet offerings such as Mongolian Lamb, Mango Broccoli Prawn and Pork-stuffed Eggplant and Tofu. This is probably the first time I've ever had orange chicken that was made using real orange and orange zest (no neon-orange flavorless goop!) They even garnished it! They make excellent Kung Pao and my favorite Chicken Fried Rice. 

I especially adore that they offer meatless chicken because then my vegetarian husband can eat with me. They offer 5 meatless chicken dishes and 11 vegetarian entree options! Wow!

They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.

The people who answer the phone speak English perfectly so there are never communication issues. They are always friendly and sweet. The delivery guys arrive at your door super fast and are always a pleasure to deal with. These people really *get* customer service!

I am always pleased with the food and service at Yum Yum. What is there not to love?

excerpts: Another reviewer mentioned being able to customize dishes but they were not able to add veggies to the orange chicken.
orange chicken.author: Victoria W.
orange chicken.review:
I enjoyed my spinach tofu soup--large portion too. The vegetarian chicken they use is similar to Quorn but juicier. Another reviewer mentioned being able to customize dishes but they were not able to add veggies to the orange chicken. I got a different chicken dish instead (I think Kung Pao) and it was great!

Service was pleasant and I enjoyed the tasteful ambiance. Would definitely return.

excerpts: I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing.
Great place for Chinese food.
orange chicken.author: Mario C.
orange chicken.review: Ive been going to Yum-yum ever since they were at the Valencia location and since then, them moving I've followed them like a stalker, lol... I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing. Great place for Chinese food.

excerpts:
the real-orange Orange Chicken

Drunken Beef is meh
My hands are actually shaking right now...just a little bit....after eating almost half of the entire order of Orange Chicken...and still....wanting .....
orange chicken.author: Yasi S.
orange chicken.review:
I remember this place when it was back on Valencia: so so so delicious! Thank you for moving! Thank you for remaining in business!

Their food is extremely fresh and has a vibrancy of flavors. Their sauces are so well spiced and delicious without bordering on the "tastes right out of a bottle!" that more mediocre Chinese restaurants seem to specialize in. Also, there's a surprising lack of "oh, wonder what kind of mystery meat that is?!" situation going on. And finally, they have several dishes that deviate from your standard Chinese take-out menus that we've all come to memorize, unfortunately...

They're definitely a cut above the standard Chinese food in SF but I like them just a little less than the California Chinese that Eric's  http://www.yelp.com/biz/erics-restaurant-san-francisco and Alice's made famous.



Good to know:

Spicy Mandarin Eggplant is fabulous as is the real-orange Orange Chicken

Drunken Beef is meh

If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free. Sometimes you have to ask for it though.


Unfortunately, I can tell by my frenetic eating, putting away, returning, nibbling, yearning, wanting of Yum Yum's food that they almost certainly use MSG. And there's no large font denials of it on their menus, so it's safe to say, they use MSG. With great success. And probably a lot of it. My hands are actually shaking right now...just a little bit....after eating almost half of the entire order of Orange Chicken...and still....wanting .....more......

So that's minus 1 star. For my MSG hangover from eating waaaay too much good Yum Yum.

I am going to try to ask them to make my order without MSG next time. I'l let you know how it goes.

excerpts:
We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!
orange chicken.author: R D.
orange chicken.review:
This was some good Chinese Delivery.  The guy on the phone was really nice and helpful and we got our food in the time that he specified.  Huge portions and fresh vegetables - not overcooked!

We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!  Lightly fried (not greasy) and very tasty!  Obviously made with real orange.  I ordered this for me, but my boyfriend ate most of it!

Kung Pao Chicken: The veggies in this were amazing!  So perfectly cooked and tons of them!  The chicken, however, was a bit rubbery and fatty...thus the boyfriend eating my chicken!

Kung Pao Fried Rice: I know, I know - Why more Kung Pao?  I don't know.  But the rice was great!  So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.  Alas, the chicken in this was the same as the chicken in the previous dish.

I will order from Yum Yum again, just not the Kung Pao Chickens.

excerpts: Most recently we ordered the orange chicken, which was good, but nothing special as some of the reviews here rave.
Usually I'm not a huge fan of deep fried anything , but I was hoping this would be more impressive.
Egg rolls were very greasy, would definitely skip these next time, but that hot and sour soup was good, see above.
orange chicken.author: Carolyn K.
orange chicken.review:
This is our delivery place of the moment when we're craving Chinese food. I always judge a Chinese restaurant based on its hot and sour soup and I was pleasantly surprised that when I tasted Yum Yum's soup, it was just that, yum yum. 

We've gotten delivery here twice now and its always tasty and delivered quickly. Most recently we ordered the orange chicken, which was good, but nothing special as some of the reviews here rave. Usually I'm not a huge fan of deep fried anything , but I was hoping this would be more impressive. Egg rolls were very greasy, would definitely skip these next time, but that hot and sour soup was good, see above. We've also gotten the chow mein in the past which I liked, not too greasy. 

Delivery is ridiculously fast, the hot and sour soup is yummy, and the food satisfies that Chinese takeout craving. 3 stars it is!

excerpts: Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice.
orange chicken.author: Tara M.
orange chicken.review: This is our GO-TO Chinese food spot. Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice. AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB). Enjoy! - We always Do! Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.

excerpts:
We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons
orange chicken.author: Melissa J.
orange chicken.review:
Super fast delivery.

Everything was fresh and delicious. They use real chicken... not that sketchy stuff that they call "chicken" at other takeout Chinese restaurants.

We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons

We were also happy with the free Chicken Chow Mein. That was a nice surprise.  So why not 5 stars?

The egg drop soup was a big thumbs down. It tasted fishy. We bought a big container of it and tossed the whole thing. ick.

I won't hold it against them though - everything else was excellent!

excerpts: The orange chicken tasted like slimy McDonalds chicken nuggets and the green beans were way too heavily salted.
orange chicken.author: Katie H.
orange chicken.review:
This was one of the first search results for "Pac Heights," "Chinese food," and "delivery."  The food came in less than 30 minutes, which was awesome.  The delivery guy was friendly enough.  

BUT...The orange chicken tasted like slimy McDonalds chicken nuggets and the green beans were way too heavily salted. 

All in all, if I'm going to hoover MSG down the hatch at 9 pm on a Wednesday night, it should taste better than this.

excerpts: Orange chicken?
Neither sticky nor soggy, good quality meat, actual orange peel in the sauce.
Hot and sour soup?
Above average, delivered in generous quantity and still hot.
We were glad we ordered two.....mmm leftovers.
Noodles?
Buttery and just greasy enough, crunchy fresh veggies mixed in.
orange chicken.author: Marie K.
orange chicken.review:
This place gets five stars not because it is the most spectacular Chinese food ever (it isn't) but because it does exactly what it is supposed to... deliver hot, tasty American-Chinese food promptly and for a reasonable price, with no screwups.  

Egg rolls?  Crispy and delicious, check, ample sweet and sour, check.
Orange chicken?  Neither sticky nor soggy, good quality meat, actual orange peel in the sauce.
Hot and sour soup?  Above average, delivered in generous quantity and still hot.  We were glad we ordered two.....mmm leftovers.
Noodles? Buttery and just greasy enough, crunchy fresh veggies mixed in.
Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?  BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy? BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?  $40

We'll be back... well actually, geeky delivery boy will be back to our apartment.

excerpts: the orange chicken is amazing.
the chow main is amazing.
hell, i actually dont think i've had anything bad here!
My all time favorite thing though is the mongolian chicken.
i will not order from here unless that's included in my order haha.
They are SO FAST on the delivery and its always piping hot!
orange chicken.author: Danielle R.
orange chicken.review: 5-stars for this being my go-to place for typical,"im craving greasy unhealthy chinese food and don't care bad it is for me" nights. That being said, the seczhuan beef is amazing. the orange chicken is amazing. the chow main is amazing. hell, i actually dont think i've had anything bad here! My all time favorite thing though is the mongolian chicken. i will not order from here unless that's included in my order haha. They are SO FAST on the delivery and its always piping hot!

excerpts:
Kungo Pao Fried Rice (too many peanuts)
Great meatless orange chicken!
Spoke English, yeah!
orange chicken.author: Kindra W.
orange chicken.review:
Fast delivery... 
Kungo Pao Fried Rice (too many peanuts)
Great meatless orange chicken!  
Spoke English, yeah!

excerpts: Likely not going back, was not very impressed with the orange chicken I ordered either.
orange chicken.author: Eric B.
orange chicken.review: What kind of chinese food place doesn't include rice with an entree? It's not listed on their site or on Grubhub either. Never in my life have I encountered this. So now I have to a) wait and cook my own, b) still not eat, go back and buy some? Likely not going back, was not very impressed with the orange chicken I ordered either.

excerpts: Big portions and the Orange Chicken was awesome.
orange chicken.author: Travis S.
orange chicken.review: Big portions and the Orange Chicken was awesome.

excerpts: Sampling Orange Chicken near and far.
Why does everyone insist on making this with soy sauce.
I found you and I can now live happily ever after with a belly full of Orange Chicken.
orange chicken.author: Ty M.
orange chicken.review:
oh Yum Yum Gods! I found you. It only took 1 YEAR and 1 MONTH. 
I've been busy over the past year. Sampling Orange Chicken near and far. Why does everyone insist on making this with soy sauce. or deep frying it til the chicken ceases to exist?

At least 10 Chinese Restaurants later, many plea's on facebook for help in finding my addiction, I discover the Valencia St. Yum Yum cooks and staff have been over on Diviz for a year! 

But I can't be mad for the delay. I found you and I can now live happily ever after with a belly full of Orange Chicken. 

The end.

excerpts: I had their orange chicken once
and it was good, and a lot.
orange chicken.author: Alex E.
orange chicken.review: I like the food here for the most part. It's well priced, quick, and yummy. I feel there could be a bit more to quality in the food. I had their orange chicken once and it was good, and a lot. My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2! I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped. It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken. They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea. Good food.

excerpts: We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.
THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!
WHAT
THE HELL!!!
With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.
Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.
orange chicken.author: LittleBird 8.
orange chicken.review:
So our Hunan cravings had led us to Eliza's, but sadly, they were closed by the time we got there (around 945pm ish).  We headed down divisadero, knowing there were was another Hunan joint there.  We discovered Yum Yum Hunan, formerly known as Hunan China Restaurant.  It was already 950pm by the time we arrived and they were happy to accomodate our prompt lateness.  We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.  To my delight they announced that we get free fried rice or chow mien with 2 entree orders!!!  Ooh...free food, I'm not the one to be complaining.  So, the order was taken and their ferocious wok skills dished out our take out in 5 minutes!  Amazing! (I guess they wanted to close by 10)  20 minutes later, as we were unpacking our food on our Ikea coffee table, we discovered...*dramatic pause*....THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!  WHAT THE HELL!!!  With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.  Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.  Yum Yum Hunan would have easily gotten 4.5 shiny red stars from us, but instead, we gave them 3 slightly tarnished yellow stars.  

*Sniff...sniff*...till this very second, as I am typing this review, my discouraged palate is still searching for the hint of eggplant that should be present between the cracks of my teeth.   *SIGH*...

excerpts: A metal piece came out from Sesame chicken.
sesame chicken.author: Jeiko S.
sesame chicken.review:
I ordered a delivery last night. A metal piece came out from Sesame chicken.
Chow mein is bad as well.

excerpts: Try the sesame chicken as well.
The place is very clean as well
sesame chicken.author: JJ M.
sesame chicken.review: Finally found the best Mongolian Beef in the city. After our favorite restaurant closed last year it was difficult looking for a restaurant with the similar taste of cooking.  This is definitely the one that hits the spot. If you are looking for a good Hunan food, this is the place.  Try the sesame chicken as well.  The place is very clean as well

excerpts: Sesame Chicken is not the best I have had, but it's far from the worst.
Pick up orders are dutifully packed, and made quick.
It's not the absolute best Chinese food in San Francisco, but when you have that craving for Americanized Chinese food, it will scratch that itch.
