They serve beer and have a TV that is usually playing a sports game.
sesame chicken.author: Kevin M.
sesame chicken.review: Their Szechuan chicken is a unique and flavorful take on the Hunan classic. Sesame Chicken is not the best I have had, but it's far from the worst. Pick up orders are dutifully packed, and made quick. It's not the absolute best Chinese food in San Francisco, but when you have that craving for Americanized Chinese food, it will scratch that itch. They serve beer and have a TV that is usually playing a sports game.

excerpts: I LOVE this places Sesame Chicken!!
It is to me, hands down, the best around.
The meat has a nice batter around it, its nice and crispy and so flavorful and they don't give you tiny little pieces like some restaurants.
Sesame Chicken lunch special is the only thing I order from here so cant review much else food wise but give it a try, I bet you'll enjoy it!
sesame chicken.author: Sara C.
sesame chicken.review:
I LOVE this places Sesame Chicken!! It is to me, hands down, the best around. The meat has a nice batter around it, its nice and crispy and so flavorful and they don't give you tiny little pieces like some restaurants. You get nice full chunks of chicken. 

Sesame Chicken lunch special is the only thing I order from here so cant review much else food wise but give it a try, I bet you'll enjoy it! The service is super fast as well. 

SIDE NOTE: They did change their payment policy so if you want to dine in, I believe you must spend a minimum of $20.00 if you are going to pay with CREDIT/DEBIT card.

excerpts: Always order the Orange chicken, sesame chicken, green onion pancakes, crab rangoons, and walnut prawns.
Want something different?
The orange prawns are pretty rad too.
sesame chicken.author: Wendy K.
sesame chicken.review:
Go-to chinese food delivery spot. They're fast, consistent, cheap, and really delicious. 

Dim sum is on point. Always order the Orange chicken, sesame chicken, green onion pancakes, crab rangoons, and walnut prawns. Want something different? The orange prawns are pretty rad too.

excerpts: We ordered the green beans and chicken, meatless sesame chicken, and a side of rice.
GrubHub said they didn't deliver from Pac Heights to the Tendernob, but on the other hand, Seamless said they did (or the other way around, I can't remember).
My sesame chicken was ordered mild but Hunan being Hunan, it had a good kick to it.
sesame chicken.author: Cassandra J.
sesame chicken.review:
I'll refrain from the obvious pun on the name. 

We got delivery from Yum Yum the other night at a suggestion from a friend. We ordered the green beans and chicken, meatless sesame chicken, and a side of rice. GrubHub said they didn't deliver from Pac Heights to the Tendernob, but on the other hand, Seamless said they did (or the other way around, I can't remember). Delivery was neither fast nor slow, but did come within the time span given (within a 10 minute window and they hit it, I was impressed). 

My sesame chicken was ordered mild but Hunan being Hunan, it had a good kick to it. Be warned if you're sensitive to hot spices (if you are, what are you doing ordering Hunan anyways?)  

Delicious delicious food! It was hard not to eat all of it in one sitting (there was a lot!)  Fortunately lots of leftovers for work the next day!

Yum yum!

(You knew it had to be said)

excerpts: Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice.
Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.
sesame chicken.author: Lauren C.
sesame chicken.review: Awesome dim sum / chinese food delivery. Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice. Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.

excerpts: The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible.
The pork buns were ok.
sesame chicken.author: Summer M.
sesame chicken.review: Got an order from Grub Hub. The food was only ok. The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible. The pork buns were ok.

excerpts: but I love their sesame chicken.
It's totally yum yum.
How appropriate.
Haha the service is mediocre but the food makes up for it!
sesame chicken.author: Sherita P.
sesame chicken.review: My fave Chinese food in the Bay Area. I'm no expert but I love their sesame chicken. It's totally yum yum. How appropriate. Haha the service is mediocre but the food makes up for it!

excerpts: I got the Sesame Chicken, and it came with hot and sour soup, an egg roll, fried rice, and a side salad.
sesame chicken.author: J C.
sesame chicken.review:
Get - Any Lunch Special. I got the Sesame Chicken, and it came with hot and sour soup, an egg roll, fried rice, and a side salad. This was a big portioned meal for $7 with tax.

Avoid - No Complaints.

Service - Standard. Competent, but not very friendly. They take your order, bring your food, and fulfill your requests.

Space - Lots of light, nice and airy (unlike a lot of Chinese restaurants)

Would come back - If I am in the area for lunch and want Chinese food.

excerpts: My faves:  sesame chicken, garlic eggplant, chow fun veggie.
sesame chicken.author: Yelper H.
sesame chicken.review:
Consistently good!  They always deliver food hot and a complete order.

My faves:  sesame chicken, garlic eggplant, chow fun veggie.

This place hits the spot!

excerpts: Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!)
sesame chicken.author: Megan J.
sesame chicken.review:
We are new to the Pac Hts neighborhood so I jumped on Yelp to figure out where to grab bomb Chinese food.  Yum Yum came highly recommended from the majority of Yelpers and STILL managed to exceed our expectations. The prices are surprisingly reasonable and the food is insanely flavorful and fresh.  Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.  Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.  Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!) and Yum Yum just added 4 devotees to their customer base. 

The service was also uber-friendly.  Since we placed our order during a World Series game (aka they were slammed with orders), they suggested that we pick up in 15 minutes rather than wait the 45-60 mins for delivery.  And, then, when we arrived at the restaurant, thanked us profusely for making the effort to come to them.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant.
The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent.
I've always had a great experience.
sesame chicken.author: Caroline N.
sesame chicken.review: It's hard to find a tasty decent Chinese food place in the city. I am so happy to find Yum Yum Hunan! The prices are reasonable and the food is very good. I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant. The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent. I've always had a great experience.

excerpts: I used to really love the sesame chicken, but the inconcistency of their meals combined with their questionable customer service made them recently lose me as a customer
sesame chicken.author: Nikko J.
sesame chicken.review: The customer service in here is pretty bad. They scold you/ make you feel like crap if you try to use a card instead of cash, and once didnt let me pay with card at all. Foods okay but i've gotten sick a couple times off of it so i dont touch it anymore. I used to really love the sesame chicken, but the inconcistency of their meals combined with their questionable customer service made them recently lose me as a customer

excerpts: and I always get their sesame chicken w/ broccoli.
This dish doesn't have broccoli on the menu but, just ask for it w/ broccoli.
sesame chicken.author: Mina B.
sesame chicken.review:
My favorite local Chinese delivery spot.

Order two entrees and get a free order of fried rice (veggie, chicken, beef) OR chow mein.  I always get the veggie fried rice. 

They give you hearty portions!  My husband and I always get their sesame chicken w/ broccoli. This dish doesn't have broccoli on the menu but, just ask for it w/ broccoli. You can balance the fried sweet chicken pieces with some steamed veggies. 

Other dishes tried that we liked was the drunken beef and basil beef...both very good.

excerpts: We ordered a sesame chicken and a eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish.
Both were great deals, but the eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish was definitely better.
I was surprised at how authentic it was.
Before the dishes come out, they give you a cup of soup which is good too.
Also, did I mention how much rice they give you???
I love rice and was still having a hard time finishing all of it.
On each plate, they also give you a few salty chips on the side.
All in all, Yum Yum's lunch deals were cheap and satisfying.
sesame chicken.author: Angela S.
sesame chicken.review:
After multiple attempts of trying to eat at Food Inc (a block or two away from Yum Yum), we were disappointed as we found ourselves in front of a closed Food Inc which is not open on Sundays. Then he said he was craving chinese food for some reason, so we looked on yelp and made our way to Yum Yum. Upon entering, there was only one other lady eating there and I got a little worried. However, the place was clean and more spacious than it seemed from the numerous times I've passed by. 

We sat down and spotted a section with lunch deals on the menu, ranging from $6-8 each. We ordered a sesame chicken and a eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish. Both were great deals, but the eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish was definitely better. I was surprised at how authentic it was. Before the dishes come out, they give you a cup of soup which is good too. Also, did I mention how much rice they give you??? I love rice and was still having a hard time finishing all of it. On each plate, they also give you a few salty chips on the side. All in all, Yum Yum's lunch deals were cheap and satisfying.

excerpts: I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken.
sesame chicken.author: Edwin M.
sesame chicken.review:
Very good - perfect grease factor. 

The service was average, and the pricing was a little higher than average, but hey, it's Pac Heights, what are you going to do?

I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken. My friend ordered Garlic Chicken. They both came with an egg roll - it was very reminiscent of generic Chinese food from home, but altogether, a nice place to eat.

excerpts: I got sesame chicken
and there was a lot of chicken and not too much breading!
the rice also had a great texture and wasn't over or under done.
The food even tasted great reheated as leftovers.
sesame chicken.author: Chase H.
sesame chicken.review: Possibly the best chinese takeout I've had in San Francisco so far.  I got sesame chicken and there was a lot of chicken and not too much breading!  the rice also had a great texture and wasn't over or under done.  The food even tasted great reheated as leftovers.

excerpts: As well as sesame chicken.
sesame chicken.author: Jen L.
sesame chicken.review: Amazing food. I have tried take out which only took 6 minutes to prepare and dine in which came out almost instantly . There mongolian chicken off the chain. As well as sesame chicken. I really really enjoy there lover and cashew walnut prawns and they have a new take on crab rangoon. I love it as well as my dog who I feed to her for treats. GREAT FOOD FAST AND AMAZING PRICES. Portions are big. Friendly staff

excerpts: We also got sesame chicken,
sesame chicken.author: Bobby P.
sesame chicken.review:
Finally, I try somewhere I have had bookmarked forever. I would like to Holla at Rita C. for suggesting this place weeks ago. I wish I would have heeded her advice earlier because this place is really good. 

The food was yum, yum and then some. And on top of that it was Hunan. The name really does sum the place up. I went with a friend after happy hour at Fishbowl and we couldn't have been happier. We ordered the appetizer platter that came with pot stickers, egg rolls, crab ragoon, and some shrimp thing. We also got sesame chicken, Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice. All of it was amazing. I want to come back and try more of their menu. It was so damn good. 

Yum Yum is up there on my list of favorite Chinese places for sure. Thanks Rita!

excerpts: Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).
sesame chicken.author: TC C.
sesame chicken.review:
Same great Yum Yum's that was loved on Valencia St.

I ate fried food for dinner with white rice and LOVED every bite!  
Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).

I also recommend their Basil Tofu and Mango Chicken.

Extremely friendly service!  Nice to see some of the same familiar faces.

excerpts: They also do the classic dishes great such as their crab rangoon or sesame chicken.
sesame chicken.author: King D M.
sesame chicken.review:
Its between this place and Tai Chi for chinese delivery for me.  (I haven't actually ever been there)  

As many others have said, the mongolian lamb is amazing; it has great flavor.  They also do the classic dishes great such as their crab rangoon or sesame chicken.

excerpts: Here, it comes in the form of Sesame Chicken, but that's just fine.
The sauce isn't the same (it's good), but the chicken is crispy, and that seems to be the challenge.
Add to that some sesame seeds, the fact that it's remarkably cheap and has excellent, friendly service and you've got a winner.
(I'll always miss you Fu Wah)
sesame chicken.author: Rich M.
sesame chicken.review: Ever since I lost my favorite General Cho's Chicken place, Fu Wah on Haight, I've been searching for a replacement (the sit-down part, not the take-away at the front). In fact, every time I try a new Chinese Food place, I go straight for "the General" only to be served soggy lumps of disappointment. Fu Wah deserves mentioning because the General's chicken always came out crispy, with a tangy, spicy sauce that couldn't be beat. The closest I've had is the spicy chicken at San Tungs, but my other favorite is Yum Yum. Here, it comes in the form of Sesame Chicken, but that's just fine. The sauce isn't the same (it's good), but the chicken is crispy, and that seems to be the challenge. Add to that some sesame seeds, the fact that it's remarkably cheap and has excellent, friendly service and you've got a winner. (I'll always miss you Fu Wah)

excerpts: I ordered the sesame chicken.
The chunks of "chicken" were mostly fried batter.
It gave me a bit of a stomach ache, however I don't eat fried food too often.
On the bright side, their service was great.
sesame chicken.author: Daniel Y.
sesame chicken.review: I didn't like my dish. I ordered the sesame chicken. The chunks of "chicken" were mostly fried batter. It gave me a bit of a stomach ache, however I don't eat fried food too often. On the bright side, their service was great.

excerpts: I had a taste of sesame chicken and a eggplant shrimp plate, both of which were tasty and freshly made.
Although it is tailored slightly to American Chinese, it still offers some traditional dishes and cooks with quality.
This place will have you saying yum-yum in your tum-tum for under $10 bones!
sesame chicken.author: Ed L.
sesame chicken.review: Divisadero is not a renowned street for Chinese food but Yum Yum beats expectations. With solid lunch meals on the menu, that ranged from $6-8 each, you get soup, entree, rice and fried wontons (just wrapper actually). Pretty good deal for a place around Pac Heights. I had a taste of sesame chicken and a eggplant shrimp plate, both of which were tasty and freshly made. Although it is tailored slightly to American Chinese, it still offers some traditional dishes and cooks with quality. This place will have you saying yum-yum in your tum-tum for under $10 bones!

excerpts: i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.
sesame chicken.author: Roshni R.
sesame chicken.review:
i wasn't a fan of hunan china at all.  in fact, my co-worker and i used to refer to it as "dirty chinese" as opposed to "clean chinese" which is eliza's around the corner.

what a delight when yum yum replaced hunan china.  the food is just as cheap but infinitely better.  i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.  some of my co-workers swear by the string bean salmon.

the lunch special, for most items, is a mere $6 including tax for an entree, rice (white or brown), soup, and an appetizer of their selection.  great lunch spot if you work in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings: Not bad.
I am a huge chicken wing enthusiast, especially salt and pepper wings, so I may be a bit critical when it comes to this dish.
I've definitely had much tastier salt and pepper wings, but it isn't the worst I've had.
salt and pepper chicken wings.author: Christina B.
salt and pepper chicken wings.review:
My Chinese food palate is quite extensive, especially living in San Francisco, growing up Chinese and constantly being surrounded by Chinese food.

I got delivery from this place last night and it wasn't horribly bad nor was it excellent either. The delivery time was standard, about 40 minutes. The food came warm which is always a plus in my book.

FOOD:
Green onion pancake: SKIP! This dish is definitely not worth the caloric intake nor is it worth your money. They only put the tasty green onion mixture in the middle of the pancake and it only covered approximately 25% of the pancake innards. Therefore, when they fry it up and serve it to you, you eat mostly fried batter without the yummy insides.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings: Not bad. I am a huge chicken wing enthusiast, especially salt and pepper wings, so I may be a bit critical when it comes to this dish. I've definitely had much tastier salt and pepper wings, but it isn't the worst I've had. It's fairly average and I would order it again if ordering from this place.

Chicken Chow Fun: Meh. Honestly, I don't think there was enough soy or sauce on it because the noodles were not brown but a tan color, which is an indication that there isn't enough soy. When tasting, it was a bit bland for what the dish could have been. I would skip this dish or maybe try the beef chow fun next time.

Bok Choy and Shiitake mushrooms: It's hard to ruin this dish so this dish gets my thumbs up especially if you're trying to eat healthy.

Wor Won Ton Soup: The broth was a bit plain and everything in it was just meh. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. 


In conclusion: just a "meh" restaurant. If I am craving Chinese, I might order from here again but I'd probably be more inclined to trying another place just because their food is just average. I'm not really sure why they have such a high rating. Is it the neighborhood they are in? If they were in the sunset or a more Chinese populated neighborhood, I have a feeling they wouldn't have such a high rating. If I were you, I'd skip on this place and try somewhere else.

excerpts: Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings Entree - 5 Stars.
Came on a bed of shredded lettuce with jalapeno, peppers, some other stuff.
Batter was tasty and seasoned.
salt and pepper chicken wings.author: Christina C.
salt and pepper chicken wings.review:
As far as Americanized Chinese foods go, this place is...here.  It has some lovely things that I would never have ordered were it not for the reviews on this site, and then it had some things that I craved which were also mentioned on this site.  Let's start off with the good news, shall we?

Crab Rangoon - 5 stars, delicious, star shaped generous filling.  I would never have order this except one of the reviews here talked about it and I am very very glad I did.  It's a good execution of Crab Rangoon even if it may be crab-less.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings Entree - 5 Stars.  Came on a bed of shredded lettuce with jalapeno, peppers, some other stuff.  Batter was tasty and seasoned.  A bit heavy, but that's like saying the cone shape of carrots detracts from the taste.  

Ma Po ToFu - 3 stars.  Ths sauce was not undelicious, and the flavor was not offensive.  My preferance is for it to be made with soft tofu whereas this was made with medium or firm.

Buddha's Delight Vegetable Clay Pot - 3 stars.  The taste was rather fresh.  I enjoyed the thin glass noodles at the bottom and the pleasing array of veg, wood ear mushroom, and tofu.  Again, I would have like soft tofu, not medium or firm.  

Pork Chow Mein - 5 stars because it was FREE!!  I ordered so much food that my tummy is groaning right now.  Maybe tomorrow after the laxative eat works its magic, I'll have some.  But for now, Chinese food:1, Christina:0.

Let's talk about the lovely young man who delivered it.  He was so considerate and concerned that my apartment door would close and lock me out (it does and did), he voiced his concern.  Ah.  What a nice young man.

Final thoughts: I've come to the conclusion that ordering chinese food as a chinese person who does not live in NYC is like eating at a cafeteria (maybe even a public school cafeteria) after having grown up on home cooking, on the farm, grandmother makes her own bread, cooks her own jellies.  I'm not disappointed because that would be like being disappointed that watermelons are not poisonous.  I am merely...enlightened.  And I know that for $36 I have enough food to last me the rest of the week through finals, if only I can bring myself to eat it.

excerpts: The hot and sour soup hit the spot, and the salt and pepper chicken wings weren't too bad.
salt and pepper chicken wings.author: Michael G.
salt and pepper chicken wings.review: This is surprisingly decent Chinese delivery food. While it's not the best in SF, this place earns props due to the overall experience. The guy was extremely friendly and efficient on the phone. He even told me that the rice was free after I declined it. They also happily take credit cards. I didn't even have to ask. The food arrived in less than twenty minutes. The hot and sour soup hit the spot, and the salt and pepper chicken wings weren't too bad. The garlic chicken, however, was rather bland, though it did have fresh vegetables, as someone else pointed out. All in all, I'll probably be ordering from them often.

excerpts: I especially love the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and Singapore noodles.
kung pao meatless chicken.author: Mark F.
kung pao meatless chicken.review:
Probably one of the best Hunan places in the city. Food is flavorful and rich. Extra points for having really good fake chicken. Fried rice is free with a delivery order and delivery is very fast.

I especially love the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and Singapore noodles.

Their dim sum stinks, though. The spring rolls and pot stickers are inedible, but the entrees are sooooo good that it doesn't loose them stars in my book.

excerpts:
My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
lemon meatless chicken.author: Cat A.
lemon meatless chicken.review:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.

excerpts: The General Tsos meatless chicken is TERRIBLE.
The "meatless" part is an awful rubbery texture and the outside is a strange, gelatinous coating that makes the whole thing stick together in one block.
The sauce is watery thin, and the taste is not remotely General Tsos.
I will not order from here ever again.
general tsos meatless chicken.author: Chanda G.
general tsos meatless chicken.review: The General Tsos meatless chicken is TERRIBLE. The "meatless" part is an awful rubbery texture and the outside is a strange, gelatinous coating that makes the whole thing stick together in one block. The sauce is watery thin, and the taste is not remotely General Tsos. I will not order from here ever again.

excerpts: The orange meatless chicken is a favorite of mine, but everything I've had has been pretty tasty.
orange meatless chicken.author: Murphy O.
orange meatless chicken.review:
Yum Yum! 

This is my go to place for delivery. The orange meatless chicken is a favorite of mine, but everything I've had has been pretty tasty. 

Add in free delivery and chow mein with two entrees and I'm a fan!

excerpts: The orange meatless chicken is still my favorite of all time and every once in a while you need a good-greasy-chinese-food-night-in.
orange meatless chicken.author: N F.
orange meatless chicken.review:
This is for the delivery only; I've never been to the restaurant.

It's your standard delivery.  I've never had to wait too long for their driver and they always get the order right.  They seem a little expensive, but I don't order too many take-outs, so I don't have much of a market-comparison on this.

The great thing is they have the meatless chicken options which is fantastic.  One of my friends who eats meat said it tastes the same, if not better, than their meat.

The downside is that the last order I got the boc choy with mushrooms.  the greens were great, the mushrooms tasted as if they were soaked in powdered cheese.  not a fan.  Moreover, all the food was shiny from soaking in oil.  Also not a fan. Some may say, it's chinese take-out, what do you expect?  Just a little better than food that comes with your oil.

But all in all I will certainly order from them again.  The orange meatless chicken is still my favorite of all time and every once in a while you need a good-greasy-chinese-food-night-in.

excerpts: I dig this place, great food, not too greasy, ordered the orange meatless chicken and for someone who's not a huge fan of tofu i was blown away.
taste real, real good.
orange meatless chicken.author: A F.
orange meatless chicken.review:
I dig this place, great food, not too greasy, ordered the orange meatless chicken and for someone who's not a huge fan of tofu i was blown away. taste real, real good. 
i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice. that pisses me off. he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty. the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.

excerpts:
My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
sesame meatless chicken.author: Cat A.
sesame meatless chicken.review:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.

excerpts: i went right in and ordered up some mandarin meatless chicken, chatted with them about the closure, how big lantern stole their identity, and the new location.
two words-hells
yeah!!!
mandarin meatless chicken.author: Wendolyn A.
mandarin meatless chicken.review:
i have a soft spot for yum yum house.  they have always been the best of the chinese delivery spots in the mission, msg free, nice staff, familiar with regulars, not to mention that "yum yum" is an understatement.  but most of all i love them because once when i  was very sick with the flu and bronchitis off and on for three weeks and i was ordering their hot and sour for lunch every day.  eventually the guy who usually answered the phone joked that i must really like their soup to order so often and i told him my predicament.  to my surprise, when my delivery guy came to the door, i suddenly had a giant container of hot and sour-same price as the smaller size and he told me to get well soon.  how f***ing rad is that???

sadly, i moved away from the mission in december and the chinese food in my new hood just wasn't the same.  then i heard that they were closed down in april and my heart was broken . . . until one day when i was walking down divisidero and to my amazement-we're neighbors again!!!  i went right in and ordered up some mandarin meatless chicken, chatted with them about the closure, how big lantern stole their identity, and the new location.  two words-hells yeah!!!

excerpts: We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight.
Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea.
A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.
vegetable delight.author: Brandi W.
vegetable delight.review: Exceptional. Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, excellent dishes. We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight. Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea. A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: I have ordered the kung pao tofu and chicken, mongolian beef, meatless chicken general tsao, hot and sour soup, and vegetable chow main.
Everything was yummy (with the exception of the hot sour soup, lacking in the flavor department)!
None of the dishes were greasy,  all the ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies, and the portions were generous.
My meat loving, i hate organic and vegan anything bf really liked the meatless chicken general tsao.
kung pao tofu.author: danielle l.
kung pao tofu.review:
Yum Yum Hunan is a name well deserved.  I have ordered delivery here twice now and both times have been pleasantly surprised.  I have ordered the kung pao tofu and chicken, mongolian beef, meatless chicken general tsao, hot and sour soup, and vegetable chow main.  Everything was yummy (with the exception of the hot sour soup, lacking in the flavor department)!  None of the dishes were greasy,  all the ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies, and the portions were generous.  My meat loving, i hate organic and vegan anything bf really liked the meatless chicken general tsao.  He couldn't tell it wasn't real chicken! 

Delivery was fast.  They pack their food in compostable containers(way to be green YYH). Yum Yum Hunan is my go to place now for Chinese delivery.

excerpts: I consistently order the hot and sour soup, the kung pao tofu, and the brown rice.
Always solid, and generally not too greasy (though once the tofu was REALLY greasy...
but still
oh sooooo tasty & flavorful).
kung pao tofu.author: Jasmine F.
kung pao tofu.review:
I'm a bit surprised seeing so many low ratings for this place over the past few months! For me, Yum Yum has been the best Chinese delivery I've experienced in the city, hands down...and I've been looking for a "go to" spot for a looooooooooong time. The only thing that has gone wrong for me: they have forgotten items a couple times and brought the wrong order once, but they always make it up to me, so it's all good.

I consistently order the hot and sour soup, the kung pao tofu, and the brown rice. Always solid, and generally not too greasy (though once the tofu was REALLY greasy...but still oh sooooo tasty & flavorful). I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point. I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time. It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.

excerpts: Every time we go we have to order Kung Pao Tofu, Szechuan String Beans, Garlic Eggplant and several more purely vegie dishes.
Even the meat-lovers we bring sing the praises of the vegetarian fare.
Vegans and Vegetarians get this strange look on their faces....

one that I've seen on people who get their first view of Yosemite valley from atop half dome, taste gandiua gelato in Florence for the first time, and come home from one of those rare and magical first dates....
ah!
yeah,
that's it
kung pao tofu.author: Scott C.
kung pao tofu.review:
This is THE BEST Chinese food in San Francisco.  
We mourned the loss of Yum Yum when their lease ran out on Valencia.  We celebrated madly when we found them at their new location on Divisadero.  The new place is more commodious and WAY nicer than any other decent Chinese restaurant in the city -- save Brandy Ho's North Beach location.  I prefer Yum Yum to B.H., though.

Vegetarians and veggie friendly/open types -- RUN here!!!  Every time we go we have to order Kung Pao Tofu, Szechuan String Beans, Garlic Eggplant and several more purely vegie dishes.  Even the meat-lovers we bring sing the praises of the vegetarian fare.  Vegans and Vegetarians get this strange look on their faces....one that I've seen on people who get their first view of Yosemite valley from atop half dome, taste gandiua gelato in Florence for the first time, and come home from one of those rare and magical first dates....ah! yeah, that's it...they get stars in their eyes.

Fish lovers rejoice -- the whole fish is to die for.  The lightly breaded and perfectly deep fried fish can reach near-orgasmic heights of intensity --no grease, just light, crunchy bites of cloud-like heaven ;-)

I can't speak to pork/beef dishes, but they've gotta' be great.  

Even though they do a brisk take-out biz, I highly recommend eating in.  Nothing beats fresh hot Yum Yum....but do order enough for left-overs....even day-old, microwaved Yum Yum is nice and comforting...especially if accompanied by an old Woody Allen flick?!? ...besides, it reminds one of the ethereal experiences of the previous night.

excerpts: Best Kung Pao Tofu in Pac Heights!
Has a really great balance if fresh veggies, tofu, and peanuts.
All the other dishes I've tried have also been great!
Less greasy than most places and TONS of meatless options!
They deliver in under 30 minutes!
kung pao tofu.author: Lizzie L.
kung pao tofu.review: Best Kung Pao Tofu in Pac Heights! Has a really great balance if fresh veggies, tofu, and peanuts. All the other dishes I've tried have also been great! Less greasy than most places and TONS of meatless options! They deliver in under 30 minutes!

excerpts: We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight.
Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea.
A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.
kung pao tofu.author: Brandi W.
kung pao tofu.review: Exceptional. Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, excellent dishes. We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight. Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea. A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.

excerpts: The Kung Pao Tofu was ok, but not what I was expecting.
Not the fault of the restaurant as I was trying it for the first time.
The veggie potstickers were great and less greasy  than other places, but the green onion pancakes were pretty greasy and made me feel like I had to take a shower after I ate one.
Im going to give this place another chance and hope for speedier delivery and metal free food next time.
kung pao tofu.author: reina t.
kung pao tofu.review:
Ok, so I read someone else's review about how they got their food in like 20 minutes or something so I was pretty excited about that when I ordered last night.However, our order took over an hour to arrive. Maybe it was the rain. 
On to the food. When it finally arrived there was quite a bit in exchange for not too much money which is always a pretty pleasant suprise. The food itself was pretty good, HOWEVER, when I was eating the chow mein, what did I find? A little peice of metal nestled within the noodles and hidden just enough to make it into my mouth. Repulsive. If that didn't happen I (and I'm sure anyone else) would have been much happier. The Kung Pao Tofu was ok, but not what I was expecting. Not the fault of the restaurant as I was trying it for the first time. The veggie potstickers were great and less greasy  than other places, but the green onion pancakes were pretty greasy and made me feel like I had to take a shower after I ate one. Im going to give this place another chance and hope for speedier delivery and metal free food next time.

excerpts: Specifically, I recommend the Kung Fu Tofu, Garlic Eggplant, and Szechuan Broccoli.
The (vegetarian) orange "chicken" is spectacular.
Even my Mom who has a tendency to be a bit of a Chinese food snob thought the food was excellent.
When she visits she is always happy to order from here.
szechuan broccoli.author: Rick P.
szechuan broccoli.review:
Really good delivery options: the food comes fast and the portions are huge. I've tried most of their vegetarian options are they truly are delicious! Specifically, I recommend the Kung Fu Tofu, Garlic Eggplant, and Szechuan Broccoli. The (vegetarian) orange "chicken" is spectacular. Even my Mom who has a tendency to be a bit of a Chinese food snob thought the food was excellent. When she visits she is always happy to order from here. That's saying a lot.

Order your food, and then 20 minutes later or so the food will be at your doorstep, piping hot! Also, per other Yelp reviews, if you order two or more dishes, they'll give you a free chow mein for free. 

Love this place.

excerpts: Szechuan broccoli $7.95 fantastic.
I love the sauce.
I drizzle it on my rice.
Walnut prawns $10 not too bad.
First time having this dish.
I didn't know it was deep fried AND had mayo.
Wouldn't order it next time.
13 prawns.
szechuan broccoli.author: Mrs F.
szechuan broccoli.review:
Szechuan broccoli $7.95 fantastic.  I love the sauce.  I drizzle it on my rice.
Walnut prawns $10 not too bad.  First time having this dish.  I didn't know it was deep fried AND had mayo.  Wouldn't order it next time.  13 prawns.  
Free vegie fried rice.  $23 with delivery and tip.  Same nice young man in glasses.

Solid place and just as good second time around.  Very happy I have a Chinese place I can count on time and again and hopefully for many more years to come.

excerpts: Mongolian beef and szechuan broccoli were yum!
szechuan broccoli.author: Jessica P.
szechuan broccoli.review: Good lunch spot. I love that their food comes out piping hot. Mongolian beef and szechuan broccoli were yum!

excerpts: The garlic eggplant ($10) had great texture and strong garlic flavor.
I loved it.
garlic eggplant.author: Linda X.
garlic eggplant.review:
I was craving Chinese food and this place really hit the spot. The prices aren't cheap like in Chinatown but the service was great and the serving sizes were super generous. The restaurant is nice and clean too.

We got the broccoli beef ($11) which had this addicting, delicious sauce. The garlic eggplant ($10) had great texture and strong garlic flavor. I loved it. The beef fried rice ($9) was the perfect comfort food. It's all pretty salty though so make sure to drink plenty of tea or water.

I definitely enjoyed my meal. Huge plus that they were extremely quick with getting the food to our table. We had barely just ordered and already had the food in front of us!

excerpts: After about five minutes of scanning the menu we ordered General Tsao's Chicken and Spicy Garlic Eggplant.
The General Tsao's Chicken was pretty standard, despite the fact that the chicken wasn't as spicy
we'd hoped it'd be despite asking the waitress to make it extra spicy.

But the real surprise/treat of the night was the Spicy Garlic Eggplant; usually when you order this dish at a Chinese restaurant it's usually bland and you don't really taste "garlic" or "spicy," but YYH's was full of flavor and the best part
: their spicy garlic eggplant comes with shrimp, calamari and other assorted SEAFOOD!

The best I've ever gotten with my spicy garlic eggplant in the past was maybe some shredded pork, but YYH serves theirs with a delicious mix of assorted seafood, and they even top it off with some basil for an extra depth of flavor.
garlic eggplant.author: Scott S.
garlic eggplant.review:
I really love Divisadero; the atmosphere, the stores, the people... everything about it and around it reads "anti-big money, mom and pop neighborhood." I'm not hinting that there's an air of class about this neighborhood, but it is definitely more unique and delightful than most, thus you can imagine my surprise when I found out there was a Chinese restaurant on this block.

When you think of Chinese restaurants in America you usually think of places that serve up a quick fix of left-over-for-the-next-meal-bound pan-asian cuisine, but Yum Yum Hunan (despite their hilariously cheesy sounding name,) like the street and neighborhood in which it's situated, is more unique and delightful than most.

Now from past experience, there are only two types of Chinese restaurants that I usually find in semi-gentrified areas: those that are sort of shabby looking inside, serve horribly americanized chinese food for bargain prices; and those that are really well-decorated inside, serve horribly americanized "fusion" chinese food for ridiculous prices. Well guess what? YYH is neither of these.

My roommate and I came here for a late dinner and looking at the interior from the outside we immediately thought this place was the latter of the aforementioned "chinese restaurant stereotypes," but since we were pretty hungry we decided to sit down anyway. We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

After about five minutes of scanning the menu we ordered General Tsao's Chicken and Spicy Garlic Eggplant. The General Tsao's Chicken was pretty standard, despite the fact that the chicken wasn't as spicy we'd hoped it'd be despite asking the waitress to make it extra spicy. But the real surprise/treat of the night was the Spicy Garlic Eggplant; usually when you order this dish at a Chinese restaurant it's usually bland and you don't really taste "garlic" or "spicy," but YYH's was full of flavor and the best part: their spicy garlic eggplant comes with shrimp, calamari and other assorted SEAFOOD! The best I've ever gotten with my spicy garlic eggplant in the past was maybe some shredded pork, but YYH serves theirs with a delicious mix of assorted seafood, and they even top it off with some basil for an extra depth of flavor.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.

excerpts: We had the garlic eggplant.
It was great.
garlic eggplant.author: Stephanie D.
garlic eggplant.review: This place was great. My group of 8 strolled in at 7pm on a Sunday night and was seated right away. As others have noted, prices were reasonable (most entrees around $10) and portions were good to share. Mild is VERY mild, so I would definitely order at least medium next time. We had the garlic eggplant. It was great.

excerpts: My faves:  sesame chicken, garlic eggplant, chow fun veggie.
garlic eggplant.author: Yelper H.
garlic eggplant.review:
Consistently good!  They always deliver food hot and a complete order.

My faves:  sesame chicken, garlic eggplant, chow fun veggie.

This place hits the spot!

excerpts: I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant.
The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent.
I've always had a great experience.
garlic eggplant.author: Caroline N.
garlic eggplant.review: It's hard to find a tasty decent Chinese food place in the city. I am so happy to find Yum Yum Hunan! The prices are reasonable and the food is very good. I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant. The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent. I've always had a great experience.

excerpts: my favorite is the garlic eggplant.
fast delivery
garlic eggplant.author: Laura M.
garlic eggplant.review: still my favorite chinese delivery in sf... lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.  my favorite is the garlic eggplant. fast delivery

excerpts: I loved the garlic eggplant the most, and the won ton soup was full of white meat chicken and fresh vegetables.
I rarely get soup but just felt like it for some reason
so I don't know how won ton soup usually looks, but
this one seemed more packed with meat, veggies, and won tons than I remember most places having.
Oh, and I liked the fortune cookies ..
they were funny.
"Try a new hat for a change in looks.
Be creative!"
Wow, that is good advice.
How did they know I love hats and need an excuse to buy another one?
Your choices at the moment will be good ones.
Trust yourself.
"  Aaaw, that's sweet.
Just the pick-me-up I needed!
Oh thanks to the yelper who posted where you can find their menu.
I'll re-post

that:
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu
garlic eggplant.author: Muriel D.
garlic eggplant.review:
Great service, polite, fast (under 20 mins from the time I picked up the phone to the time the food was in my kitchen).  I loved the garlic eggplant the most, and the won ton soup was full of white meat chicken and fresh vegetables.  I rarely get soup but just felt like it for some reason so I don't know how won ton soup usually looks, but this one seemed more packed with meat, veggies, and won tons than I remember most places having.  Oh, and I liked the fortune cookies .. they were funny.  "Try a new hat for a change in looks.  Be creative!"  Wow, that is good advice.  How did they know I love hats and need an excuse to buy another one?  "Your choices at the moment will be good ones.  Trust yourself."  Aaaw, that's sweet.  Just the pick-me-up I needed!
Oh thanks to the yelper who posted where you can find their menu.  I'll re-post that:
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu

excerpts: We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.
THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!
WHAT
THE HELL!!!
With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.
Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.
garlic eggplant.author: LittleBird 8.
garlic eggplant.review:
So our Hunan cravings had led us to Eliza's, but sadly, they were closed by the time we got there (around 945pm ish).  We headed down divisadero, knowing there were was another Hunan joint there.  We discovered Yum Yum Hunan, formerly known as Hunan China Restaurant.  It was already 950pm by the time we arrived and they were happy to accomodate our prompt lateness.  We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.  To my delight they announced that we get free fried rice or chow mien with 2 entree orders!!!  Ooh...free food, I'm not the one to be complaining.  So, the order was taken and their ferocious wok skills dished out our take out in 5 minutes!  Amazing! (I guess they wanted to close by 10)  20 minutes later, as we were unpacking our food on our Ikea coffee table, we discovered...*dramatic pause*....THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!  WHAT THE HELL!!!  With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.  Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.  Yum Yum Hunan would have easily gotten 4.5 shiny red stars from us, but instead, we gave them 3 slightly tarnished yellow stars.  

*Sniff...sniff*...till this very second, as I am typing this review, my discouraged palate is still searching for the hint of eggplant that should be present between the cracks of my teeth.   *SIGH*...

excerpts: I also recommend their Basil Tofu and Mango Chicken.
basil tofu.author: TC C.
basil tofu.review:
Same great Yum Yum's that was loved on Valencia St.

I ate fried food for dinner with white rice and LOVED every bite!  
Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).

I also recommend their Basil Tofu and Mango Chicken.

Extremely friendly service!  Nice to see some of the same familiar faces.

excerpts: Had an order of the Basil Tofu lunch special ($7) in between appointments at UCSF: fried tofu, carrot, & red pepper with brown rice, a little salad, vegetarian hot & sour soup and an egg roll.
Food was delicious, staff was attentive, and an the ambiance was augmented with CNBC!
basil tofu.author: Rishi C.
basil tofu.review: Had an order of the Basil Tofu lunch special ($7) in between appointments at UCSF: fried tofu, carrot, & red pepper with brown rice, a little salad, vegetarian hot & sour soup and an egg roll.  Food was delicious, staff was attentive, and an the ambiance was augmented with CNBC!

excerpts: I didn't like the Basil Tofu dish much but
that's only because there's a lot of water chestnuts in it.
The Lover's Prawns are great half honey walnut prawns and half prawns in a sweet slightly spicy sauce (if the sauce were spicier it'd be even better).
basil tofu.author: Joann C.
basil tofu.review: Solid delivery place.  The people are really nice on the phone, and the delivery comes in a reasonable amount of time.  I didn't like the Basil Tofu dish much but that's only because there's a lot of water chestnuts in it.  The Lover's Prawns are great half honey walnut prawns and half prawns in a sweet slightly spicy sauce (if the sauce were spicier it'd be even better).  With two entrees, you get a free fried rice or noodle and you can get "chow fun" as the noodle entree.  Anytime we order from here we can eat the leftovers for at least 2 more meals.

excerpts: basil tofu, comes with jalepenos, yum.
any meatless chicken dish.
basil tofu.author: Little P.
basil tofu.review:
i love yum yum.  i loved yum yum on valencia...unfortunately it moved to divisadero, but luckily, i work close by there!  
my favorites: hot and sour soup. it's vegetarian and delicious and will clear up any stuffed nose you have.
onion pancake:  light, scallion-ey and good peanut dip.
basil tofu, comes with jalepenos, yum.
any meatless chicken dish.  my husband eats meat, he couldn't tell!
veggie fried rice.  mmmmmm
oh, i could go on and on. prices are cheeeeeeeeaaaap.  hooray!
lunch special is where it's at though, you get the perfect portions and a bit of everything.  
yum yum for my tum tum.

excerpts: I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).
I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.
basil tofu.author: Annalise V.
basil tofu.review: Yum Yum Hunan was recommended to me by my half Asian friend who is super picky about Asian cuisine of any kind.  She also has very expensive taste so I was surprised to find that Yum Yum (as we now affectionately refer to it) is very reasonable (cheap actually).  I have loved everything I have ever ordered.  And for nights spent in, ordering Yum Yum Hunan delivery is the best thing in the entire world.  It's hot, fresh, tasty, and even when I eat a lot of it (which I do quite often) I don't feel like I overdid it as I normally do with inexpensive Chinese food restaurants in the city.   For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.  Translation:  For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.  Good food too.  Seriously.  I love this place.  I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).  I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.

excerpts: I usually get the "HUNAN FISH" or the " WOR WON TON SOUP"
hunan fish.author: Cali L.
hunan fish.review:
DINING IN- EXCELLENT service. the staff here are attentive and totally friendly. 

TAKE OUT- FAST DELIVERY and quality of food is just as good, like as if you were dining in.

QUAILITY- pretty "yummy" good portions and great prices..

I usually get the "HUNAN FISH" or the " WOR WON TON SOUP"
Prawns with scrambled eggs are pretty gooood here...and you get steamed bok choy on the side too.

Coworkers and I tend to order here for their good food and fast service.

One coworker raves about the chicken curry..and id have to agree that its pretty good.

The guy who takes the orders on the phone is super nice too!

"HELLO.....YUM YUM.."

excerpts: The hunan fish ($6.50) is my standbye, but I'm all about exploring their options too.
hunan fish.author: Gopal R.
hunan fish.review:
This place is one of my top 3 lunch places when I'm at work, and number 1 for takeout.

The hunan fish ($6.50) is my standbye, but I'm all about exploring their options too.

excerpts:
-Have unique items on their menu

Try the walnut prawn!
walnut prawn.author: Jay C.
walnut prawn.review:
I feel like for the amount of times I order from these guys, I should at least give them another rating. 

It's a bit on the higher priced side, but they 

-Deliver fast and HOTTER THAN HELL
-Are polite (and I'll admit, the fact that they speak excellent English is a plus). 
-Have unique items on their menu

Try the walnut prawn! It's the most decadent thing in the world.

excerpts: Their walnut prawn, is like Tony Montana in your MOUTH
walnut prawn.author: Stephen B.
walnut prawn.review: This place rulz. Their walnut prawn, is like Tony Montana in your MOUTH

excerpts: Walnut prawn is definitely up to par if not a little above.
Their dim sum is worth passing on, but I feel that way because there are so many good dim sum places in the city and its definitely not their specialty.
service is good but they do kind of hurry you to order they dont seem to like my style of ordering one thing at a time.
walnut prawn.author: Joshua D.
walnut prawn.review: The food is good for the most part. I live across the street and the only issue i have had was when I ordered the pork sui mai and it was cooked all the way through. Their won ton soup is pretty good. Walnut prawn is definitely up to par if not a little above. Their dim sum is worth passing on, but I feel that way because there are so many good dim sum places in the city and its definitely not their specialty.  service is good but they do kind of hurry you to order they dont seem to like my style of ordering one thing at a time.

excerpts: We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.
dry garlic calamari.author: Therese H.
dry garlic calamari.review:
I may have found a new hot spot for the new neighborhood I am living in.

We stopped by, hungry after moving furniture due to the high recommendation that came from a friend.  

It was early for dinner time and we were one of two tables full.  

The staff was very pleasant and the food was great!

The portions we very big and i noticed quite a few things that were exciting to me on the menu:

The first is free delivery, very handy even if you're right across the way.  I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.  There was quite a lot of seafood as well as veggie options, which even included seitan/soy meat or "meatless chicken"  

We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.  This was plenty for two, plus leftovers.

I willl definitly be back to try more of the menu :)

excerpts: I highly recommend the String Bean Salmon.
Beware that a lot of there stuff is deep fried.
string bean salmon.author: Kate J.
string bean salmon.review: Great lunch specials!  This place has a new owner and look. I highly recommend the String Bean Salmon.  Beware that a lot of there stuff is deep fried.

excerpts: some of my co-workers swear by the string bean salmon.
string bean salmon.author: Roshni R.
string bean salmon.review:
i wasn't a fan of hunan china at all.  in fact, my co-worker and i used to refer to it as "dirty chinese" as opposed to "clean chinese" which is eliza's around the corner.

what a delight when yum yum replaced hunan china.  the food is just as cheap but infinitely better.  i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.  some of my co-workers swear by the string bean salmon.

the lunch special, for most items, is a mere $6 including tax for an entree, rice (white or brown), soup, and an appetizer of their selection.  great lunch spot if you work in the neighborhood.

excerpts: I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice).
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms.
The Chow Fun was O.K.
It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts).
Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork...
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
fried rice.author: Lilian C.
fried rice.review:
I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice). 

Delivery time was fast!

We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice! Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms. The Chow Fun was O.K. It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts). Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork... I would've chosen a different meat if I knew.

Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!

excerpts: The beef fried rice ($9) was the perfect comfort food.
fried rice.author: Linda X.
fried rice.review:
I was craving Chinese food and this place really hit the spot. The prices aren't cheap like in Chinatown but the service was great and the serving sizes were super generous. The restaurant is nice and clean too.

We got the broccoli beef ($11) which had this addicting, delicious sauce. The garlic eggplant ($10) had great texture and strong garlic flavor. I loved it. The beef fried rice ($9) was the perfect comfort food. It's all pretty salty though so make sure to drink plenty of tea or water.

I definitely enjoyed my meal. Huge plus that they were extremely quick with getting the food to our table. We had barely just ordered and already had the food in front of us!

excerpts: the best salt and pepper fried rock cod the Szechuan beef delicious prawn fried rice amazing this will be my go-to place all the time...
just had this for dinner yummy yum yum
fried rice.author: Lorellie S.
fried rice.review: I love this place it has the best salt and pepper fried rock cod the Szechuan beef delicious prawn fried rice amazing this will be my go-to place all the time... just had this for dinner yummy yum yum

excerpts: Food was good, but found an egg shel the size of a quarter in the veggie fried rice.
Also none of the dishes come with white rice?
Glad we ordered a separate fried Rice or we wouldn't have had rice for our entrees.
fried rice.author: Christy B.
fried rice.review: Ordered delivery today. Food was good, but found an egg shel the size of a quarter in the veggie fried rice. Also none of the dishes come with white rice? Glad we ordered a separate fried Rice or we wouldn't have had rice for our entrees. The orange chicken wasn't good, soft sponges texture.  My Kung Pao chicken however was really tasty. Fortune cookies were stale.

excerpts: Also, their Prawn Fried Rice is always Excellent
(notice that capital "E"...
I did that on purpose!).
I often come here for this alone!
Always a pleasure to order from Yum Yum!
fried rice.author: Eric H.
fried rice.review: Am still a fan of Yum Yum Hunan. I just tried their Salt & Pepper Rock Cod the other day, and it was great. Will definitely be ordering that again! Also, their Prawn Fried Rice is always Excellent (notice that capital "E"... I did that on purpose!). I often come here for this alone! Always a pleasure to order from Yum Yum!

excerpts: The Kung poa fried rice is delicious and they can make it as hot as you like.
I have good to this place since Valencia street
and it's still Great!!!
Gets crowded during lunchtime.
fried rice.author: Pam P.
fried rice.review: Steve and his crew are awesome.  I always order the basil chicken white meat but I also have had most of all the other entrees.  The Kung poa fried rice is delicious and they can make it as hot as you like.  I have good to this place since Valencia street and it's still Great!!! Gets crowded during lunchtime.

excerpts: Enjoyed the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice lunch special.
Very good!
$20 minimum for credit cards tho
fried rice.author: Jennifer S.
fried rice.review: Enjoyed the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice lunch special. Very good! $20 minimum for credit cards tho

excerpts:
Also, if you order over $25 worth of food, you get a free lo mein or fried rice (but you have to order over the phone; no free stuff if you order online due to take rates from the websites). 

Highly recommend:
- vegetable fried rice (not too oily and has lots of veggies in it, including zucchini!)
fried rice.author: Amelia C.
fried rice.review:
Great for take-out/ delivery. Also, if you order over $25 worth of food, you get a free lo mein or fried rice (but you have to order over the phone; no free stuff if you order online due to take rates from the websites). 

Highly recommend:
- vegetable fried rice (not too oily and has lots of veggies in it, including zucchini!)
- crispy salt and pepper black cod
- mongolian beef (tasty with sautéed onions)
- chicken with green beans (v. generous with the green beans)

excerpts: Kung pao fried rice??
Yummm must try next time.
fried rice.author: Sydney W.
fried rice.review: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.

excerpts: Love the ribs, pork fried rice, Royal pork is great as well.
Deep fried prawns, egg rolls!
These guys are faster if you call them instead of using some delivery app...
fried rice.author: Kirk M.
fried rice.review: Great delivery from these guys! Love the ribs, pork fried rice, Royal pork is great as well. Deep fried prawns, egg rolls! These guys are faster if you call them instead of using some delivery app...

excerpts: The egg rolls and fried rice are great.
The king pao fried rice is interesting, and I thought it was a fun dish.
The hot and sour soup is a little on the bland side, but decent.
fried rice.author: Elizabeth R.
fried rice.review:
I've only had delivery from Yum Yum and I've been pleased every time. They are timely, their website is easy to use and they are always very courteous at the door.

The egg rolls and fried rice are great. The king pao fried rice is interesting, and I thought it was a fun dish. The hot and sour soup is a little on the bland side, but decent. I've liked all of the vegetable dishes I've ordered.

My go-to neighborhood Chinese delivery.

excerpts: Delivery guy was friendly and the bbq pork fried rice is good.
General chicken has good flavor (if you like spicy, medium tasted pretty mild) gets points added for coming with broccoli but deducted cuz I feel like the pieces of chicken were 70% breading
fried rice.author: Siobhan T.
fried rice.review:
Ordered on the yelp app and it arrived in 20 still hot. Delivery guy was friendly and the bbq pork fried rice is good. General chicken has good flavor (if you like spicy, medium tasted pretty mild) gets points added for coming with broccoli but deducted cuz I feel like the pieces of chicken were 70% breading but that's not surprising.

For quick, hot delivery i would order from here again.

excerpts: For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein
I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that.
The food was serviceable.
fried rice.author: Marty J.
fried rice.review:
I ordered delivery from here through Eat24.com last night. It was nice to see some comments mostly mixed about the food. For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein but it came as pork.

The food was filling. Pretty greasy. I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that. The food was serviceable. I'd probably order from here again.

I like that they are not the standard take out boxes and they are plastic with a lid so they are easy to refrigerate. It came with 2 soy sauce packets and 2 fortune cookies. My girlfriend got the cookie with no fortune in it. LOL.

excerpts: Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake.
Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups.
Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite.
fried rice.author: Sarah B.
fried rice.review:
My go to chinese delivery now!


Have ordered twice, and both times the food was very good, and with prompt delivery. Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns. Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake. Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups. Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite. Not big pieces, but just those little bites that make you think twice about what you just ate. 

Also, we've ordered a couple entrees at once and not gotten the free stuff everyone else is raving about. How do I get on that??

excerpts: Fried Rice & Chicken, Lo Mein & Orange Chicken are our favorites, with some wontons.
fried rice.author: Suzy G.
fried rice.review:
My husband and I order out from Yum Yum's probably 1-2 times a month and we love it! 

Delivery is usually 20-30 minutes, and the delivery man is always friendly. The portions are huge, we always have leftovers. 

They usually throw in egg rolls for us too. Fried Rice & Chicken, Lo Mein & Orange Chicken are our favorites, with some wontons. 

Super yummy, cheap, and friendly. We love it!

excerpts: Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
fried rice.author: Cat A.
fried rice.review:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.

excerpts: bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.
fried rice.author: Connie S.
fried rice.review:
this place is appropriately named because their food is yum yum. the ingredients taste fresher and look higher quality than comparable chinese delivery restaurants. the guy who answers the phone is always super friendly and very accommodating of my hatred of bell peppers. and they deliver to my house even though i live fairly far away. what's not to love?!

some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers. bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.

yum yum, enjoy!

excerpts: They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.
fried rice.author: Lisa K.
fried rice.review:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.

excerpts: The fried rice is full of goodness that you can see.
My kids ate it and it had veggies and egg.
fried rice.author: Van T.
fried rice.review:
It's good take out. They are fast on delivery. 

The fried rice is full of goodness that you can see. My kids ate it and it had veggies and egg. So I am happy. 

Other items ordered: 
- Chicken Basil - good. Spice it up your way. Just let them know.
- Hong kong noodle combo - good. This comes with crispy noodles. Check out the picture and you will want to order this one.
- Beef Broccoli - good. Just look at the pictures i posted.
- Buddha delight - good. If you like the clear glass noodles, then you will like this dish. It has wood ear mushrooms, fried tofu, and various veggies.
- Szechuan string beans - okay. But if you order it, I will eat it again.

excerpts: I like their fish, chow mein, beef and broc, and fried rice.
fried rice.author: Dee N.
fried rice.review:
Yum yum!! An awesome restaurant that delivers fast and delicious food every time. 

Super affordable for huge portions. I like their fish, chow mein, beef and broc, and fried rice.

excerpts: We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids.
fried rice.author: Alexis M.
fried rice.review:
Yum Yum is well...Yum Yum.


We headed here after a show at The Fillmore based on reviews on Yelp.

Very fresh and non greasy. The restaurant was empty but the phone was ringing of the hook and the delivery guys were in and out like crazy. I enjoyed hearing the old man answer the phone, "Hello, Yum Yum".

Everything was wonderful and fresh. When I walked by to use the bathroom I saw them cutting up a ton of fresh zucchini and carrots and onions. Nothing frozen. All super fresh vegetables.

We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids. 

So glad we stumbled upon this gem of a Chinese restaurant. Plus we got to end the night with a tour of Pac Heights with it's beautiful homes all decorated for Christmas.

excerpts: When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein.
Nice!
Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.
The chow mein was simple and satisfying.
fried rice.author: Valeria R.
fried rice.review:
Until this past Friday, in my almost 15 years here I had never found a Chinese delivery place that I would try again. So, basically, all this time I've been ordering once from here, once from there, etc. If only Hunan Homes delivered...that would have solved my problem a long time ago.

But, recently, my BFF started raving about Yum Yum Hunan. I checked out my fellow Yelpers' reviews and Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise! When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein. Nice! Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.

The food arrived, nice and hot, in about 30 minutes. The wontons blew me away...they were simply amazing. Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.

The chow mein was simple and satisfying.

The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.

The walnut prawns, again, weren't as good as Hunan Homes', but I would order them again. They give you a baker's dozen, by the way.

I expected the prawns to come on the usual bed of shredded lettuce, but the beef was served that way as well, which I don't care for because it reheats horribly. Next time I'll ask them to leave out the lettuce on everything so that I don't have to pick it off.

So, all told, for about $30 including tip, I got almost 5 meals. Yum Yum, indeed, and economical! Friendly service too.

Yum Yum is going on the speed-dial for sure!

P.S. I swear I didn't eat all 5 of those meals in one night.

excerpts: Got the combination fried rice here one night and it wasn't salty or sweet enough.
They could have stood to use more soy sauce in the cooking or (since I'm Vietnamese) fish sauce.
fried rice.author: Skippy T.
fried rice.review:
This place has -surprisingly- flavorful Dim Sum (well, not real "dim sum" per se, but the popular dumpling styles from dim sum). The Pork Siu Mai and Ha Gao (shrimp dumplings) were absolutely delicious and reminiscent of my times eating in Roland Heights, Diamond Bar, and Westminster in southern California.

Got the combination fried rice here one night and it wasn't salty or sweet enough. They could have stood to use more soy sauce in the cooking or (since I'm Vietnamese) fish sauce. In general, it needed -just- a little more salt.

Definitely good, and extremely cheap. Oh, and they do delivery for free, so that's a bonus. Would definitely recommend for a casual lunch!

excerpts: The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.
fried rice.author: Le T.
fried rice.review:
I came here twice. The first time, the food was pretty bland. I got the spare ribs, chicken wings, and mongolian beef.  While the food was edible, it wasn't very spectacular. 

The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.  This time, the food was surprisingly tasty. 

I suggest going around lunch time to get the lunch special.  Otherwise, the dinner prices can add up especially if you order a rice dish and a meat dish and a vegetable dish.

excerpts: The fried rice is more moist than average.
fried rice.author: Kristen S.
fried rice.review:
They should consider changing their name to So So Hunan.

The fried rice is more moist than average.  

String bean chicken shouldn't have sliced bell peppers in it... just my two cents.

excerpts: We always get 3 entrees because then you get either chow mein or fried rice for free!

prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice =
okay
-mongolian

beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.
Lots of green peas and water chestnuts

prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice =
okay
-mongolian

beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.
Lots of green peas and water chestnuts
fried rice.author: Christy A.
fried rice.review:
Not bad Chinese food.  We always get 3 entrees because then you get either chow mein or fried rice for free!  We usually get it delivered and they are pretty quick about it.

THE FOOD

-spicy, salty, fried pork = good (MSG galore tho!)
-walnut prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice = okay
-mongolian beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.  Lots of green peas and water chestnuts

excerpts: Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice.
Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.
fried rice.author: Lauren C.
fried rice.review: Awesome dim sum / chinese food delivery. Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice. Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.

excerpts: The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible.
The pork buns were ok.
fried rice.author: Summer M.
fried rice.review: Got an order from Grub Hub. The food was only ok. The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible. The pork buns were ok.

excerpts: you chose the option of fried rice for 50c extra, and you find you have only white rice, and that is 80% of your meal...
fried rice.author: Raj D.
fried rice.review:
Omg, very poor service...can you imagine this...you walk in to order, are looking at the menu, they bring you a small sweet n sour soup and hot tea...you start having the soup, and place your order, that you wanted it packed to go...and **** they pick up your soup and tea from under your nose !!!

As if that is not enough, if you order from the lunch menu, your hunan chicken or whatever, you open your lunch at home...and again you feel screwed...the plate is all rice, with very little of the main course...you chose the option of fried rice for 50c extra, and you find you have only white rice, and that is 80% of your meal...you ask for the bill, you get a scribble in frickin Chinese, nothing is itemized, just a grand total...which is also way more than you expected...
