The restaurant is usually empty, and now I can see why...NEVER AGAIN !!!

excerpts: We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.
fried rice.author: Scott S.
fried rice.review:
I really love Divisadero; the atmosphere, the stores, the people... everything about it and around it reads "anti-big money, mom and pop neighborhood." I'm not hinting that there's an air of class about this neighborhood, but it is definitely more unique and delightful than most, thus you can imagine my surprise when I found out there was a Chinese restaurant on this block.

When you think of Chinese restaurants in America you usually think of places that serve up a quick fix of left-over-for-the-next-meal-bound pan-asian cuisine, but Yum Yum Hunan (despite their hilariously cheesy sounding name,) like the street and neighborhood in which it's situated, is more unique and delightful than most.

Now from past experience, there are only two types of Chinese restaurants that I usually find in semi-gentrified areas: those that are sort of shabby looking inside, serve horribly americanized chinese food for bargain prices; and those that are really well-decorated inside, serve horribly americanized "fusion" chinese food for ridiculous prices. Well guess what? YYH is neither of these.

My roommate and I came here for a late dinner and looking at the interior from the outside we immediately thought this place was the latter of the aforementioned "chinese restaurant stereotypes," but since we were pretty hungry we decided to sit down anyway. We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

After about five minutes of scanning the menu we ordered General Tsao's Chicken and Spicy Garlic Eggplant. The General Tsao's Chicken was pretty standard, despite the fact that the chicken wasn't as spicy we'd hoped it'd be despite asking the waitress to make it extra spicy. But the real surprise/treat of the night was the Spicy Garlic Eggplant; usually when you order this dish at a Chinese restaurant it's usually bland and you don't really taste "garlic" or "spicy," but YYH's was full of flavor and the best part: their spicy garlic eggplant comes with shrimp, calamari and other assorted SEAFOOD! The best I've ever gotten with my spicy garlic eggplant in the past was maybe some shredded pork, but YYH serves theirs with a delicious mix of assorted seafood, and they even top it off with some basil for an extra depth of flavor.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.

excerpts:
Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!
fried rice.author: Talia G.
fried rice.review:
They changed their deal. I'm so sad. Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

Still...$34 for 4 entrees isn't bad:
+ General Tsao Chicken - Decent. Not at all spicy though.
+ Mango Broccoli Prawn - My favorite. Going to order it every time.
+ Mu Shu Pork - Solid.
+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!

Yum Yum, I may be a bit put off by your policy change, but your delivery is still speedy and you still taste delicious, so I will forgive and forget.

excerpts: Order 3 (used to be 2) entrees and get a free chow main or fried rice.
Only available for delivery orders
fried rice.author: Brian L.
fried rice.review:
My favorite go-to delivery/take-out Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Delivery is free and pretty fast. The food satisfies every time. They do the standard dishes well. The best part about ordering from Yum Yum is when you call and they answer - "HELLO!! YUM YUM!!!"

Our favorites: Beef and broccoli, sweet and sour pork
Avoid: Hot and sour soup
Must do: Order 3 (used to be 2) entrees and get a free chow main or fried rice. Only available for delivery orders

excerpts: I ordered chicken chowmein, and chicken fried rice.. shared with my toddler and I. like all kids, he loves the noodles!!

anything pasta, he'll eat, and ask for more..
and for me I'll give the chowmein a 6.5 out of 10..
it's good.
the rice, the same.
it's edible.
so if you order, make sure to be specific, and say Over Rice, make it  as one. because they will send you TWO boxes, one chowmein, and once fried rice.
we have left overs for tomorrows lunch and dinner!
lol.
fried rice.author: Mariana O.
fried rice.review:
When I first called to order I thought, wow he didn't ask me for my name, my phone number or how to get in the building?! Anyway, delivery came pretty quick, my phone says I called around 1:43, they called me at 2:03.. not bad. apparently they found my number on the caller ID. and when I came outside to pay the guy was already outside of my part of the building, I wondered how he was able to get in... weird!!
I ordered chicken chowmein, and chicken fried rice.. shared with my toddler and I. like all kids, he loves the noodles!! anything pasta, he'll eat, and ask for more..
and for me I'll give the chowmein a 6.5 out of 10.. it's good. the rice, the same. it's edible. not the best out there, but good.. regular steamed rice, fried with soy sauce from what I can see.. chicken, eggs, peas, carrots, and onion..
so overal, I'd say a 6/10 experience with them.. I'm sure If I were drunk it'd be the best ever... lol.
but I like it, big noodles.. and big chunks of chicken in the rice :)
we'll probably order from here again.
and my total, was $15.50.

and now full, finished eating. and theres still enough for at least 2 or 3 people!!! I told them medium, but I doubt it, the sizes look like there's one size only.. I can't eat anymore.. so if you order, make sure to be specific, and say Over Rice, make it  as one. because they will send you TWO boxes, one chowmein, and once fried rice. we have left overs for tomorrows lunch and dinner! lol.

excerpts: Got white rice and fried rice.
Could not help but devour the green beans and fried rice.
The beef was good.
fried rice.author: Mary P.
fried rice.review: Yay for being open late! Ordered the green beans, orange chicken, and mongolian? beef. Got white rice and fried rice. Could not help but devour the green beans and fried rice. The beef was good. Orange chicken was too much on the sweet side. However, I'd have to say the actual quality of the food was 5 star. Very fair quality of food to price ratio.

excerpts: We usually order Mongolian beef and pork fried rice and broccoli a la carte (special request)
I've gotten scallops. before.
fried rice.author: Nia N.
fried rice.review:
My great aunt loves this place because its close to our apartment and because they deliver. Delivery is super fast and the food is still hot. We usually order Mongolian beef and pork fried rice and broccoli a la carte (special request) I've gotten scallops. before. All in all the food is pretty tasty. 

Only complaint: One night, my aunt and I decided to place our order for pick up since they were 15 mins away from closing. My great aunt walked in ahead of me and told them how much she loved their food and how she's been coming for years and they completely ignored her comment and asked how they could help me since I walked in a little after her. I waited a minute to see if he would comment back to her but he didn't he just asked how he could help me. I told him I had an order for pick-up and as he turns to get it, my aunt asked for a cup of water (she was pretty winded by the walk there) and he glances at her then completely ignores her again. It wasn't until I asked again for her that he got the water for her... From the sink, at that! I guess the guy figured maybe my aunt wasn't spending any money, just coming in to make a comment but either way it was extremely rude. I would've considered giving another star but after that experience I just couldn't, plus the food is just OK anyway. What makes it even worse is I don't think My great aunt even noticed how rude they really were to her. Smh

excerpts: After I ordered our dinner he asked if I wanted free fried rice because we ordered 2 entrees.
fried rice.author: Kimberly H.
fried rice.review:
Here is where you can find their menu: http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurantdetails?restaurantid=7632

Last night we ordered dinner from here; wow! The phone service is the best that I have ever called when ordering delivery of any kind of food, he answered my questions nicely and didn't put me on hold or rush me. I even had a short conversation with him about how they recently moved from Valencia St. It was so obvious he had a smile in his voice. Because I have never been there before he said he will put a menu in my bag. Their new divisadero location was the home to my old Chinese delivery place. 

After I ordered our dinner he asked if I wanted free fried rice because we ordered 2 entrees. I was so surprised because usually when you are able to get something free you have to ask them for it by saying you have a coupon or tell them you see it on the menu. 

I placed my order at 6:48pm and it arrived at 7:00pm. Can you believe that, 12 minutes! I am not even lying because I knew that I would be giving them a yelp review while I was talking on the phone with him because he was so nice. I wanted my review to have all the information that mattered so I wrote down the times. Mind you, I live 7 blocks from this place so I can't guarantee you that you will be getting your order that fast. It could have also been that their delivery guy was there at the exact time my food was ready. However, I will say that the Chinese restaurant that used to be at this location never delivered my food this fast. 

Even though I am one fourth Chinese, my pallet for Chinese delivery food is pretty poor; so I have to say that the food quality is as good as any Chinese delivery I have ever had; possibly better because their Mongolian beef actually has lots of beef, unlike some places I have ordered from where there is more onion than anything else. This will now be the place where I buy my Chinese delivery from now on.

excerpts: I have to say their Mongolian beef is pretty good, as well as their combination fried rice, potstickers and green beans.
Extra stars for being one of the only Chinese restaurants I've ordered from that has Har Gow (shrimp dumplings) available all day!
Delivery is faster than almost anywhere (except Amici's of course), so it's a great option for a last-minute dinner.
fried rice.author: Nancy O.
fried rice.review:
We used to order from Ben Wa just down the street.  However, the declining quality of the meat and taste of the food has pushed us to Yum Yum.
I have to say their Mongolian beef is pretty good, as well as their combination fried rice, potstickers and green beans.  Extra stars for being one of the only Chinese restaurants I've ordered from that has Har Gow (shrimp dumplings) available all day!
Delivery is faster than almost anywhere (except Amici's of course), so it's a great option for a last-minute dinner.

excerpts: Also, if you purchase two entrees you get a FREE fried rice or chow mein.
I have never been in the restaurant
but I love the delivery.
fried rice.author: Serene M.
fried rice.review:
The food is delicious, the delivery is fast, and I can understand the person on the phone when he is taking my order. Once in a while I still try delivery from somewhere else, but I keep going back to Yum Yum. 
So far I haven't found a place that can match Yum Yum's proportions, which are very generous. I always have food for more than one meal. The prices are great. Also, if you purchase two entrees you get a FREE fried rice or chow mein. I have never been in the restaurant but I love the delivery.

excerpts: I got the Sesame Chicken, and it came with hot and sour soup, an egg roll, fried rice, and a side salad.
fried rice.author: J C.
fried rice.review:
Get - Any Lunch Special. I got the Sesame Chicken, and it came with hot and sour soup, an egg roll, fried rice, and a side salad. This was a big portioned meal for $7 with tax.

Avoid - No Complaints.

Service - Standard. Competent, but not very friendly. They take your order, bring your food, and fulfill your requests.

Space - Lots of light, nice and airy (unlike a lot of Chinese restaurants)

Would come back - If I am in the area for lunch and want Chinese food.

excerpts: The Chicken Fried rice was decent as well (needed salt and pepper as per usual).
BUT the General Tsao's Chicken NOT GOOD, and NEEDS ALOT of improvement -
it was deep fried until it was poofy, and then sogged down in a pile of thin watery sauce in the box (a puddle), and it was nearly flavorless.
Tell Chef Yum Yum to try PF Changs "Changs Chicken", or even Panda Express!
Something a little more sticky, less water, and less deep friend - or change the deep fry recipe to include a sticky sauce mixture like bbq ribs.
I've had alot of General Chicken in my life and this was the worst
, I'm not angry, just disappointed.
Please fix this Chef Yum Yum!
fried rice.author: Jean P.
fried rice.review: I ordered delivery.  It was super fast and on time.  The portion sizes were great (american style).  The Mongolian Beef was tasty.  The Chicken Fried rice was decent as well (needed salt and pepper as per usual).  BUT the General Tsao's Chicken NOT GOOD, and NEEDS ALOT of improvement - it was deep fried until it was poofy, and then sogged down in a pile of thin watery sauce in the box (a puddle), and it was nearly flavorless.  Tell Chef Yum Yum to try PF Changs "Changs Chicken", or even Panda Express! Something a little more sticky, less water, and less deep friend - or change the deep fry recipe to include a sticky sauce mixture like bbq ribs.  I've had alot of General Chicken in my life and this was the worst, I'm not angry, just disappointed.  Please fix this Chef Yum Yum!

excerpts: Delivery was super fast (about 25 minutes to deliver to the inner richmond) and you get free chow mein or fried rice if you buy two entrees.
Thanks for the advice, Yelp!
fried rice.author: Ronald T.
fried rice.review:
If you're looking for good Americanized chinese take-out, this place will not disappoint. They've got all the classics, and they give you a LOT of it. I don't expect places like this not to be filled with greasy goodness, but it was just a bit too oily for my [highly high brow] taste. 

Delivery was super fast (about 25 minutes to deliver to the inner richmond) and you get free chow mein or fried rice if you buy two entrees. Thanks for the advice, Yelp!

excerpts: Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!)
fried rice.author: Megan J.
fried rice.review:
We are new to the Pac Hts neighborhood so I jumped on Yelp to figure out where to grab bomb Chinese food.  Yum Yum came highly recommended from the majority of Yelpers and STILL managed to exceed our expectations. The prices are surprisingly reasonable and the food is insanely flavorful and fresh.  Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.  Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.  Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!) and Yum Yum just added 4 devotees to their customer base. 

The service was also uber-friendly.  Since we placed our order during a World Series game (aka they were slammed with orders), they suggested that we pick up in 15 minutes rather than wait the 45-60 mins for delivery.  And, then, when we arrived at the restaurant, thanked us profusely for making the effort to come to them.

excerpts:
They make excellent Kung Pao and my favorite Chicken Fried Rice. 

They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.
fried rice.author: L. L.
fried rice.review:
Ha! I have no affiliation with Yum Yum Hunan, just a coincidence we chose the same name!

I have been ordering delivery from this place for a couple years. Their service is lightning fast, always courteous, and the food is great!

I'm very picky about my Chinese food yet I'm the kind of person that will eat at the scary, dirty, hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurants my friends are too afraid to try. I usually shy away from Hunan style food because I think the sauces are too rich for me. I hate dishes where my food is swimming in gloppy sauce! But for some reason, Yum Yum's Hunan I find delicious and the sauces are not overwhelming.

They have all the classics but make them especially well. They also have a very long list of "Specials" with unique gourmet offerings such as Mongolian Lamb, Mango Broccoli Prawn and Pork-stuffed Eggplant and Tofu. This is probably the first time I've ever had orange chicken that was made using real orange and orange zest (no neon-orange flavorless goop!) They even garnished it! They make excellent Kung Pao and my favorite Chicken Fried Rice. 

I especially adore that they offer meatless chicken because then my vegetarian husband can eat with me. They offer 5 meatless chicken dishes and 11 vegetarian entree options! Wow!

They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.

The people who answer the phone speak English perfectly so there are never communication issues. They are always friendly and sweet. The delivery guys arrive at your door super fast and are always a pleasure to deal with. These people really *get* customer service!

I am always pleased with the food and service at Yum Yum. What is there not to love?

excerpts: They are lightning fast, will deliver to your house if you're lazy, and offer a free container of tasty fried rice (I prefer vegetable) if you order 2 or more entrees (noodles, sadly, are not considered entrees).
fried rice.author: Krystle S.
fried rice.review:
On the whole, the food is A-OK.  The majority of their menu consists of pieces of chicken/beef/fish deep fried with a sticky sauce poured over them :( but there are a few gems like the vegetarian hong kong style noodle and string bean chicken that I totally love.

The service is what makes me a fan.  They are lightning fast, will deliver to your house if you're lazy, and offer a free container of tasty fried rice (I prefer vegetable) if you order 2 or more entrees (noodles, sadly, are not considered entrees).

excerpts: I ordered fried rice and peking duck.
Taste was okay.
not too bad.
But there is definitely room for improvement.
Very fast though!
fried rice.author: Julian C.
fried rice.review: Just ordered for delivery through iPhone yelp app.  Food was here within 20 mins.  Very fast.  I ordered fried rice and peking duck.  Taste was okay. not too bad.  But there is definitely room for improvement.  Very fast though!

excerpts: I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing.
Great place for Chinese food.
fried rice.author: Mario C.
fried rice.review: Ive been going to Yum-yum ever since they were at the Valencia location and since then, them moving I've followed them like a stalker, lol... I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing. Great place for Chinese food.

excerpts: Once we also ordered Orange Fake Meat Chicken (or whatever more appealing name they have for it) and got a free fried rice, and they were good enough to stuff our faces with until we thought we were going to explode, but it was way way way too much food for the two of us.
fried rice.author: Shaina 'Occasionally Rahn' K.
fried rice.review:
Until further notice, I am sticking by this five star review. For the past month and a half, I have ordered from this Chinese restaurant every Sunday at exactly 11AM (when they start delivery). And no, I'm not some fat, greasy slob. I am young, I am fit, and I like to think that I know good food.

My gf and I always share General Tsao's Chicken, 1 brown rice, and 1 veggie potstickers. Once we also ordered Orange Fake Meat Chicken (or whatever more appealing name they have for it) and got a free fried rice, and they were good enough to stuff our faces with until we thought we were going to explode, but it was way way way too much food for the two of us.

So let's break it down.
General Tsao's: Arrives hot, doesn't leave grease marks on the packaging. Broccoli has been well cooked every time, except once when it was a bit overdone, but still pretty good. Also, tasty.
Brown rice: Too often restaurant undercook brown rice thinking it cooks like white rice. Yum Yum gets it right. Simply steamed.
Veggie Potstickers: Like the others, comes hot, tastes fresh. Good by themselves, without any extra sauce. Although I do like to rub the last one in the General Tsao's sauce once the take-out thing is empty.
Speed: 20-40 minutes. Again, I order when they just start delivery, so there's no back-up from a bunch of other people ordering unless they're just like me.
Service: Always nice on the phone, never had to be on hold. The delivery guy is always nice, and always has change.
Price: With tip, I think we pay $19 for this meal for two. Not bad, eh?

Don't listen to the haters: this place is definitely worth the cash you just found in that coat you haven't worn for months.

excerpts: Order two entrees and get a free order of fried rice (veggie, chicken, beef)
I always get the veggie fried rice.
fried rice.author: Mina B.
fried rice.review:
My favorite local Chinese delivery spot.

Order two entrees and get a free order of fried rice (veggie, chicken, beef) OR chow mein.  I always get the veggie fried rice. 

They give you hearty portions!  My husband and I always get their sesame chicken w/ broccoli. This dish doesn't have broccoli on the menu but, just ask for it w/ broccoli. You can balance the fried sweet chicken pieces with some steamed veggies. 

Other dishes tried that we liked was the drunken beef and basil beef...both very good.

excerpts: If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free.
fried rice.author: Yasi S.
fried rice.review:
I remember this place when it was back on Valencia: so so so delicious! Thank you for moving! Thank you for remaining in business!

Their food is extremely fresh and has a vibrancy of flavors. Their sauces are so well spiced and delicious without bordering on the "tastes right out of a bottle!" that more mediocre Chinese restaurants seem to specialize in. Also, there's a surprising lack of "oh, wonder what kind of mystery meat that is?!" situation going on. And finally, they have several dishes that deviate from your standard Chinese take-out menus that we've all come to memorize, unfortunately...

They're definitely a cut above the standard Chinese food in SF but I like them just a little less than the California Chinese that Eric's  http://www.yelp.com/biz/erics-restaurant-san-francisco and Alice's made famous.



Good to know:

Spicy Mandarin Eggplant is fabulous as is the real-orange Orange Chicken

Drunken Beef is meh

If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free. Sometimes you have to ask for it though.


Unfortunately, I can tell by my frenetic eating, putting away, returning, nibbling, yearning, wanting of Yum Yum's food that they almost certainly use MSG. And there's no large font denials of it on their menus, so it's safe to say, they use MSG. With great success. And probably a lot of it. My hands are actually shaking right now...just a little bit....after eating almost half of the entire order of Orange Chicken...and still....wanting .....more......

So that's minus 1 star. For my MSG hangover from eating waaaay too much good Yum Yum.

I am going to try to ask them to make my order without MSG next time. I'l let you know how it goes.

excerpts: The best part is that if you order two entrees, you get a FREE order of chow mein or fried rice!
Service is always great and call in orders are ready to pick up in 15-20 minutes.
I have never tried the delivery service because I live so close.
Best Chinese food in the area!
fried rice.author: Bobby J.
fried rice.review:
After moving to a new neighborhood the first thing to do is to find the closest GOOD Chinese restaurant. Done and done.
Being a vegetarian, it is hard to find Chinese food that is more than just tofu and veggies. Yum Yum Hunan has filled that void with a "meatless chicken" section of the menu! The lemon and orange "chicken" dishes are amazing! I think even voracious carnivores would love these dishes. 
Their standard vegetarian section also boasts more than 10 entrees. 
The prices here are really good for the large portions you get. Rice is extra, but cheap: $1 for white $1.25 for brown.
The best part is that if you order two entrees, you get a FREE order of chow mein or fried rice!
Service is always great and call in orders are ready to pick up in 15-20 minutes. I have never tried the delivery service because I live so close.
Best Chinese food in the area!

excerpts: If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice...
the FREE chicken fried is awesome!!
i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies.
the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it.
for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00.....
i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout
fried rice.author: Kimberly S.
fried rice.review: Best chinese food delivery! Prices are cheap, delivery is quick, and the food is delicious. If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice... the FREE chicken fried is awesome!! i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies. the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it. also tried the combo noodle soup - very fat noodles (-) but  a lot of great meats and veggies in it (++). for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00..... i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout :)

excerpts:
As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. 
I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.
fried rice.author: Daniela R.
fried rice.review:
A friend and I were up studying late and called in to order Chinese delivery here; I was worried that we'd get DENIED because it was probably ten minutes before the closing time listed on their website. 

However, the guy who took our order (and I second the reviewer on here who compared him to a Chinese Grandpa!) was extremely accommodating and friendly.

I was expecting the delivery in probably half an hour or something, but I got a call from the delivery guy less than fifteen minutes later. 

Now, if I'd known about the FREE RICE that would've come with ordering two entrees for delivery, I might've saved myself some money. As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

Not only was the food plentiful, but it was RIDICU-LICIOUSLY NOMSOME. It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.

I'm almost certainly going to call Yum Yum Hunan again when I want Chinese food delivered....and next time I'm going to take advantage of the free rice/chow mein. ;D

excerpts: Kung Pao Fried Rice:
I know,
I know - Why more Kung Pao?
I don't know.
But the rice was great!
So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.
fried rice.author: R D.
fried rice.review:
This was some good Chinese Delivery.  The guy on the phone was really nice and helpful and we got our food in the time that he specified.  Huge portions and fresh vegetables - not overcooked!

We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!  Lightly fried (not greasy) and very tasty!  Obviously made with real orange.  I ordered this for me, but my boyfriend ate most of it!

Kung Pao Chicken: The veggies in this were amazing!  So perfectly cooked and tons of them!  The chicken, however, was a bit rubbery and fatty...thus the boyfriend eating my chicken!

Kung Pao Fried Rice: I know, I know - Why more Kung Pao?  I don't know.  But the rice was great!  So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.  Alas, the chicken in this was the same as the chicken in the previous dish.

I will order from Yum Yum again, just not the Kung Pao Chickens.

excerpts: I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.
We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.
fried rice.author: Therese H.
fried rice.review:
I may have found a new hot spot for the new neighborhood I am living in.

We stopped by, hungry after moving furniture due to the high recommendation that came from a friend.  

It was early for dinner time and we were one of two tables full.  

The staff was very pleasant and the food was great!

The portions we very big and i noticed quite a few things that were exciting to me on the menu:

The first is free delivery, very handy even if you're right across the way.  I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.  There was quite a lot of seafood as well as veggie options, which even included seitan/soy meat or "meatless chicken"  

We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.  This was plenty for two, plus leftovers.

I willl definitly be back to try more of the menu :)

excerpts: Our staple:  Everything fried rice (w/out shrimp), Mongolian Beef, and Chicken Chow Fun.
Enough for dinner  for 2 and lunch the next day.
fried rice.author: Alexis M.
fried rice.review:
Prompt, yummy, and you can understand what they say over the phone!

Never actually been, but when in need of a Chinese food fix, Yum Yum is who we call.

Our staple:  Everything fried rice (w/out shrimp), Mongolian Beef, and Chicken Chow Fun.    Enough for dinner  for 2 and lunch the next day.

excerpts: And get this...they give a FREE side of chow main or fried rice with two entrees, and the side is the size of a whole dish, and its delicious.
fried rice.author: Jenn T.
fried rice.review:
Heck YES!! Yum yum is YUM YUMS!! (so cheesy) So incredibly THRILLED to give a two thumbs up review to a Chinese food delivery spot. So many times I have ordered Chinese delivery and the food for the most part has been has been nasty, mushy, mystery meat. C avarage food at BEST. BLECH! The last place we called before yum yum even forgot to put the chicken in our CHICKEN and eggplant dish! Whaaaat? What is that?! 

Yum Yum is amazing. High quality chicken and beef, amazing flavors and no soggy veggies! And get this...they give a FREE side of chow main or fried rice with two entrees, and the side is the size of a whole dish, and its delicious. 

They even have "meatless" options for your lovely vegan and veggie freinds. Yay! 

We were so pleased and now Yum Yum's menu is on the fridge and all the MILLION others that get put on our front door handle with a rubber band are goin in the T-R-A-S-H. Thanks Yum Yum for doing it RIGHT and at a great price.

excerpts: The spicy fried rice and lo mein hit the spot and weren't too greasy.
fried rice.author: Kim K.
fried rice.review: Need delivery for your first night in a new apartment?  Yum Yum Hunan is your place. Tylical chinese menu selections, but executed well.  The spicy fried rice and lo mein hit the spot and weren't too greasy.

excerpts: Fried rice is free with a delivery order and delivery is very fast.
fried rice.author: Mark F.
fried rice.review:
Probably one of the best Hunan places in the city. Food is flavorful and rich. Extra points for having really good fake chicken. Fried rice is free with a delivery order and delivery is very fast.

I especially love the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and Singapore noodles.

Their dim sum stinks, though. The spring rolls and pot stickers are inedible, but the entrees are sooooo good that it doesn't loose them stars in my book.

excerpts: There fried rice is pretty good too.
prices got a lil high recently and if u pay with your ATM it has to be a minimun of $10 ...weak
fried rice.author: Rene L.
fried rice.review: This place is pretty good, Usually me an my boys order food from there and get it delivered sinced its close to work it usually gets there pretty fast. There chow mein is really flavorful. One of my Favs is there salt and pepper crispy spareribs its delicious. There fried rice is pretty good too. prices got a lil high recently and if u pay with your ATM it has to be a minimun of $10 ...weak

excerpts: Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice.
fried rice.author: Tara M.
fried rice.review: This is our GO-TO Chinese food spot. Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice. AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB). Enjoy! - We always Do! Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.

excerpts:
We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons
fried rice.author: Melissa J.
fried rice.review:
Super fast delivery.

Everything was fresh and delicious. They use real chicken... not that sketchy stuff that they call "chicken" at other takeout Chinese restaurants.

We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons

We were also happy with the free Chicken Chow Mein. That was a nice surprise.  So why not 5 stars?

The egg drop soup was a big thumbs down. It tasted fishy. We bought a big container of it and tossed the whole thing. ick.

I won't hold it against them though - everything else was excellent!

excerpts: Kung Pao, and Fried Rice can be had here.
I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much.
So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum.
They deliver too, which was another reason to try.
The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good.
You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish.
You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable.
Try it!
fried rice.author: Michael M.
fried rice.review:
Two of the best possible combinations ... Kung Pao, and Fried Rice can be had here. 

I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much. So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum. They deliver too, which was another reason to try. I also tried the Mongolian Beef and Pot Stickers to get a feel for it. I had plenty for lunch the next day. 

The Pot Stickers were OK, and not filled very much with pork and cabbage goodness, but the sauce that came with it, was very good. The Mongolian Beef didn't have much of the rice noodles that come as a filler, which is a good thing. It was spicy, and not too full of green onions which I have a hard time chewing. 

The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good. You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish. You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable. Try it! It's not as spicy as it could be, but throw in some chile sauce if you want.

Delivery was quick. I think I'll order Kung Pao Beef this time!

excerpts: Perfect for two, they have a great deal of tossing in free fried rice or chow mein with an order of two entrees.
fried rice.author: Marsha Z.
fried rice.review:
I'm still partial to Ken's Kitchen when I'm craving meatless chicken due to their proximity and quick delivery, but Yum Yum has a slight edge in quality.  Perfect for two, they have a great deal of tossing in free fried rice or chow mein with an order of two entrees.

I've always done take out, but their dining area is bigger and brighter than what I remember from when they were in the Mission.  Aside from Tataki, I'm not a huge fan of any of the restaurants on this side of Divis, so I'm glad Yum Yum provides another option of good food to the area.

excerpts: Sure - I love screeching my wheels around a 90* turn into a rare Clement Street parking spot to grab BBQ duck, dim sum and fluffy fried rice.
fried rice.author: Juliana C.
fried rice.review:
Yay!  A solid, high quality Chinese restaurant that delivers.

I'm in the Inner Richmond.  Surrounded by Chinese food... practically none of it delivered.  Sure - I love screeching my wheels around a 90* turn into a rare Clement Street parking spot to grab BBQ duck, dim sum and fluffy fried rice.  

But when it's pouring outside...  When it's really raining in buckets...  When I've got two kids in tow (ack, it's sleepover night and I'm low on groceries)... plus a bf who wants something tasty and meaty, and I'm pooped and all I reeeeally want to do is watch a cheesy Sci Fi flick next to the man on the couch while some fresh-faced dude brings us good eats...  THEN you need delivery.  Actually need it, mind you...  As a sanity tool.

Yum Yum is now my official Sanity Tool for
1. Chinese food cravings at odd hours
2. Delivery food need - any hour
3.  Pot stickers for the afficionado and kid-diner alike
4. String beans with anything.

Dude, the string beans rocked.  And I got to watch a whole movie AND the rain slamming down on the cars outside from my toasty livingroom where I watched my cheesy flick with my lovely man.  (The kids wrought havoc in the bedroom - the result being something a bit Midwestern on the Weather Channel - This used to be my daughter's room..." Etc.).

Smiling, very wet delivery guy took my signature.  And did NOT ask for my card (Which typically requires my screaming around to find it  - oh here it is, now hold it up and scribble all over my nicely painted walls please).  Yay.

You have no idea how much I love them for not insisting on seeing my card. :)  You mean you actually trust me to pay my bill?  Awesome.

Did I mention the food is 4 Stars?  Absolutely 4 Stars.

And as a non-Chinese speaker with a fairly well developed palate for Chinese food - including the regional specialties... yes I do, in fact, appreciate that they speak intelligible English on the phone.

Oh - and I ordered with no menu.  Just asking if they had "something like this, or that... and maybe String beans."  I got polite help, and no attitude. 

Lovely.  I'm a fan.

excerpts: The chicken fried rice was greasy but good and cure those hangover hungers.
fried rice.author: Rocky K.
fried rice.review:
Got delivery from here after an epic Halloween nights involving broken teeth, crashing Mexican parties, and passing out on the streets.

The sesame and General's chicken tasted exactly the same, except one was mildy spicy and the other had sesame seeds on it. Also, the chicken was breaded, and not a little breaded, but rather like there was a clearance on bread crumbs (do Chinese people use bread crumbs?)

Hot and sour soup was nice, but I love that stuff, so you can douse some shit with hot and sour soup and I'll still love it.

The chicken fried rice was greasy but good and cure those hangover hungers. And no the chicken wasn't breaded.

The delivery guy was a champ though. Found where we were in an alley and put up with me answering the door wearing just underwear and a sailor's cap. I wonder what he thinks we we're doing in there. Haha.

Yum Yum is at best, so-so. Unless you're in desperate need of hangover food.

excerpts: Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?
BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy?
BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?
fried rice.author: Marie K.
fried rice.review:
This place gets five stars not because it is the most spectacular Chinese food ever (it isn't) but because it does exactly what it is supposed to... deliver hot, tasty American-Chinese food promptly and for a reasonable price, with no screwups.  

Egg rolls?  Crispy and delicious, check, ample sweet and sour, check.
Orange chicken?  Neither sticky nor soggy, good quality meat, actual orange peel in the sauce.
Hot and sour soup?  Above average, delivered in generous quantity and still hot.  We were glad we ordered two.....mmm leftovers.
Noodles? Buttery and just greasy enough, crunchy fresh veggies mixed in.
Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?  BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy? BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?  $40

We'll be back... well actually, geeky delivery boy will be back to our apartment.

excerpts: The chicken fried rice is good and the egg rolls are pretty tasty as well.
fried rice.author: Jenny W.
fried rice.review:
I don't know about this place. It's pretty convienent as a good friend of mine lives down the street. The hot and sour soup was pretty quality and I was enjoying my chicken until I found like some sort of piece of plastic in it (WHAT?).  The chicken fried rice is good and the egg rolls are pretty tasty as well.  

The service was friendly and fast, too.  Sadly, I probably won't be back, but am sure there's tons of other good Chinese food in the city.

excerpts: Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.
And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery.
fried rice.author: Matthew C.
fried rice.review:
Yum Yum's name is a perfect fit. Consistent good quality, fast delivery and great price. 

Possibly the best Chinese delivery we have had. We live in the Inner Richmond and have tried MANY different Chinese restaurants. More than I can recall.  

They do all the traditional dishes, plus many original creations. Try the Lovers Shrimp or the Yum Yum Delicatessen, both winners. Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.

And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery. Makes it easy and less expensive to please the whole family, kids and neighbors.

With so many for-to-go options, it's nice to find one I have no qualms about calling again & again.

Glad we "found" out about Yum Yum. Now you know about them too.

excerpts: Our last delivery order was spot on: Buddha's delight claypot, general tsao chicken and vegetable fried rice.
The décor is nice with white table cloth but is nothing special unlike Eliza's.
However so far we haven't had to wait at lunchtime.
fried rice.author: Elsa T.
fried rice.review:
Thanks Yelp for getting us to try Yum Yum. We had walked past this restaurant a thousand time because for walking-distance Chinese we would just go to Eliza's. We are so glad we now know because their food feels very healthy and fresh. And they deliver!!!!!!
Our last delivery order was spot on: Buddha's delight claypot, general tsao chicken and vegetable fried rice. $20.
The décor is nice with white table cloth but is nothing special unlike Eliza's. However so far we haven't had to wait at lunchtime.

excerpts: Sour Soup, General Tso's, Shrimp Fried Rice, Moo Shu Pork, and they even threw in some free Chicken Chow Mein.
fried rice.author: Nish N.
fried rice.review:
We ordered from Yum Yum last night, and I'd say for delivery, these folks live up to their name. The guy who took our order was almost excited to hear from me, service with a smile through that phone, I tell you.

Since this was my first time with them, I played it standard -- Hot 'n' Sour Soup, General Tso's, Shrimp Fried Rice, Moo Shu Pork, and they even threw in some free Chicken Chow Mein.

The Tso's wasn't the best I've had, but everything arrived in under 45 minutes, pretty hot, and for a little shy of forty bucks. Will definitely order from them again, giving them the potsticker test... 3.5 stars for now!

excerpts: Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees.
The man who took my order was nice.
The food came fast too.
The chow mein was decent, though bland.
The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it.
The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess..
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place.
We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad-
I hate to waste.
Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
fried rice.author: Rachel D.
fried rice.review:
Oh Nuh Uh!

I had just today told my Sweetie that finally I was learning to like Chinese food (a special shout out & a thx to Nan King Road Bistro for making that possible). We like to occasionally order in on Sunday nights & got flyered by YYH. Their menu was appealing so we thought to give them a try.
Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees. The man who took my order was nice. The food came fast too.
We ordered: dim sum sampler (I give it 1 out of 5 stars), apps sampler (the Crab Rangoon and potstickers were a 3 out of 5, but the fried shrimp and the egg roll were beyond greasy, with an aftertaste.. negative two stars). The chow mein was decent, though bland. The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it. The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess.. 
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place. We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad- I hate to waste. However, the fortunes in the cookies were auspicious.

Pros: Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
Cons: The food.

Yuk Yuk Hunan- good for diet, bad for me.

excerpts: Even the chicken fried rice was bad - the chicken was chewy and again, I had to spit it out.
I will not be ordering from here again.
fried rice.author: Allison S.
fried rice.review: I ordered from Yum Yum tonight for delivery. I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken. Both entrees are in the trash. I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.  Even the chicken fried rice was bad - the chicken was chewy and again, I had to spit it out. I will not be ordering from here again.

excerpts: For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.
fried rice.author: Janet L.
fried rice.review:
I wish I could give this a slightly higher rating just for service and cleanliness, but alas I'm unable to award half a star to bring it up to a 3.5.

The peking duck was nicely done and flavorful, accompanied by four fluffy buns, but we were a little disappointed by how little scallion they sent us away with.  The drunken beef with celery, mushrooms and snow peas tasted fairly healthy, but the sauce wasn't spectacular.  I slathered the soft pieces of beef in sriracha, as is my custom with mild foods.  The complimentary noodle dish was a winner!  For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.  They were nice enough to accomodate a change to chow fun.

All in all, I think this is a fine establishment and definitely a bargain for this area!

excerpts: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.
fried rice.author: Ileana H.
fried rice.review:
Formerly known as Hunan China, it feels as if there's been a lot of revamping.

From:
-a new green awning with white font
-the interior (now a mustard yellow type color with white trim)
-more indoor plants
-perhaps new tables and chairs
-new tea pots
I could go on...but...AN ALTOGETHER CLEANER FEEL. 

A new menu item I did see: Mango Chicken (decent). 

Lunch is only served until 3pm. I believe the lunch special is only for weekdays.

What you get for SIX BUCKS: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.

I did spot that they do serve Sierra Nevada for $3. Awesome.

excerpts: They even do the free fried rice or chow mein deal for dinner delivery..
fried rice.author: Missy B.
fried rice.review:
Look. I am just.. way too stoked about this to be funny right now.. 

I guess they've been open now for ten days and nobody's noticed yet, but according to the manager here, THE WHOLE kitchen staff from Yum Yum House on Valencia came over to this new Divisadero location..

Same cute font! Same menu! Same free delivery.. They even do the free fried rice or chow mein deal for dinner delivery.. 

This is.. just.. awesome.. I have to go get some water and calm down..

excerpts: Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice.
All of it was amazing.
I want to come back and try more of their menu.
fried rice.author: Bobby P.
fried rice.review:
Finally, I try somewhere I have had bookmarked forever. I would like to Holla at Rita C. for suggesting this place weeks ago. I wish I would have heeded her advice earlier because this place is really good. 

The food was yum, yum and then some. And on top of that it was Hunan. The name really does sum the place up. I went with a friend after happy hour at Fishbowl and we couldn't have been happier. We ordered the appetizer platter that came with pot stickers, egg rolls, crab ragoon, and some shrimp thing. We also got sesame chicken, Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice. All of it was amazing. I want to come back and try more of their menu. It was so damn good. 

Yum Yum is up there on my list of favorite Chinese places for sure. Thanks Rita!

excerpts: We had the fried rice and basil beef - so good!
We also ordered the sesame scallops and some appetizers.
We had leftovers for a party of four,  and took the rest to go (asked for some forks & they even gave us more fortune cookies!)
fried rice.author: Leslie K.
fried rice.review:
Wish we had one in L.A.! 

For a late lunch, we drove by and found this spot. We decided to try the The Five Flavor chicken - it  was delicious! We had the fried rice and basil beef - so good! We also ordered the sesame scallops and some appetizers. We had leftovers for a party of four,  and took the rest to go (asked for some forks & they even gave us more fortune cookies!) After hanging out at the Exploratorium for a while we scarfed the rest down before leaving to catch our flight home. 

Good food, and not at all oily. Will be back next time we are in town!

excerpts:
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein
fried rice.author: Kris B.
fried rice.review:
I used their takeout and have eaten at the restaurant. Food comes out  fairly quick and the servers are nice.

Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein

the list goes on...

Almost anything I order is great. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.

excerpts:
Kungo Pao Fried Rice (too many peanuts)
Great meatless orange chicken!
Spoke English, yeah!
fried rice.author: Kindra W.
fried rice.review:
Fast delivery... 
Kungo Pao Fried Rice (too many peanuts)
Great meatless orange chicken!  
Spoke English, yeah!

excerpts: Free vegie fried rice.
$23 with delivery and tip.
fried rice.author: Mrs F.
fried rice.review:
Szechuan broccoli $7.95 fantastic.  I love the sauce.  I drizzle it on my rice.
Walnut prawns $10 not too bad.  First time having this dish.  I didn't know it was deep fried AND had mayo.  Wouldn't order it next time.  13 prawns.  
Free vegie fried rice.  $23 with delivery and tip.  Same nice young man in glasses.

Solid place and just as good second time around.  Very happy I have a Chinese place I can count on time and again and hopefully for many more years to come.

excerpts: vege fried rice!
fried rice.author: SF Blondie B.
fried rice.review:
THANK THE LORD!!! yum yums is back. i was never able to find a chinese delivery that came to par with these guys. i went chinese-less since they closed up shop in the mission. 

I ordered delivery last week  @ 10:30pm and they came in 30 min! whoo hoo.

i order......
potstickers- my favorite!
sesame chicken- great 
vege fried rice!

yum yum is DOUBLE YUM!

excerpts: The free fried rice with big slices of zucchini rocks!
Salt & Pepper prawns, perfect, 5-Spice Chicken ... flavorful.
The Hot & Sour Soup ... not very impressed.
fried rice.author: CatherineLouise A.
fried rice.review: Went with the STARS and was not dissappointed! The free fried rice with big slices of zucchini rocks! Salt & Pepper prawns, perfect, 5-Spice Chicken ... flavorful. The Hot & Sour Soup ... not very impressed.

excerpts: Great Mix Veggies, house fried rice, and chow mein.
The delivery time is quick and the price is reasonable, if not unpriced.
The only thing I disliked is the hot sauce they mix in their food to create hot dishes.
It is kinda yucky!
I opted to just add my own hot sauce later.
Good Food.
fried rice.author: Pawanpreet G.
fried rice.review:
Yummy for Your Tummy.

The name fits the food. Great Mix Veggies, house fried rice, and chow mein.  The delivery time is quick and the price is reasonable, if not unpriced. The only thing I disliked is the hot sauce they mix in their food to create hot dishes. It is kinda yucky! I opted to just add my own hot sauce later. Good Food.

excerpts: With 2 entrees, you can get free fried rice or lo mein.
fried rice.author: maranda w.
fried rice.review:
Yum Yum is my "eating my feelings" food favorite. On those awful days at work, I come home and my husband just sees the look on my face and hands me the Yum Yum Hunan menu.  I already know exactly what i'm going to order, but look at it again anyway.

The food is SO tasty and cheap-- and FAST that its a no brainer. Tons of food in each entree-- so much so there is always leftovers. Their meatless chicken is effing awesome for quality/texture and so delicious! With 2 entrees, you can get free fried rice or lo mein. My husband loves that.

Its seriously cheaper to eat here than to cook at home, if you can believe it. So my guilt for eating out is at least diminished.

excerpts:
combo chow main: not that great 
combo fried rice: much better than the noodles 
fresh OJ:

goood! 
40$ish 
quick delivery
call in order, i found the menu here, awesome app!
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu
fried rice.author: Sataya B.
fried rice.review:
combo dim sum: good, shrimp dumplings, pork balls, were the best, pork buns were ok 
mandarin eggplant: not spicy like it said it would be :) 
combo chow main: not that great 
combo fried rice: much better than the noodles 
fresh OJ: goood! 
40$ish 
quick delivery 
call in order, i found the menu here, awesome app! 
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu

excerpts: As for the entree, the portion size was very satisfying: a hearty serving of steamed or fried rice with a small bit of iceberg lettuce salad, a spring roll, and a large portion of the scallops and broccoli.
While I felt there was a good amount of scallop in my dish, it was saturated in a cloyingly sweet, heavy sauce and was not garlicky.
The spring roll was good but the salad was kind of pointless and dressed in a very sweet dressing that tasted similar to the scallop dish sauce.
fried rice.author: Jenny K.
fried rice.review:
This review is based on the lunch special I had recently. I live nearby and had been curious to try this restaurant for a while. 

I was seated during the lunch rush. I ordered the lunch special of garlic scallops and broccoli. I was very disappointed by the food. I was almost immediately served some hot and sour soup and a pot of tea. The soup was lukewarm and bland. As for the entree, the portion size was very satisfying: a hearty serving of steamed or fried rice with a small bit of iceberg lettuce salad, a spring roll, and a large portion of the scallops and broccoli. While I felt there was a good amount of scallop in my dish, it was saturated in a cloyingly sweet, heavy sauce and was not garlicky. The spring roll was good but the salad was kind of pointless and dressed in a very sweet dressing that tasted similar to the scallop dish sauce. I wanted lunch not dessert!

The restaurant was really busy so the server took some time to clear my soup bowl, bring me my entree, and get me the check. 

Given the generally positive reviews for Yum Yum, I feel like I should give this place another chance. I at least know never to order the garlic scallops and broccoli again.

excerpts: and the shrimp fried rice was great too.
and i have i to say these guys were incredibly quick in getting this stuff delivered considering that the weather was awful and that it was 5 o'clock.
i would definitely order from here again!
fried rice.author: Jubi N.
fried rice.review: Ok really good chinese take out/delivery.  The food was really good, we got the general tso's chicken and the drunken beef.  i'm a big fan of having fresh and crisp veggies in my chinese food.  and i have to say the veggies looked fresh and tasted just right.  not crazy salty and drenched in thick sauce.  and the shrimp fried rice was great too.  and i have i to say these guys were incredibly quick in getting this stuff delivered considering that the weather was awful and that it was 5 o'clock.  i would definitely order from here again!

excerpts: I also like the chow fun and kung pao fried rice.
They close earlier than most places so order before 10.
Im gonna miss this place when I move!
fried rice.author: M K.
fried rice.review: This is the best chinese food delivery I have had in SF. They have a huge affordable menu and serve a large variety of dishes. Delivery is very fast and food comes hot hot hot! The seafood and veggies are always very fresh. I recommend the eggrolls, and shrimp with eggplant and basil- its thai inspired. I also like the chow fun and kung pao fried rice. They close earlier than most places so order before 10. Im gonna miss this place when I move!

excerpts: I found the won ton soup to be way too salty (and I love salt), and the pork fried rice was just so-so.
fried rice.author: J D.
fried rice.review: I ordered delivery - and the service was great... very prompt, but the food was just ok.  I found the won ton soup to be way too salty (and I love salt), and the pork fried rice was just so-so.  As for the kung pao chicken, that was pretty good but nothing special. I probably won't order from Yum Yum again.

excerpts: My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2!
I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped.
It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken.
They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea.
Good food.
fried rice.author: Alex E.
fried rice.review: I like the food here for the most part. It's well priced, quick, and yummy. I feel there could be a bit more to quality in the food. I had their orange chicken once and it was good, and a lot. My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2! I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped. It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken. They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea. Good food.

excerpts: I decided on the staple of Kung Pao Chicken and w/ fried rice, but you do have a choice of steamed and even brown rice (which is great)!
fried rice.author: Eric R.
fried rice.review:
Took a shot at Yum Yum for the first time today based on the reviews and because it is closer then my regular haunts on Clement. I have to say, I was very pleased. First off, this place is clean, bright and friendly. Service was real quick and the staff had a cup of Hot and Sour soup, fresh tea w/pot and water in front of me within a minute of seating. I went for the lunch special which was a great value at $5.50. I decided on the staple of Kung Pao Chicken and w/ fried rice, but you do have a choice of steamed and even brown rice (which is great)! 

The food plate arrived piping hot and extremely quick. Yes, they weren't that busy now at 2:30, but still, very impressive. It was a generous lunch portion and even came with a nice side salad with a light sweet dressing and a free egg roll. Now we are talking. The dish was pleasantly spiced, great sauce (NO MSG) and everything was extremely fresh and the veggies were all properly cooked and retained their natural flavor. I was getting full about 1/2 to 3/4's of the way through the dish and that generally never happens with Chinese lunch specials. However, I couldn't put down the fork. It definitely hit the spot. 

I will be going here again for dinner with friends to order more of my favorites and continue to sample the menu. Btw - even the bathroom was extremely clean, well decorated, stocked and nice hand soap :) That is a good sign of the overall attention to detail and cleanliness of a restaurant.

excerpts: I have ordered the beef broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, vegetable fried rice, beef chow mein,  sizzling rice soup, and mushroom chicken.
I wasn't a big fan of the mushroom chicken but everything else has been great here.
Very flavorful and inexpensive.
fried rice.author: Marissa Z.
fried rice.review: This place is great. The service is fast and efficient. I usually order take out and have eaten their once. I have ordered the beef broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, vegetable fried rice, beef chow mein,  sizzling rice soup, and mushroom chicken. I wasn't a big fan of the mushroom chicken but everything else has been great here. Very flavorful and inexpensive.

excerpts: i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice.
that pisses me off.
he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty.
the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.
fried rice.author: A F.
fried rice.review:
I dig this place, great food, not too greasy, ordered the orange meatless chicken and for someone who's not a huge fan of tofu i was blown away. taste real, real good. 
i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice. that pisses me off. he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty. the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.

excerpts: I would recommend highly the Dry Garlic Shrimp... nice spice, really great... loved the fried rice as well.
Tried the spicy crispy pork... not a fan
but thats
ok...
fried rice.author: Carol F.
fried rice.review:
Just moved to the neighborhood and was hoping to find a great Chinese take out.... Yum Yum hit the spot!  Tried the Hong Kong Chow Mein for the first time... with chicken.  Chicken was just ok but I would order again with just the veggies...great flavor and fun to eat.  I would recommend highly the Dry Garlic Shrimp... nice spice, really great... loved the fried rice as well.  Tried the spicy crispy pork... not a fan but thats ok... I have tried it before other places and its just me. 

Food was fresh and hot...delivered fast... service was friendly

excerpts: Love the free fried rice with two entrees...
this is definitely my new go-to delivery.
fried rice.author: Kate S.
fried rice.review: GREAT chinese delivery - just ordered this tonight for the first time. Super quick service and the food is fresh and hot and not too greasy. Love the free fried rice with two entrees...this is definitely my new go-to delivery.

excerpts: For about 6  bucks, you get an entree, with your choice of white rice, fried rice OR brown rice.
I love that they have brown rice, and it doens't come at an extra cost either.
Maybe they know that there are serveral hospitals in the area, and they smartly want to cater to the health conscoius crowd.
fried rice.author: Jerry C.
fried rice.review: This place is very close to where I work at, UCSF, so it's a common place for all my co workers and I to head out to for a quick lunch of good solid chinese food. For about 6  bucks, you get an entree, with your choice of white rice, fried rice OR brown rice. I love that they have brown rice, and it doens't come at an extra cost either. Maybe they know that there are serveral hospitals in the area, and they smartly want to cater to the health conscoius crowd. Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef. You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices. Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.

excerpts: With two entrees, you get a free fried rice or noodle and you can get "chow fun" as the noodle entree.
Anytime we order from here we can eat the leftovers for at least 2 more meals.
fried rice.author: Joann C.
fried rice.review: Solid delivery place.  The people are really nice on the phone, and the delivery comes in a reasonable amount of time.  I didn't like the Basil Tofu dish much but that's only because there's a lot of water chestnuts in it.  The Lover's Prawns are great half honey walnut prawns and half prawns in a sweet slightly spicy sauce (if the sauce were spicier it'd be even better).  With two entrees, you get a free fried rice or noodle and you can get "chow fun" as the noodle entree.  Anytime we order from here we can eat the leftovers for at least 2 more meals.

excerpts: To my delight they announced that we get free fried rice or chow mien with 2 entree orders!!!
Ooh...free food, I'm not the one to be complaining.
So, the order was taken and their ferocious wok skills dished out our take out in 5 minutes!
Amazing!
(I guess they wanted to close by 10)
20 minutes later, as we were unpacking our food on our Ikea coffee table, we discovered...
*dramatic pause*....
fried rice.author: LittleBird 8.
fried rice.review:
So our Hunan cravings had led us to Eliza's, but sadly, they were closed by the time we got there (around 945pm ish).  We headed down divisadero, knowing there were was another Hunan joint there.  We discovered Yum Yum Hunan, formerly known as Hunan China Restaurant.  It was already 950pm by the time we arrived and they were happy to accomodate our prompt lateness.  We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.  To my delight they announced that we get free fried rice or chow mien with 2 entree orders!!!  Ooh...free food, I'm not the one to be complaining.  So, the order was taken and their ferocious wok skills dished out our take out in 5 minutes!  Amazing! (I guess they wanted to close by 10)  20 minutes later, as we were unpacking our food on our Ikea coffee table, we discovered...*dramatic pause*....THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!  WHAT THE HELL!!!  With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.  Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.  Yum Yum Hunan would have easily gotten 4.5 shiny red stars from us, but instead, we gave them 3 slightly tarnished yellow stars.  

*Sniff...sniff*...till this very second, as I am typing this review, my discouraged palate is still searching for the hint of eggplant that should be present between the cracks of my teeth.   *SIGH*...

excerpts: and if you get 2 entrees you get a free fried rice or chow mein.
fried rice.author: Matthew R.
fried rice.review: Love this place even when it was over in the mission. I think they have the best meatless chicken stuff anywhere. I eat meat but the lady doesn't but and this places  meatless chicken taste better than the real thing. The five flavor fake chicken is the best thing they have, and the basil fake chicken is also really good. Super friendly , fast delivery and if you get 2 entrees you get a free fried rice or chow mein.

excerpts: My Shrimp fried rice was delightful.
However, I am knocking off 2 stars because (1) why should we give a pass for poor service, irrespective of the cuisine?
I have seen lot of reviews where they say poor service
but what do you expect from Chinese place.
Why is that?
(2) why minimum charge of $10 to accept credit card?
I ordered a soft drink and fried rice.
Am i supposed to stuff myself to meet $10 minimum.
Isn't a fried rice and soft drink enough to fill up a normal person?
I probably go again if I have my family with but not super happy experience.
fried rice.author: Ram G.
fried rice.review: I am patient at UCSF Hellen Diller cancer center (1600 Divisadero). I went for lunch on 5/26 around 1PM. It was fairly busy but I was seated immediately. I do not eat red meat. The owner/server came and gave me a cup of soup. I wanted to know if it has any red meat it. So, even before I asked him what is in the soup, he said it is soup and walked away. Duh, I know that is is soup. Then he came back took the soup away. My Shrimp fried rice was delightful. However, I am knocking off 2 stars because (1) why should we give a pass for poor service, irrespective of the cuisine? I have seen lot of reviews where they say poor service but what do you expect from Chinese place. Why is that? (2) why minimum charge of $10 to accept credit card? I ordered a soft drink and fried rice. Am i supposed to stuff myself to meet $10 minimum. Isn't a fried rice and soft drink enough to fill up a normal person? I probably go again if I have my family with but not super happy experience.

excerpts: And free fried rice or chow mein when you get two entrees!
Chinese people never have chow mein for dinner
but if it's free
it's okay.
I highly recommend the Yum Yum combo clay pot-
you get a little bit of everything and the flavors are amazing.
Lots of leftovers too.
Me and my husband can stretch it out for three days.
That's a lot of food!
Highly recommended!
fried rice.author: Karen C.
fried rice.review: Okay I'm full blooded Chinese and I really love this place! For the longest time there we're no Chinese restaurants on Divisadero. We always liked Yum Yum House in the Mission. When they closed it was a sad sad day. So when we got a take out menu on our door, we freaked out because not only was it Yum Yum but delivery too!! And boy do they deliver fast. We always get our order in about 1/2 hour even through they say 45 minutes. And the food is hot!! That's amazing on it's own! And free fried rice or chow mein when you get two entrees! Chinese people never have chow mein for dinner but if it's free it's okay. I highly recommend the Yum Yum combo clay pot- you get a little bit of everything and the flavors are amazing. Lots of leftovers too. Me and my husband can stretch it out for three days. That's a lot of food! Highly recommended!

excerpts:
my husband eats meat, he couldn't tell!
veggie fried rice.
mmmmmm
oh, i could go on and on.
prices are cheeeeeeeeaaaap.
hooray!
lunch special is where it's at though, you get the perfect portions and a bit of everything.
yum yum for my tum tum.
fried rice.author: Little P.
fried rice.review:
i love yum yum.  i loved yum yum on valencia...unfortunately it moved to divisadero, but luckily, i work close by there!  
my favorites: hot and sour soup. it's vegetarian and delicious and will clear up any stuffed nose you have.
onion pancake:  light, scallion-ey and good peanut dip.
basil tofu, comes with jalepenos, yum.
any meatless chicken dish.  my husband eats meat, he couldn't tell!
veggie fried rice.  mmmmmm
oh, i could go on and on. prices are cheeeeeeeeaaaap.  hooray!
lunch special is where it's at though, you get the perfect portions and a bit of everything.  
yum yum for my tum tum.

excerpts: I really like their vegetarian hot and sour soup, their fake chicken kung pao, and their fried rice.
She really likes the sizzling rice soup.
Super nice guy on the phone, however the first time we ordered it took FOREVER to get to us
but the second time it was quick, so we'll soon find out if the long wait was just a fluke.
However the food made it worth it.
Also, if you call before 3pm, they will deliver the lunch special.
Excellent.
fried rice.author: nicole p.
fried rice.review:
YEA!! A very nice yelper messaged me to let me know that Yum Yum house was not gone, just moved.  I'm going today!
UPDATE:  My boss and I ordered from here twice in the last two weeks.  EXACTLY the same as Yum Yum on Valencia.  I really like their vegetarian hot and sour soup, their fake chicken kung pao, and their fried rice.  She really likes the sizzling rice soup.  Super nice guy on the phone, however the first time we ordered it took FOREVER to get to us but the second time it was quick, so we'll soon find out if the long wait was just a fluke.  However the food made it worth it.  Also, if you call before 3pm, they will deliver the lunch special.  Excellent.

excerpts: For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.
Translation:
For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.
Good food too.
Seriously.
I love this place.
fried rice.author: Annalise V.
fried rice.review: Yum Yum Hunan was recommended to me by my half Asian friend who is super picky about Asian cuisine of any kind.  She also has very expensive taste so I was surprised to find that Yum Yum (as we now affectionately refer to it) is very reasonable (cheap actually).  I have loved everything I have ever ordered.  And for nights spent in, ordering Yum Yum Hunan delivery is the best thing in the entire world.  It's hot, fresh, tasty, and even when I eat a lot of it (which I do quite often) I don't feel like I overdid it as I normally do with inexpensive Chinese food restaurants in the city.   For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.  Translation:  For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.  Good food too.  Seriously.  I love this place.  I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).  I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.

excerpts: also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.
you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.
i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.
fried rice.author: kate s.
fried rice.review:
i was so happy when this place reopened where hunan china used to be.  why?  because yum yum hunan serves meatless chicken!  i am a huge tofu fan but sometimes your mouth just needs that extra chewiness.  it's so good even my husband orders it, and he is usually not very vegetarian-friendly.  it's great because now we can actually SHARE OUR DISHES!  this happened maybe twice a year previously.  now it can be a weekly event.  he always orders the same thing--the general tsao's meatless chicken--but that's okay because so far it's the best thing we've tried on the menu.  the lemon chicken is pretty good too, and they will make most regular meat dishes with meatless chicken--i had them made me basil meatless chicken and it was yummy.  however, this is not a health food place.  the tastiest meatless chicken is the kind that's fried.  the basil meatless chicken wasn't breaded and fried, and it looked like diced ham--while it tasted good, it was a bit strange.

also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.  you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.  i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.

excerpts: I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice).
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms.
The Chow Fun was O.K.
It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts).
Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork...
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
kung pao fried rice.author: Lilian C.
kung pao fried rice.review:
I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice). 

Delivery time was fast!

We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice! Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms. The Chow Fun was O.K. It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts). Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork... I would've chosen a different meat if I knew.

Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!

excerpts: Kung pao fried rice??
Yummm must try next time.
kung pao fried rice.author: Sydney W.
kung pao fried rice.review: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.

excerpts: Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake.
Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups.
Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite.
kung pao fried rice.author: Sarah B.
kung pao fried rice.review:
My go to chinese delivery now!
