Have ordered twice, and both times the food was very good, and with prompt delivery. Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns. Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake. Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups. Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite. Not big pieces, but just those little bites that make you think twice about what you just ate. 

Also, we've ordered a couple entrees at once and not gotten the free stuff everyone else is raving about. How do I get on that??

excerpts: Kung Pao Fried Rice:
I know,
I know - Why more Kung Pao?
I don't know.
But the rice was great!
So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.
kung pao fried rice.author: R D.
kung pao fried rice.review:
This was some good Chinese Delivery.  The guy on the phone was really nice and helpful and we got our food in the time that he specified.  Huge portions and fresh vegetables - not overcooked!

We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!  Lightly fried (not greasy) and very tasty!  Obviously made with real orange.  I ordered this for me, but my boyfriend ate most of it!

Kung Pao Chicken: The veggies in this were amazing!  So perfectly cooked and tons of them!  The chicken, however, was a bit rubbery and fatty...thus the boyfriend eating my chicken!

Kung Pao Fried Rice: I know, I know - Why more Kung Pao?  I don't know.  But the rice was great!  So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.  Alas, the chicken in this was the same as the chicken in the previous dish.

I will order from Yum Yum again, just not the Kung Pao Chickens.

excerpts: Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice.
All of it was amazing.
I want to come back and try more of their menu.
kung pao fried rice.author: Bobby P.
kung pao fried rice.review:
Finally, I try somewhere I have had bookmarked forever. I would like to Holla at Rita C. for suggesting this place weeks ago. I wish I would have heeded her advice earlier because this place is really good. 

The food was yum, yum and then some. And on top of that it was Hunan. The name really does sum the place up. I went with a friend after happy hour at Fishbowl and we couldn't have been happier. We ordered the appetizer platter that came with pot stickers, egg rolls, crab ragoon, and some shrimp thing. We also got sesame chicken, Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice. All of it was amazing. I want to come back and try more of their menu. It was so damn good. 

Yum Yum is up there on my list of favorite Chinese places for sure. Thanks Rita!

excerpts: I also like the chow fun and kung pao fried rice.
They close earlier than most places so order before 10.
Im gonna miss this place when I move!
kung pao fried rice.author: M K.
kung pao fried rice.review: This is the best chinese food delivery I have had in SF. They have a huge affordable menu and serve a large variety of dishes. Delivery is very fast and food comes hot hot hot! The seafood and veggies are always very fresh. I recommend the eggrolls, and shrimp with eggplant and basil- its thai inspired. I also like the chow fun and kung pao fried rice. They close earlier than most places so order before 10. Im gonna miss this place when I move!

excerpts: I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped.
It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken.
They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea.
Good food.
kung pao fried rice.author: Alex E.
kung pao fried rice.review: I like the food here for the most part. It's well priced, quick, and yummy. I feel there could be a bit more to quality in the food. I had their orange chicken once and it was good, and a lot. My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2! I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped. It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken. They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea. Good food.

excerpts: Got the sweet and sour pork, a side of rice and the chicken chow mein to share with a friend
and it's more than enough food for the both of us.
chow mein.author: Sierra S.
chow mein.review: Great food at a decent price. Got the sweet and sour pork, a side of rice and the chicken chow mein to share with a friend and it's more than enough food for the both of us.

excerpts: Chow mein is bad as well.
chow mein.author: Jeiko S.
chow mein.review:
I ordered a delivery last night. A metal piece came out from Sesame chicken.
Chow mein is bad as well.

excerpts:
The last time I went they refused to let me order chow
mein for lunch instead of rice or to even let me order a side of chow mein... unbelievable.
I don't know why this place is still in business
chow mein.author: Jon I.
chow mein.review:
This place should get zero stars as it is one of the worst businesses in town.  They keep cats in their restaurant.  Unsanitary to say the least.  I have been several times because I work nearby and it is the only chinese restaurant.. the employees are rude and the food is bad.  The last time I went they refused to let me order chow
mein for lunch instead of rice or to even let me order a side of chow mein... unbelievable.  I don't know why this place is still in business

excerpts: Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy!
Not greasy like most places.
chow mein.author: Sydney W.
chow mein.review: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.

excerpts: For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein
I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that.
The food was serviceable.
chow mein.author: Marty J.
chow mein.review:
I ordered delivery from here through Eat24.com last night. It was nice to see some comments mostly mixed about the food. For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein but it came as pork.

The food was filling. Pretty greasy. I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that. The food was serviceable. I'd probably order from here again.

I like that they are not the standard take out boxes and they are plastic with a lid so they are easy to refrigerate. It came with 2 soy sauce packets and 2 fortune cookies. My girlfriend got the cookie with no fortune in it. LOL.

excerpts: Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95
chow mein.author: Cat A.
chow mein.review:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.

excerpts: We were in the area, when hit with a sudden craving for Chow Mein, so we yelped the nearest place to us, and we got Yum Yum Hunan!
Yummy cheap food.
Huuuuuge portions.
We took our food to go, but the atmosphere was pretty nice [observations from the 5 min I spent in there.]
Less than $12 for huge portions of chow mein&chow fun.
Yummm
chow mein.author: Amy L.
chow mein.review:
Very appropriate name, because while the boy&I were eating, I was definitely saying "yum yum!" Hah. Kinda.

We were in the area, when hit with a sudden craving for Chow Mein, so we yelped the nearest place to us, and we got Yum Yum Hunan! Yummy cheap food. Huuuuuge portions. We took our food to go, but the atmosphere was pretty nice [observations from the 5 min I spent in there.] Less than $12 for huge portions of chow mein&chow fun. Yummm :)

Will definitely come back next time I'm in the area :) I need to try their entrees!

excerpts: bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.
chow mein.author: Connie S.
chow mein.review:
this place is appropriately named because their food is yum yum. the ingredients taste fresher and look higher quality than comparable chinese delivery restaurants. the guy who answers the phone is always super friendly and very accommodating of my hatred of bell peppers. and they deliver to my house even though i live fairly far away. what's not to love?!

some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers. bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.

yum yum, enjoy!

excerpts: They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.
chow mein.author: Lisa K.
chow mein.review:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.

excerpts: I like their fish, chow mein, beef and broc, and fried rice.
chow mein.author: Dee N.
chow mein.review:
Yum yum!! An awesome restaurant that delivers fast and delicious food every time. 

Super affordable for huge portions. I like their fish, chow mein, beef and broc, and fried rice.

excerpts: When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein.
Nice!
Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.
The chow mein was simple and satisfying.
chow mein.author: Valeria R.
chow mein.review:
Until this past Friday, in my almost 15 years here I had never found a Chinese delivery place that I would try again. So, basically, all this time I've been ordering once from here, once from there, etc. If only Hunan Homes delivered...that would have solved my problem a long time ago.

But, recently, my BFF started raving about Yum Yum Hunan. I checked out my fellow Yelpers' reviews and Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise! When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein. Nice! Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.

The food arrived, nice and hot, in about 30 minutes. The wontons blew me away...they were simply amazing. Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.

The chow mein was simple and satisfying.

The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.

The walnut prawns, again, weren't as good as Hunan Homes', but I would order them again. They give you a baker's dozen, by the way.

I expected the prawns to come on the usual bed of shredded lettuce, but the beef was served that way as well, which I don't care for because it reheats horribly. Next time I'll ask them to leave out the lettuce on everything so that I don't have to pick it off.

So, all told, for about $30 including tip, I got almost 5 meals. Yum Yum, indeed, and economical! Friendly service too.

Yum Yum is going on the speed-dial for sure!

P.S. I swear I didn't eat all 5 of those meals in one night.

excerpts: We always get 3 entrees because then you get either chow mein or fried rice for free!

prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice =
okay
-mongolian

beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.
Lots of green peas and water chestnuts

prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice =
okay
-mongolian

beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.
Lots of green peas and water chestnuts
chow mein.author: Christy A.
chow mein.review:
Not bad Chinese food.  We always get 3 entrees because then you get either chow mein or fried rice for free!  We usually get it delivered and they are pretty quick about it.

THE FOOD

-spicy, salty, fried pork = good (MSG galore tho!)
-walnut prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice = okay
-mongolian beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.  Lots of green peas and water chestnuts

excerpts: We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.
chow mein.author: Scott S.
chow mein.review:
I really love Divisadero; the atmosphere, the stores, the people... everything about it and around it reads "anti-big money, mom and pop neighborhood." I'm not hinting that there's an air of class about this neighborhood, but it is definitely more unique and delightful than most, thus you can imagine my surprise when I found out there was a Chinese restaurant on this block.

When you think of Chinese restaurants in America you usually think of places that serve up a quick fix of left-over-for-the-next-meal-bound pan-asian cuisine, but Yum Yum Hunan (despite their hilariously cheesy sounding name,) like the street and neighborhood in which it's situated, is more unique and delightful than most.

Now from past experience, there are only two types of Chinese restaurants that I usually find in semi-gentrified areas: those that are sort of shabby looking inside, serve horribly americanized chinese food for bargain prices; and those that are really well-decorated inside, serve horribly americanized "fusion" chinese food for ridiculous prices. Well guess what? YYH is neither of these.

My roommate and I came here for a late dinner and looking at the interior from the outside we immediately thought this place was the latter of the aforementioned "chinese restaurant stereotypes," but since we were pretty hungry we decided to sit down anyway. We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

After about five minutes of scanning the menu we ordered General Tsao's Chicken and Spicy Garlic Eggplant. The General Tsao's Chicken was pretty standard, despite the fact that the chicken wasn't as spicy we'd hoped it'd be despite asking the waitress to make it extra spicy. But the real surprise/treat of the night was the Spicy Garlic Eggplant; usually when you order this dish at a Chinese restaurant it's usually bland and you don't really taste "garlic" or "spicy," but YYH's was full of flavor and the best part: their spicy garlic eggplant comes with shrimp, calamari and other assorted SEAFOOD! The best I've ever gotten with my spicy garlic eggplant in the past was maybe some shredded pork, but YYH serves theirs with a delicious mix of assorted seafood, and they even top it off with some basil for an extra depth of flavor.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.

excerpts:
Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!
chow mein.author: Talia G.
chow mein.review:
They changed their deal. I'm so sad. Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

Still...$34 for 4 entrees isn't bad:
+ General Tsao Chicken - Decent. Not at all spicy though.
+ Mango Broccoli Prawn - My favorite. Going to order it every time.
+ Mu Shu Pork - Solid.
+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!

Yum Yum, I may be a bit put off by your policy change, but your delivery is still speedy and you still taste delicious, so I will forgive and forget.

excerpts: Chicken Chow Mein (Good.)
chow mein.author: Kristy F.
chow mein.review:
Finally a Chinese food place that delivers and came recommended. I shall pass along the message. 

I tried: Chinese Mango Chicken (YUMMERS!)
            Chicken Chow Mein (Good.)

excerpts: Even though I was just making a simple order and had a few misunderstanding about the free chow mein or whatever, he was yelling at me as if I was stupid.
chow mein.author: Cindy L.
chow mein.review:
UGH! Been craving this since the last time I've had it which was last week. The bf and I decided to order  in since we need to study. Sadly when I called, the guy on the phone was SOOOOO RUDE! He was yelling at me and seem so angry at me. Even though I was just making a simple order and had a few misunderstanding about the free chow mein or whatever, he was yelling at me as if I was stupid. He hung up on me and didn't even tell me how long it would take for them to come. 

Usually whenever servers, waiters, ect at the restaurants are rude, the place won't get more than a 2 star from me, but since the food is so good, I guess I can give it 3 stars.

excerpts: Chicken Chow Mein
(This was better than most Chow Mein I've had at comparable restaurants.)
chow mein.author: Annalise F.
chow mein.review:
Yum Yum Hunan has become our go-to for Chinese Delivery. Although I hate to think of the calories and grams of fat consumed, my belly was quite satisfied both before and after NYE celebrations. (I've cursed myself for being such a fattie since, but oh my god- did it safe my life!)

We've never eaten at the restaurant itself but they're always timely and friendly when we call. (Which has only been twice, mind you.) 

We ordered:

Steamed Pot Stickers (Always better pan-fried, but this is the healthier option. Probably wouldn't order these again.)
Beef Broccoli (Yummy in my tummy!)
Kung Pao Prawns (Wasn't what I was expecting, but I do love my prawns.)
Sauteed String Beans (Good- but Betelnut's are still the best!)
Chicken Chow Mein (This was better than most Chow Mein I've had at comparable restaurants.)

I'm still searching for my Chinese Food Mecca in San Francisco....but this place shall do for now!

excerpts: For about $20 bucks you can get two entrees + a free Chow Mein (but make sure you ask the guy for it, they wont offer you the deal if you don't mention it).
chow mein.author: Rona Y.
chow mein.review:
This place is clean, fast, cheap, and delicious! All things I would want at my local Chinese restaurant. 

For about $20 bucks you can get two entrees + a free Chow Mein (but make sure you ask the guy for it, they wont offer you the deal if you don't mention it). The amount of food usually lasts me about 3-4 meals .. which in my mind means this is an awesome deal. 

The basic Amercanized Chinese foods... general tso, orange chicken,  etc. all taste the way they should. But some of the less traditional dishes like the asian fried chicken are so addicting! 

Pick up and delivery are pretty speedy - but I usually go late at night when it's pretty dead.

excerpts: Also, if you purchase two entrees you get a FREE fried rice or chow mein.
I have never been in the restaurant
but I love the delivery.
chow mein.author: Serene M.
chow mein.review:
The food is delicious, the delivery is fast, and I can understand the person on the phone when he is taking my order. Once in a while I still try delivery from somewhere else, but I keep going back to Yum Yum. 
So far I haven't found a place that can match Yum Yum's proportions, which are very generous. I always have food for more than one meal. The prices are great. Also, if you purchase two entrees you get a FREE fried rice or chow mein. I have never been in the restaurant but I love the delivery.

excerpts: Also, per other Yelp reviews, if you order two or more dishes, they'll give you a free chow mein for free.
chow mein.author: Rick P.
chow mein.review:
Really good delivery options: the food comes fast and the portions are huge. I've tried most of their vegetarian options are they truly are delicious! Specifically, I recommend the Kung Fu Tofu, Garlic Eggplant, and Szechuan Broccoli. The (vegetarian) orange "chicken" is spectacular. Even my Mom who has a tendency to be a bit of a Chinese food snob thought the food was excellent. When she visits she is always happy to order from here. That's saying a lot.

Order your food, and then 20 minutes later or so the food will be at your doorstep, piping hot! Also, per other Yelp reviews, if you order two or more dishes, they'll give you a free chow mein for free. 

Love this place.

excerpts: A feast of sweet & sour pork, honey walnut prawns, broccoli beef, chicken chow mein, and steamed rice was at my doorstep less than 1/2 hour after I called.
{Note: you don't need this much food for two people.
I will have leftovers for weeks.
Hilariously, they included 5 fortune cookies, as if to say "no way this is for a couple.
chow mein.author: Kelly B.

excerpts: Delivery was super fast (about 25 minutes to deliver to the inner richmond) and you get free chow mein or fried rice if you buy two entrees.
Thanks for the advice, Yelp!
chow mein.author: Ronald T.
chow mein.review:
If you're looking for good Americanized chinese take-out, this place will not disappoint. They've got all the classics, and they give you a LOT of it. I don't expect places like this not to be filled with greasy goodness, but it was just a bit too oily for my [highly high brow] taste. 

Delivery was super fast (about 25 minutes to deliver to the inner richmond) and you get free chow mein or fried rice if you buy two entrees. Thanks for the advice, Yelp!

excerpts: They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.
chow mein.author: L. L.
chow mein.review:
Ha! I have no affiliation with Yum Yum Hunan, just a coincidence we chose the same name!

I have been ordering delivery from this place for a couple years. Their service is lightning fast, always courteous, and the food is great!

I'm very picky about my Chinese food yet I'm the kind of person that will eat at the scary, dirty, hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurants my friends are too afraid to try. I usually shy away from Hunan style food because I think the sauces are too rich for me. I hate dishes where my food is swimming in gloppy sauce! But for some reason, Yum Yum's Hunan I find delicious and the sauces are not overwhelming.

They have all the classics but make them especially well. They also have a very long list of "Specials" with unique gourmet offerings such as Mongolian Lamb, Mango Broccoli Prawn and Pork-stuffed Eggplant and Tofu. This is probably the first time I've ever had orange chicken that was made using real orange and orange zest (no neon-orange flavorless goop!) They even garnished it! They make excellent Kung Pao and my favorite Chicken Fried Rice. 

I especially adore that they offer meatless chicken because then my vegetarian husband can eat with me. They offer 5 meatless chicken dishes and 11 vegetarian entree options! Wow!

They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.

The people who answer the phone speak English perfectly so there are never communication issues. They are always friendly and sweet. The delivery guys arrive at your door super fast and are always a pleasure to deal with. These people really *get* customer service!

I am always pleased with the food and service at Yum Yum. What is there not to love?

excerpts: I had the general chicken (really good), the vegetables (decent, not great), and the veggie chow mein (very yummy).
Also, since I ordered two entrees the chow mein was free.
chow mein.author: Elizabeth R.
chow mein.review:
Looking for a Chinese place that delivers (for free) I called up Yum Yum Hunan.  Delivery took a full hour (minus one star) and when I called to inquire about the delivery (after 45 mins)  the man on the phone was rather short with me.  However, when the food finally came, it was really yummy.

I had the general chicken (really good), the vegetables (decent, not great), and the veggie chow mein (very yummy).  Also, since I ordered two entrees the chow mein was free.  This was a fantastic deal.  

I was very happy with this place.  I will definitely order from here again.

excerpts: Add in free delivery and chow mein with two entrees
and I'm a fan!
chow mein.author: Murphy O.
chow mein.review:
Yum Yum! 

This is my go to place for delivery. The orange meatless chicken is a favorite of mine, but everything I've had has been pretty tasty. 

Add in free delivery and chow mein with two entrees and I'm a fan!

excerpts: I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing.
Great place for Chinese food.
chow mein.author: Mario C.
chow mein.review: Ive been going to Yum-yum ever since they were at the Valencia location and since then, them moving I've followed them like a stalker, lol... I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing. Great place for Chinese food.

excerpts: Walnut shrimp, garlic pork, hongkong style chow mein was tasty and traditional.
chow mein.author: J K.
chow mein.review:
Smaller place with friendly staff. We were the only ones in the place so cooks came out to watch the NBA playoffs with us lol! Walnut shrimp, garlic pork, hongkong style chow mein was tasty and traditional. Soup was below satisfactory.

Pricing $7-10 per dish for dinner. Standard Chinese delivery, good value for the price.

excerpts: OR chow mein.
chow mein.author: Mina B.
chow mein.review:
My favorite local Chinese delivery spot.

Order two entrees and get a free order of fried rice (veggie, chicken, beef) OR chow mein.  I always get the veggie fried rice. 

They give you hearty portions!  My husband and I always get their sesame chicken w/ broccoli. This dish doesn't have broccoli on the menu but, just ask for it w/ broccoli. You can balance the fried sweet chicken pieces with some steamed veggies. 

Other dishes tried that we liked was the drunken beef and basil beef...both very good.

excerpts: FREE Chicken Chow Mein with every order of two entrees.
Ok so I totally don't need the third entree, and I'm probably fatter because of this deal, but show me the person who can say no to free Yum Yum Chicken Chow Mein
chow mein.author: Mariko H.
chow mein.review:
One of the best Chinese Food delivery experiences you'll ever have.

1.  The guy who answers the phone is what I would want my grandfather to be like if I had a Chinese grandpa.  He's extremely helpful and tries his best to accommodate your every whim.  Eg: One day I really wanted Jasmine tea with my food and I was ballsy enough to ask if they would deliver tea.  He apologized that they didn't have a takeout tea container so he packed me a (free) bag full of amazing Jasmine tea bags so that I could make my own.  How sweet - and totally NOT neccessary!  Most Chinese restaurants would just say "no" but he made an attempt to make his customer happy.  That's the way to do business people... Outstanding.

2.  Delivery is fast.  Ok sometimes it really is 30-45 minutes like they say, but I've gotten used to hearing that and suddenly having the Yum Yum guy at my door 15 minutes later.  How does he DO that?!!

3.  FREE Chicken Chow Mein with every order of two entrees.  Ok so I totally don't need the third entree, and I'm probably fatter because of this deal, but show me the person who can say no to free Yum Yum Chicken Chow Mein and I'll show you a person with no soul.

Ok so maybe I've eaten enough Yum Yum that I'm starting to resemble an over-stuffed egg roll, but I don't care.  I'll yell it from the rooftops:  I LOVE YUM YUM!!!

excerpts: I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point.
I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time.
It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.
chow mein.author: Jasmine F.
chow mein.review:
I'm a bit surprised seeing so many low ratings for this place over the past few months! For me, Yum Yum has been the best Chinese delivery I've experienced in the city, hands down...and I've been looking for a "go to" spot for a looooooooooong time. The only thing that has gone wrong for me: they have forgotten items a couple times and brought the wrong order once, but they always make it up to me, so it's all good.

I consistently order the hot and sour soup, the kung pao tofu, and the brown rice. Always solid, and generally not too greasy (though once the tofu was REALLY greasy...but still oh sooooo tasty & flavorful). I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point. I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time. It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.

excerpts: We didn't eat the chow mein that we ordered and they graciously took it off our bill.
chow mein.author: Fareed R.
chow mein.review:
Very disappointing. The quality of the chicken was very poor. It had the consistency of tofu. That's fine for tofu but not for chicken. It usually speaks of sodium pumped solution. Barely edible. We didn't eat the chow mein that we ordered and they graciously took it off our bill. 

I really wanted to like this place.  I hope they read this and improve their quality.

It's true that they have a lot of vegetarian options so it might be okay if that's a requirement.

excerpts: If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free.
chow mein.author: Yasi S.
chow mein.review:
I remember this place when it was back on Valencia: so so so delicious! Thank you for moving! Thank you for remaining in business!

Their food is extremely fresh and has a vibrancy of flavors. Their sauces are so well spiced and delicious without bordering on the "tastes right out of a bottle!" that more mediocre Chinese restaurants seem to specialize in. Also, there's a surprising lack of "oh, wonder what kind of mystery meat that is?!" situation going on. And finally, they have several dishes that deviate from your standard Chinese take-out menus that we've all come to memorize, unfortunately...

They're definitely a cut above the standard Chinese food in SF but I like them just a little less than the California Chinese that Eric's  http://www.yelp.com/biz/erics-restaurant-san-francisco and Alice's made famous.



Good to know:

Spicy Mandarin Eggplant is fabulous as is the real-orange Orange Chicken

Drunken Beef is meh

If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free. Sometimes you have to ask for it though.


Unfortunately, I can tell by my frenetic eating, putting away, returning, nibbling, yearning, wanting of Yum Yum's food that they almost certainly use MSG. And there's no large font denials of it on their menus, so it's safe to say, they use MSG. With great success. And probably a lot of it. My hands are actually shaking right now...just a little bit....after eating almost half of the entire order of Orange Chicken...and still....wanting .....more......

So that's minus 1 star. For my MSG hangover from eating waaaay too much good Yum Yum.

I am going to try to ask them to make my order without MSG next time. I'l let you know how it goes.

excerpts: The best part is that if you order two entrees, you get a FREE order of chow mein or fried rice!
Service is always great and call in orders are ready to pick up in 15-20 minutes.
I have never tried the delivery service because I live so close.
Best Chinese food in the area!
chow mein.author: Bobby J.
chow mein.review:
After moving to a new neighborhood the first thing to do is to find the closest GOOD Chinese restaurant. Done and done.
Being a vegetarian, it is hard to find Chinese food that is more than just tofu and veggies. Yum Yum Hunan has filled that void with a "meatless chicken" section of the menu! The lemon and orange "chicken" dishes are amazing! I think even voracious carnivores would love these dishes. 
Their standard vegetarian section also boasts more than 10 entrees. 
The prices here are really good for the large portions you get. Rice is extra, but cheap: $1 for white $1.25 for brown.
The best part is that if you order two entrees, you get a FREE order of chow mein or fried rice!
Service is always great and call in orders are ready to pick up in 15-20 minutes. I have never tried the delivery service because I live so close.
Best Chinese food in the area!

excerpts: If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice...
the FREE chicken fried is awesome!!
i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies.
the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it.
for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00.....
i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout
chow mein.author: Kimberly S.
chow mein.review: Best chinese food delivery! Prices are cheap, delivery is quick, and the food is delicious. If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice... the FREE chicken fried is awesome!! i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies. the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it. also tried the combo noodle soup - very fat noodles (-) but  a lot of great meats and veggies in it (++). for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00..... i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout :)

excerpts: I'm almost certainly going to call Yum Yum Hunan again when I want Chinese food delivered....and next time I'm going to take advantage of the free rice/chow mein.
;D
chow mein.author: Daniela R.
chow mein.review:
A friend and I were up studying late and called in to order Chinese delivery here; I was worried that we'd get DENIED because it was probably ten minutes before the closing time listed on their website. 

However, the guy who took our order (and I second the reviewer on here who compared him to a Chinese Grandpa!) was extremely accommodating and friendly.

I was expecting the delivery in probably half an hour or something, but I got a call from the delivery guy less than fifteen minutes later. 

Now, if I'd known about the FREE RICE that would've come with ordering two entrees for delivery, I might've saved myself some money. As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

Not only was the food plentiful, but it was RIDICU-LICIOUSLY NOMSOME. It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.

I'm almost certainly going to call Yum Yum Hunan again when I want Chinese food delivered....and next time I'm going to take advantage of the free rice/chow mein. ;D

excerpts: And they're so cool they hooked me up with a free chicken chow mein for no apparent reason.
chow mein.author: Don W.
chow mein.review:
In a nutshell: very friendly service, lightning fast delivery, and decent food at decent prices. I wouldn't say this is the finest chinese takeout in the city. In the grand scheme of things it's actually probably middle of the road. But it's definitely one of your better options if you live in the Lower Pac Heights/Laurel Heights/Western Addition area.

And they're so cool they hooked me up with a free chicken chow mein for no apparent reason. :)

excerpts: I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.
We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.
chow mein.author: Therese H.
chow mein.review:
I may have found a new hot spot for the new neighborhood I am living in.

We stopped by, hungry after moving furniture due to the high recommendation that came from a friend.  

It was early for dinner time and we were one of two tables full.  

The staff was very pleasant and the food was great!

The portions we very big and i noticed quite a few things that were exciting to me on the menu:

The first is free delivery, very handy even if you're right across the way.  I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.  There was quite a lot of seafood as well as veggie options, which even included seitan/soy meat or "meatless chicken"  

We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.  This was plenty for two, plus leftovers.

I willl definitly be back to try more of the menu :)

excerpts:
What we ordered:
Pork Pot Stickers
Hot & Sour Soup
Mongolian Beef
Walnut Shrimp
Chicken Chow Mein (free since I ordered 2 entrees!)

Mongolian Beef - spicy and tasty

Walnut Shrimp - delicious - fried and the sauce was perfect!

Chicken Chow Mein
chow mein.author: Janine L.
chow mein.review:
Yum Yum Hunan is Chinese American food delivery, moderate grease. I think we received our food within 30 min.

What we ordered:
Pork Pot Stickers
Hot & Sour Soup
Mongolian Beef
Walnut Shrimp
Chicken Chow Mein (free since I ordered 2 entrees!)

Pot Stickers - tasty - not the best I have had, but not the worst. Good ratio of meat to wrapper. Wrapper was not too thick.

Hot & Sour Soup - meh. but nourishing.

Mongolian Beef - spicy and tasty

Walnut Shrimp - delicious - fried and the sauce was perfect!

Chicken Chow Mein - I love noodles and these were free, am a fan

Looking forward to the leftovers for dinner tonight!

excerpts: We got the salt & pepper shrimp, veggie delight, salt & pepper pork chops, walnut shrimp, and the free veggie chow mein.
chow mein.author: Angela L.
chow mein.review:
Momma needed a break from playing good Chinese housewife after having to go into the office the entire weekend. Seemed like Yum Yum Hunan had some good reviews, so we decided to call for delivery. We got the salt & pepper shrimp, veggie delight, salt & pepper pork chops, walnut shrimp, and the free veggie chow mein. 

I really had high hopes for this place especially since it was a good deal ($40 for all the food) and it seems like everyone else has had a good experience. However, the food we received was sub-par. The salt & pepper shrimp was terrible--actually nothing like I've ever had before; same with the salt and pepper pork. Maybe it's because we got delivery or maybe because a lot of bai ren partake in this place so they think they can skimp on the quality, but either way it was unsatisfying.

The service was nice, but I don't know if I would try this place again :(

excerpts: We've also gotten the chow mein in the past which I liked, not too greasy.
chow mein.author: Carolyn K.
chow mein.review:
This is our delivery place of the moment when we're craving Chinese food. I always judge a Chinese restaurant based on its hot and sour soup and I was pleasantly surprised that when I tasted Yum Yum's soup, it was just that, yum yum. 

We've gotten delivery here twice now and its always tasty and delivered quickly. Most recently we ordered the orange chicken, which was good, but nothing special as some of the reviews here rave. Usually I'm not a huge fan of deep fried anything , but I was hoping this would be more impressive. Egg rolls were very greasy, would definitely skip these next time, but that hot and sour soup was good, see above. We've also gotten the chow mein in the past which I liked, not too greasy. 

Delivery is ridiculously fast, the hot and sour soup is yummy, and the food satisfies that Chinese takeout craving. 3 stars it is!

excerpts: Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice.
chow mein.author: Tara M.
chow mein.review: This is our GO-TO Chinese food spot. Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice. AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB). Enjoy! - We always Do! Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.

excerpts: We were also happy with the free Chicken Chow Mein.
That was a nice surprise.
chow mein.author: Melissa J.
chow mein.review:
Super fast delivery.

Everything was fresh and delicious. They use real chicken... not that sketchy stuff that they call "chicken" at other takeout Chinese restaurants.

We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons

We were also happy with the free Chicken Chow Mein. That was a nice surprise.  So why not 5 stars?

The egg drop soup was a big thumbs down. It tasted fishy. We bought a big container of it and tossed the whole thing. ick.

I won't hold it against them though - everything else was excellent!

excerpts: Perfect for two, they have a great deal of tossing in free fried rice or chow mein with an order of two entrees.
chow mein.author: Marsha Z.
chow mein.review:
I'm still partial to Ken's Kitchen when I'm craving meatless chicken due to their proximity and quick delivery, but Yum Yum has a slight edge in quality.  Perfect for two, they have a great deal of tossing in free fried rice or chow mein with an order of two entrees.

I've always done take out, but their dining area is bigger and brighter than what I remember from when they were in the Mission.  Aside from Tataki, I'm not a huge fan of any of the restaurants on this side of Divis, so I'm glad Yum Yum provides another option of good food to the area.

excerpts: We really like the chow mein and the scallops and vegetables.
Personally, you are safe with whatever you order!
chow mein.author: Rheannia H.
chow mein.review:
This is one of my favorite places to eat! It is amazing. The service is great. We have never gotten it as take out, but it would probably be the best take out ever. The restaurant is very clean and calm. A great minimalist feeling.  

We really like the chow mein and the scallops and vegetables. Personally, you are safe with whatever you order!

excerpts: Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?
BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy?
BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?
chow mein.author: Marie K.
chow mein.review:
This place gets five stars not because it is the most spectacular Chinese food ever (it isn't) but because it does exactly what it is supposed to... deliver hot, tasty American-Chinese food promptly and for a reasonable price, with no screwups.  

Egg rolls?  Crispy and delicious, check, ample sweet and sour, check.
Orange chicken?  Neither sticky nor soggy, good quality meat, actual orange peel in the sauce.
Hot and sour soup?  Above average, delivered in generous quantity and still hot.  We were glad we ordered two.....mmm leftovers.
Noodles? Buttery and just greasy enough, crunchy fresh veggies mixed in.
Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?  BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy? BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?  $40

We'll be back... well actually, geeky delivery boy will be back to our apartment.

excerpts: And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery.
chow mein.author: Matthew C.
chow mein.review:
Yum Yum's name is a perfect fit. Consistent good quality, fast delivery and great price. 

Possibly the best Chinese delivery we have had. We live in the Inner Richmond and have tried MANY different Chinese restaurants. More than I can recall.  

They do all the traditional dishes, plus many original creations. Try the Lovers Shrimp or the Yum Yum Delicatessen, both winners. Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.

And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery. Makes it easy and less expensive to please the whole family, kids and neighbors.

With so many for-to-go options, it's nice to find one I have no qualms about calling again & again.

Glad we "found" out about Yum Yum. Now you know about them too.

excerpts: Sour Soup, General Tso's, Shrimp Fried Rice, Moo Shu Pork, and they even threw in some free Chicken Chow Mein.
chow mein.author: Nish N.
chow mein.review:
We ordered from Yum Yum last night, and I'd say for delivery, these folks live up to their name. The guy who took our order was almost excited to hear from me, service with a smile through that phone, I tell you.

Since this was my first time with them, I played it standard -- Hot 'n' Sour Soup, General Tso's, Shrimp Fried Rice, Moo Shu Pork, and they even threw in some free Chicken Chow Mein.

The Tso's wasn't the best I've had, but everything arrived in under 45 minutes, pretty hot, and for a little shy of forty bucks. Will definitely order from them again, giving them the potsticker test... 3.5 stars for now!

excerpts: Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees.
The man who took my order was nice.
The food came fast too.
The chow mein was decent, though bland.
The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it.
The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess..
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place.
We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad-
I hate to waste.
Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
chow mein.author: Rachel D.
chow mein.review:
Oh Nuh Uh!

I had just today told my Sweetie that finally I was learning to like Chinese food (a special shout out & a thx to Nan King Road Bistro for making that possible). We like to occasionally order in on Sunday nights & got flyered by YYH. Their menu was appealing so we thought to give them a try.
Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees. The man who took my order was nice. The food came fast too.
We ordered: dim sum sampler (I give it 1 out of 5 stars), apps sampler (the Crab Rangoon and potstickers were a 3 out of 5, but the fried shrimp and the egg roll were beyond greasy, with an aftertaste.. negative two stars). The chow mein was decent, though bland. The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it. The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess.. 
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place. We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad- I hate to waste. However, the fortunes in the cookies were auspicious.

Pros: Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
Cons: The food.

Yuk Yuk Hunan- good for diet, bad for me.

excerpts: Tried the Veggie Chow Mein - bland as can be.
Tried the Hot and Sour soup - SO oily!
chow mein.author: Abby Z.
chow mein.review:
Rather bland, if you ask me.

We ordered from here because we decided to try other places in the neighborhood before picking a favorite delivery spot, and this was a huge disappointment.

I'm a vegetarian so I love meatless chicken options and we tried the General Tsao's dish, which though decent in flavor arrived a bit cold and on a bed of overcooked broccoli with no additional sauce apart from what clung to the squishy soggy breading on the "chicken" and was overall blah. Tried the Veggie Delight - bland as can be! Tried the Veggie Chow Mein - bland as can be. Tried the Hot and Sour soup - SO oily! Tried the Veggie Egg Rolls - okay fine, these were passable but this isn't hard to get right.

Though it arrived quickly, I may have preferred if it hadn't arrived at all so that I could have had an excuse to make a call to the best delivery place we have tried: Tai Chi. Now THAT's good delivery!

excerpts:
Two entrees, chow mein and rice for under $25.
Name: 
Who doesn't like saying Yum Yum Hunan.
chow mein.author: Ryan C.
chow mein.review:
Come here for some super bomb and apparently really healthy Chinese food.  Especially if you are a vegetarian.  

My girl got the meatless chicken cause she doesn't eat real chicken and when she tried it she thought she had accidentally been served real chicken cause nothing fake could taste that good.  I had to verify that her chicken was indeed fake although I must admit was pretty delicious.

My meal however was the Five Flavor Real Chicken and it was amazing.  Haven't tried anything else but after these two entrees I'm not sure how anyone could say this place was bland.

Bonus points:
Quantitiy:  Filled me up for dinner and then again for lunch the next day.
Price: Two entrees, chow mein and rice for under $25.
Name: Who doesn't like saying Yum Yum Hunan.
Came in a biodegradable container.

So why not five stars.  Both my girl and I got the exact same fortune.  Such a let down after such a great meal.

excerpts: For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.
chow mein.author: Janet L.
chow mein.review:
I wish I could give this a slightly higher rating just for service and cleanliness, but alas I'm unable to award half a star to bring it up to a 3.5.

The peking duck was nicely done and flavorful, accompanied by four fluffy buns, but we were a little disappointed by how little scallion they sent us away with.  The drunken beef with celery, mushrooms and snow peas tasted fairly healthy, but the sauce wasn't spectacular.  I slathered the soft pieces of beef in sriracha, as is my custom with mild foods.  The complimentary noodle dish was a winner!  For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.  They were nice enough to accomodate a change to chow fun.

All in all, I think this is a fine establishment and definitely a bargain for this area!

excerpts: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.
chow mein.author: Ileana H.
chow mein.review:
Formerly known as Hunan China, it feels as if there's been a lot of revamping.

From:
-a new green awning with white font
-the interior (now a mustard yellow type color with white trim)
-more indoor plants
-perhaps new tables and chairs
-new tea pots
I could go on...but...AN ALTOGETHER CLEANER FEEL. 

A new menu item I did see: Mango Chicken (decent). 

Lunch is only served until 3pm. I believe the lunch special is only for weekdays.

What you get for SIX BUCKS: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.

I did spot that they do serve Sierra Nevada for $3. Awesome.

excerpts: Pork Chow Mein - 5 stars because it was FREE!!
I ordered so much food that my tummy is groaning right now.
Maybe tomorrow after the laxative eat works its magic, I'll have some.
chow mein.author: Christina C.
chow mein.review:
As far as Americanized Chinese foods go, this place is...here.  It has some lovely things that I would never have ordered were it not for the reviews on this site, and then it had some things that I craved which were also mentioned on this site.  Let's start off with the good news, shall we?

Crab Rangoon - 5 stars, delicious, star shaped generous filling.  I would never have order this except one of the reviews here talked about it and I am very very glad I did.  It's a good execution of Crab Rangoon even if it may be crab-less.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings Entree - 5 Stars.  Came on a bed of shredded lettuce with jalapeno, peppers, some other stuff.  Batter was tasty and seasoned.  A bit heavy, but that's like saying the cone shape of carrots detracts from the taste.  

Ma Po ToFu - 3 stars.  Ths sauce was not undelicious, and the flavor was not offensive.  My preferance is for it to be made with soft tofu whereas this was made with medium or firm.

Buddha's Delight Vegetable Clay Pot - 3 stars.  The taste was rather fresh.  I enjoyed the thin glass noodles at the bottom and the pleasing array of veg, wood ear mushroom, and tofu.  Again, I would have like soft tofu, not medium or firm.  

Pork Chow Mein - 5 stars because it was FREE!!  I ordered so much food that my tummy is groaning right now.  Maybe tomorrow after the laxative eat works its magic, I'll have some.  But for now, Chinese food:1, Christina:0.

Let's talk about the lovely young man who delivered it.  He was so considerate and concerned that my apartment door would close and lock me out (it does and did), he voiced his concern.  Ah.  What a nice young man.

Final thoughts: I've come to the conclusion that ordering chinese food as a chinese person who does not live in NYC is like eating at a cafeteria (maybe even a public school cafeteria) after having grown up on home cooking, on the farm, grandmother makes her own bread, cooks her own jellies.  I'm not disappointed because that would be like being disappointed that watermelons are not poisonous.  I am merely...enlightened.  And I know that for $36 I have enough food to last me the rest of the week through finals, if only I can bring myself to eat it.

excerpts: They even do the free fried rice or chow mein deal for dinner delivery..
chow mein.author: Missy B.
chow mein.review:
Look. I am just.. way too stoked about this to be funny right now.. 

I guess they've been open now for ten days and nobody's noticed yet, but according to the manager here, THE WHOLE kitchen staff from Yum Yum House on Valencia came over to this new Divisadero location..

Same cute font! Same menu! Same free delivery.. They even do the free fried rice or chow mein deal for dinner delivery.. 

This is.. just.. awesome.. I have to go get some water and calm down..

excerpts:
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein
chow mein.author: Kris B.
chow mein.review:
I used their takeout and have eaten at the restaurant. Food comes out  fairly quick and the servers are nice.

Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein

the list goes on...

Almost anything I order is great. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.

excerpts: Great Mix Veggies, house fried rice, and chow mein.
The delivery time is quick and the price is reasonable, if not unpriced.
The only thing I disliked is the hot sauce they mix in their food to create hot dishes.
It is kinda yucky!
I opted to just add my own hot sauce later.
Good Food.
chow mein.author: Pawanpreet G.
chow mein.review:
Yummy for Your Tummy.

The name fits the food. Great Mix Veggies, house fried rice, and chow mein.  The delivery time is quick and the price is reasonable, if not unpriced. The only thing I disliked is the hot sauce they mix in their food to create hot dishes. It is kinda yucky! I opted to just add my own hot sauce later. Good Food.

excerpts: I ordered americanized staple food: Chow Mein, Sweet&Sour Chicken, and Broccoli Beef for $24.
I know:
boring, but I wasn't feeling adventurous.
The Chow Mein was excellent and the S&S chicken was actually quite good.
They use large pieces that are heavily fried, but are more meat than dough, which is good.
The broccoli was delish' as well.
chow mein.author: T. M. B.
chow mein.review:
Ordered take-out from Yum Yum last night.  I called at 930pm and when I got there at 9:45pm, the food was ready to go.  They don't ask for your name or number or anything, but that's OK as they have call-ID, and identify your order using that.  Their restaurant smelled great and the dining atmosphere was very nice.

I ordered americanized staple food: Chow Mein, Sweet&Sour Chicken, and Broccoli Beef for $24.  I know: boring, but I wasn't feeling adventurous.  The Chow Mein was excellent and the S&S chicken was actually quite good.  They use large pieces that are heavily fried, but are more meat than dough, which is good.  The broccoli was delish' as well.  Plenty of food, I'll be eating this for at least 3 meals.

All in all the food was super quick, sorta cheap, hot, and tasty.  Would eat there again.

excerpts: This place is on the short list of our go-to neighborhood takeout options, in no small measure because of their delicious faux meat entrees and the amazing veggie chow mein (which you get gratis if you order two or more entrees - yay!)
chow mein.author: Lindsay J.
chow mein.review: This place is on the short list of our go-to neighborhood takeout options, in no small measure because of their delicious faux meat entrees and the amazing veggie chow mein (which you get gratis if you order two or more entrees - yay!) I thought I'd given up lemon chicken when I became a vegetarian, but Yum Yum Hunan ensures I get my fix more often than I probably ever should.

excerpts: Big fan of the hong kong chow mein.
Potstickers are real good too.
chow mein.author: Laureto R.
chow mein.review: Really great! We're always hard critiques when it comes to trying new places in San Francisco. This place is very good. Big fan of the hong kong chow mein. Potstickers are real good too.

excerpts: lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.
chow mein.author: Laura M.
chow mein.review: still my favorite chinese delivery in sf... lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.  my favorite is the garlic eggplant. fast delivery

excerpts: My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2!
I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped.
It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken.
They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea.
Good food.
chow mein.author: Alex E.
chow mein.review: I like the food here for the most part. It's well priced, quick, and yummy. I feel there could be a bit more to quality in the food. I had their orange chicken once and it was good, and a lot. My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2! I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped. It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken. They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea. Good food.

excerpts: Chow mein and Spicy eggplant are delicious, as well as the green beans and chicken.
You may want to ask for light sauce as many of the dishes are drenched.
Super quick delivery!
A great neighborhood spot!
chow mein.author: S. V.
chow mein.review: The menu is a bit overwhelming but everything I've tried is fairly good.  Chow mein and Spicy eggplant are delicious, as well as the green beans and chicken.  You may want to ask for light sauce as many of the dishes are drenched.  Super quick delivery! A great neighborhood spot!

excerpts: I have ordered the beef broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, vegetable fried rice, beef chow mein,  sizzling rice soup, and mushroom chicken.
I wasn't a big fan of the mushroom chicken but everything else has been great here.
Very flavorful and inexpensive.
chow mein.author: Marissa Z.
chow mein.review: This place is great. The service is fast and efficient. I usually order take out and have eaten their once. I have ordered the beef broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, vegetable fried rice, beef chow mein,  sizzling rice soup, and mushroom chicken. I wasn't a big fan of the mushroom chicken but everything else has been great here. Very flavorful and inexpensive.

excerpts: i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice.
that pisses me off.
he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty.
the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.
chow mein.author: A F.
chow mein.review:
I dig this place, great food, not too greasy, ordered the orange meatless chicken and for someone who's not a huge fan of tofu i was blown away. taste real, real good. 
i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice. that pisses me off. he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty. the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.

excerpts: Tried the Hong Kong Chow Mein for the first time... with chicken.
Chicken was just ok
but I would order again with just the veggies...great flavor and fun to eat.
chow mein.author: Carol F.
chow mein.review:
Just moved to the neighborhood and was hoping to find a great Chinese take out.... Yum Yum hit the spot!  Tried the Hong Kong Chow Mein for the first time... with chicken.  Chicken was just ok but I would order again with just the veggies...great flavor and fun to eat.  I would recommend highly the Dry Garlic Shrimp... nice spice, really great... loved the fried rice as well.  Tried the spicy crispy pork... not a fan but thats ok... I have tried it before other places and its just me. 

Food was fresh and hot...delivered fast... service was friendly

excerpts: I shared the Appetizer Platter and vegetable chow mein with my boyfriend and the two others shared the meatless general tsao's chicken and the sauteed green beans.
Everything was delicious, fresh, not greasy at all, flavorful, and cooked well.
We will definitely be back again or order delivery soon.
chow mein.author: kate m.
chow mein.review: Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30, and although there were relatively few people in the restaurant, they were doing a busy delivery business.  I shared the Appetizer Platter and vegetable chow mein with my boyfriend and the two others shared the meatless general tsao's chicken and the sauteed green beans. Everything was delicious, fresh, not greasy at all, flavorful, and cooked well.  We will definitely be back again or order delivery soon.

excerpts: And if you order 2 entrees you get a free chow mein.
chow mein.author: N S.
chow mein.review:
10,000 stars.

But seriously.....their meatless chicken is AMAZING. meat lovers out there, I know you doubt that....but you really cant judge till you try it.

Does it take like tofu? No. Like soy? bean curd? vegetables? No.

It's freaking delish. And if you order 2 entrees you get a free chow mein.

So....order some meatless chicken, and if you don't like it...well, **** me.

Not like typical greasy Chinese...its yummmmmmmm

excerpts: and if you get 2 entrees you get a free fried rice or chow mein.
chow mein.author: Matthew R.
chow mein.review: Love this place even when it was over in the mission. I think they have the best meatless chicken stuff anywhere. I eat meat but the lady doesn't but and this places  meatless chicken taste better than the real thing. The five flavor fake chicken is the best thing they have, and the basil fake chicken is also really good. Super friendly , fast delivery and if you get 2 entrees you get a free fried rice or chow mein.

excerpts: And free fried rice or chow mein when you get two entrees!
Chinese people never have chow mein for dinner
but if it's free
it's okay.
I highly recommend the Yum Yum combo clay pot-
you get a little bit of everything and the flavors are amazing.
Lots of leftovers too.
Me and my husband can stretch it out for three days.
That's a lot of food!
Highly recommended!
chow mein.author: Karen C.
chow mein.review: Okay I'm full blooded Chinese and I really love this place! For the longest time there we're no Chinese restaurants on Divisadero. We always liked Yum Yum House in the Mission. When they closed it was a sad sad day. So when we got a take out menu on our door, we freaked out because not only was it Yum Yum but delivery too!! And boy do they deliver fast. We always get our order in about 1/2 hour even through they say 45 minutes. And the food is hot!! That's amazing on it's own! And free fried rice or chow mein when you get two entrees! Chinese people never have chow mein for dinner but if it's free it's okay. I highly recommend the Yum Yum combo clay pot- you get a little bit of everything and the flavors are amazing. Lots of leftovers too. Me and my husband can stretch it out for three days. That's a lot of food! Highly recommended!

excerpts: The food itself was pretty good, HOWEVER, when I was eating the chow mein, what did I find?
A little peice of metal nestled within the noodles and hidden just enough to make it into my mouth.
Repulsive.
If that didn't happen I
(and I'm sure anyone else) would have been much happier.
chow mein.author: reina t.
chow mein.review:
Ok, so I read someone else's review about how they got their food in like 20 minutes or something so I was pretty excited about that when I ordered last night.However, our order took over an hour to arrive. Maybe it was the rain. 
On to the food. When it finally arrived there was quite a bit in exchange for not too much money which is always a pretty pleasant suprise. The food itself was pretty good, HOWEVER, when I was eating the chow mein, what did I find? A little peice of metal nestled within the noodles and hidden just enough to make it into my mouth. Repulsive. If that didn't happen I (and I'm sure anyone else) would have been much happier. The Kung Pao Tofu was ok, but not what I was expecting. Not the fault of the restaurant as I was trying it for the first time. The veggie potstickers were great and less greasy  than other places, but the green onion pancakes were pretty greasy and made me feel like I had to take a shower after I ate one. Im going to give this place another chance and hope for speedier delivery and metal free food next time.

excerpts: For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.
Translation:
For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.
Good food too.
Seriously.
I love this place.
chow mein.author: Annalise V.
chow mein.review: Yum Yum Hunan was recommended to me by my half Asian friend who is super picky about Asian cuisine of any kind.  She also has very expensive taste so I was surprised to find that Yum Yum (as we now affectionately refer to it) is very reasonable (cheap actually).  I have loved everything I have ever ordered.  And for nights spent in, ordering Yum Yum Hunan delivery is the best thing in the entire world.  It's hot, fresh, tasty, and even when I eat a lot of it (which I do quite often) I don't feel like I overdid it as I normally do with inexpensive Chinese food restaurants in the city.   For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.  Translation:  For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.  Good food too.  Seriously.  I love this place.  I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).  I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.

excerpts: also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.
you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.
i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.
chow mein.author: kate s.
chow mein.review:
i was so happy when this place reopened where hunan china used to be.  why?  because yum yum hunan serves meatless chicken!  i am a huge tofu fan but sometimes your mouth just needs that extra chewiness.  it's so good even my husband orders it, and he is usually not very vegetarian-friendly.  it's great because now we can actually SHARE OUR DISHES!  this happened maybe twice a year previously.  now it can be a weekly event.  he always orders the same thing--the general tsao's meatless chicken--but that's okay because so far it's the best thing we've tried on the menu.  the lemon chicken is pretty good too, and they will make most regular meat dishes with meatless chicken--i had them made me basil meatless chicken and it was yummy.  however, this is not a health food place.  the tastiest meatless chicken is the kind that's fried.  the basil meatless chicken wasn't breaded and fried, and it looked like diced ham--while it tasted good, it was a bit strange.

also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.  you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.  i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.

excerpts: And thank you fellow yelper for posting about the free chow mein with a 2 entree order.
I asked the guy on the phone (who was super friendly) if they still offered this special and he said yes without any hesitation.
The chicken chow mein was so good, I couldn't stop talking about how good it was while I was eating it.
Oh, and the craziest part was the food got to me in 15 minutes!
I had to check my call log to make sure that was right.
I felt like the guy was at my door the second I hung up.
I'm so deliriously happy right now, I wanted to call them up and tell them how good the food was and that they made my night.
So excited I found this place, I'm always wary of chinese delivery, but I'm happy to say I've found my go to chinese spot.
Woot!
chow mein.author: Sophie P.
chow mein.review: yum yum, indeed!  Just finished stuffing my belly with super delicious and FRESH chinese food.  I ordered the veggie deluxe which came with broccoli, mushroom, snow peas, and baby corn that were still crispy and fresh, which is a huge surprise considering other take out places.  Also had the crispy deep fried chicken wings, which were amazingly tender.  Best part was the batter was still crispy.  And thank you fellow yelper for posting about the free chow mein with a 2 entree order.  I asked the guy on the phone (who was super friendly) if they still offered this special and he said yes without any hesitation.  The chicken chow mein was so good, I couldn't stop talking about how good it was while I was eating it.  Oh, and the craziest part was the food got to me in 15 minutes!  I had to check my call log to make sure that was right.  I felt like the guy was at my door the second I hung up.  I'm so deliriously happy right now, I wanted to call them up and tell them how good the food was and that they made my night.  So excited I found this place, I'm always wary of chinese delivery, but I'm happy to say I've found my go to chinese spot.  Woot!

excerpts: I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice).
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms.
The Chow Fun was O.K.
It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts).
Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork...
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!

chow fun.review:
I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice). 

Delivery time was fast!

We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice! Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms. The Chow Fun was O.K. It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts). Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork... I would've chosen a different meat if I knew.

Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!

excerpts: The chow fun was very good and the eggs rolls were so fresh and tasty
I couldn't get enough.
Definitely worth the price.
Only issue I had was the delivery driver wouldn't find a place to park and deliver the food to my hotel room.
Other than that, YUM YUM is RIGHT!!
chow fun.author: Melissa E.
chow fun.review: I ordered delivery from these guys last night and it was some of the best chinese food I've ever had. The five flavor chicken was amazing. The salty, spicy,crispy pork spareribs were TO DIE FOR!!! The chow fun was very good and the eggs rolls were so fresh and tasty I couldn't get enough. Definitely worth the price. Only issue I had was the delivery driver wouldn't find a place to park and deliver the food to my hotel room. Other than that, YUM YUM is RIGHT!!

The chicken was disappointing, but the veggie options were pretty good.

Food is agreeable and good value, but not very much going on flavor-wise.

We had buddha bowl, genera tsao's chicken, steamed veggies, and chow fun. The chicken was disappointing, but the veggie options were pretty good.

excerpts: Best chow fun in town!
Absolutely to die for, just the right noodles, perfectly dressed, the vegetable is my favorite.
chow fun.author: Tyler K.
chow fun.review:
SECRET TIP: use the online system to find what you want and then call in the order over the phone - It's cheaper!

Best chow fun in town! Absolutely to die for, just the right noodles, perfectly dressed, the vegetable is my favorite. Orange chicken is a perfect mix of American and traditional style. The soups are delicious, I recommend the wonton soup. 

Only downside (hence the 4 stars) would be the online order system. I often use the online system as a convenience and end up having to call in my order after I place it online because the system closes out when you try to complete and place your order. BUT upon calling in the order my total is usually $5-$10 cheaper than the online system. Delivery is good but takes about 45 mins

excerpts: some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers.

some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers. bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.

yum yum, enjoy!

Maybe other items on the menu are more fla

chow fun.review: Probably the worst Chinese food ever! CrAb rangoons were burned.  General Tsao was mushy and just plain nasty. The chow fun was nothing like the picture on site. DO NOT ever order from here!!

excerpts: I ordered Pork Chow Fun and it was so good!!!
Barbecued pork was amazingggg, but it was SLIGHTLY dry.
But it was still SOOO goodddd.
Ahhh.
Not greasy at all!!
Then we had the brilliant idea of mixing the sauce with my chow fun to give it a little bit more flavor
and I was so happy!!!
Yummmmm.
Now I just need to find the suitable replacement in San DIego....
chow fun.author: Bella C.
chow fun.review:
OMG I miss really good Chinese food.  I can't seem to find anything good in San Diego!

So went home for the weekend and wanted to stay in and order food.  Had a pile of take out menus and finally decided on Chinese... then narrowed it down to Yum Yum Hunan.  I'm so happy with my choice!!

I ordered Pork Chow Fun and it was so good!!! Barbecued pork was amazingggg, but it was SLIGHTLY dry.  But it was still SOOO goodddd.  Ahhh. Not greasy at all!! =DD

The mongolian beef there is spicy for me, but it was still very good.  Usually my boyfriend picks out all of the meat and leaves all the veggies, but he actually started EATING the veggies cause of the sauce! It was amazing.  Then we had the brilliant idea of mixing the sauce with my chow fun to give it a little bit more flavor and I was so happy!!! Yummmmm.  Now I just need to find the suitable replacement in San DIego.... SO hard to find one that's reasonable in price and wonderful in taste =(.

The only thing that sucked was that it took like an hour to get it delivered, but I'm not sure what standard delivery time, so that was the only downside.

But it was SO worth the wait. I want more!!!
