excerpts: Chicken Chow Fun: Meh.
Honestly, I don't think there was enough soy or sauce on it because the noodles were not brown but a tan color, which is an indication that there isn't enough soy.
When tasting, it was a bit bland for what the dish could have been.
I would skip this dish or maybe try the beef chow fun next time.
chow fun.author: Christina B.
chow fun.review:
My Chinese food palate is quite extensive, especially living in San Francisco, growing up Chinese and constantly being surrounded by Chinese food.

I got delivery from this place last night and it wasn't horribly bad nor was it excellent either. The delivery time was standard, about 40 minutes. The food came warm which is always a plus in my book.

FOOD:
Green onion pancake: SKIP! This dish is definitely not worth the caloric intake nor is it worth your money. They only put the tasty green onion mixture in the middle of the pancake and it only covered approximately 25% of the pancake innards. Therefore, when they fry it up and serve it to you, you eat mostly fried batter without the yummy insides.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings: Not bad. I am a huge chicken wing enthusiast, especially salt and pepper wings, so I may be a bit critical when it comes to this dish. I've definitely had much tastier salt and pepper wings, but it isn't the worst I've had. It's fairly average and I would order it again if ordering from this place.

Chicken Chow Fun: Meh. Honestly, I don't think there was enough soy or sauce on it because the noodles were not brown but a tan color, which is an indication that there isn't enough soy. When tasting, it was a bit bland for what the dish could have been. I would skip this dish or maybe try the beef chow fun next time.

Bok Choy and Shiitake mushrooms: It's hard to ruin this dish so this dish gets my thumbs up especially if you're trying to eat healthy.

Wor Won Ton Soup: The broth was a bit plain and everything in it was just meh. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. 


In conclusion: just a "meh" restaurant. If I am craving Chinese, I might order from here again but I'd probably be more inclined to trying another place just because their food is just average. I'm not really sure why they have such a high rating. Is it the neighborhood they are in? If they were in the sunset or a more Chinese populated neighborhood, I have a feeling they wouldn't have such a high rating. If I were you, I'd skip on this place and try somewhere else.

excerpts: Our entrees included combo chow fun noodles that was standard but full of flavor and assorted meats and veggies, a seafood on sizzling rice dish that didn't really need the sizzling rice, and the "Yum Yum Delicatessen" that had nearly the same ingredients (sans celery and plus calamari) as the former but seemed to be the consensus favorite.
chow fun.author: Maximillian M.
chow fun.review:
The dinner started off nicely with wonton soup that had an excellent broth and veggies that were so fresh they still crunched, and good-sized wontons. Our entrees included combo chow fun noodles that was standard but full of flavor and assorted meats and veggies, a seafood on sizzling rice dish that didn't really need the sizzling rice, and the "Yum Yum Delicatessen" that had nearly the same ingredients (sans celery and plus calamari) as the former but seemed to be the consensus favorite.

Definite minus was the brown rice, that tasted like it had been left out in the open for way too long. It was pretty much wasn't edible.

Overall, a pleasant experience, cloth napkins (always appreciated), fast service, nice decor. Bonus: they had NBA games on the TV... which suspiciously looked like it was taken from a kid's bedroom...

excerpts: The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.
chow fun.author: Evan M.
chow fun.review:
Pretty good not great.  Delivery was relatively quick - 40 minutes into the presidio.  Food was a mixed bag.  The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.  The mongolian beef was not good - overcooked and poor quality beef.  Won ton soup also good.

I might try this again but will look for other places in the neighborhood to try first.

excerpts: And now that I've mentioned it, I'm craving chicken chow fun.
I would give them five stars
but I've peeped at my husband's order
and they've overdone it with filler ingredients on some of the pricier dishes (tons of peanuts, sprouts, watercrests, etc.).
But the cheap prices, the quick delivery and the delicious chow fun that lasts me for three days keeps me coming back.

chow fun.review: I've ordered delivery from them at least five times in the past five weeks. Addicted? Possibly. And now that I've mentioned it, I'm craving chicken chow fun. I would give them five stars but I've peeped at my husband's order and they've overdone it with filler ingredients on some of the pricier dishes (tons of peanuts, sprouts, watercrests, etc.). But the cheap prices, the quick delivery and the delicious chow fun that lasts me for three days keeps me coming back.

excerpts: They were nice enough to accomodate a change to chow fun.
chow fun.author: Janet L.
chow fun.review:
I wish I could give this a slightly higher rating just for service and cleanliness, but alas I'm unable to award half a star to bring it up to a 3.5.

The peking duck was nicely done and flavorful, accompanied by four fluffy buns, but we were a little disappointed by how little scallion they sent us away with.  The drunken beef with celery, mushrooms and snow peas tasted fairly healthy, but the sauce wasn't spectacular.  I slathered the soft pieces of beef in sriracha, as is my custom with mild foods.  The complimentary noodle dish was a winner!  For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.  They were nice enough to accomodate a change to chow fun.

All in all, I think this is a fine establishment and definitely a bargain for this area!

They close earlier than most places so order before 10. Im gonna miss this place when I move!

chow fun.review: Solid delivery place.  The people are really nice on the phone, and the delivery comes in a reasonable amount of time.  I didn't like the Basil Tofu dish much but that's only because there's a lot of water chestnuts in it.  The Lover's Prawns are great half honey walnut prawns and half prawns in a sweet slightly spicy sauce (if the sauce were spicier it'd be even better).  With two entrees, you get a free fried rice or noodle and you can get "chow fun" as the noodle entree.  Anytime we order from here we can eat the leftovers for at least 2 more meals.

prawn fried rice.review:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.

steamed rice.author: Izzyjenn K.
steamed rice.review: We ordered on the Yelp app: crispy noodles, Orange chicken and steamed rice. We were at the SPCA and they delivered with in less than 30 minutes! Everything was delicious!

excerpts: I called them up, and ordered the garlic pork, beef Hong Kong style noodles, steamed rice and some hot and sour soup.
Quoted a 45 minute delivery time, and a price around $20 bucks.
The dishes - particularly the garlic pork, were chock full of fresh veggies, while still having plentiful amounts of meat,
And the last +1 goes to the taste and overall quality.
The Hong Kong noodles were slightly crispy, with a bit of sauce getting them to just the right consistency.
steamed rice.author: Jonathan M.
steamed rice.review:
I don't know what it is about me and writing reviews of restaurants with "Yum Yum" in their names, but hey...

So it is Chinese New Year, and I didn't even have that cross my mind prior to putting in my order at YYH. I called them up, and ordered the garlic pork, beef Hong Kong style noodles, steamed rice and some hot and sour soup. Quoted a 45 minute delivery time, and a price around $20 bucks. So far so good.

The food was here in about 30 minutes, +1. The portions were ridonculoid huge, +1. The dishes - particularly the garlic pork, were chock full of fresh veggies, while still having plentiful amounts of meat,  +1. And the last +1 goes to the taste and overall quality. The Hong Kong noodles were slightly crispy, with a bit of sauce getting them to just the right consistency. Everything tasted great, and the quantities were large enough to stock up the fridge for some lunch time action tomorrow. 

Yum Yum Hunan is my new go-to for delivery in the Western Addition. Would recommend - and the delivery minimums / credit card minimums are really reasonable - $15 and $10, respectively.

excerpts: not the best out there, but good.. regular steamed rice, fried with soy sauce from what I can see.. chicken, eggs, peas, carrots, and onion..
so overal
, I'd say a 6/10 experience with them..
I'm sure
If I were drunk it'd be the best ever... lol.
but I like it, big noodles.. and big chunks of chicken in the rice
we'll probably order from here again.
steamed rice.author: Mariana O.
steamed rice.review:
When I first called to order I thought, wow he didn't ask me for my name, my phone number or how to get in the building?! Anyway, delivery came pretty quick, my phone says I called around 1:43, they called me at 2:03.. not bad. apparently they found my number on the caller ID. and when I came outside to pay the guy was already outside of my part of the building, I wondered how he was able to get in... weird!!
I ordered chicken chowmein, and chicken fried rice.. shared with my toddler and I. like all kids, he loves the noodles!! anything pasta, he'll eat, and ask for more..
and for me I'll give the chowmein a 6.5 out of 10.. it's good. the rice, the same. it's edible. not the best out there, but good.. regular steamed rice, fried with soy sauce from what I can see.. chicken, eggs, peas, carrots, and onion..
so overal, I'd say a 6/10 experience with them.. I'm sure If I were drunk it'd be the best ever... lol.
but I like it, big noodles.. and big chunks of chicken in the rice :)
we'll probably order from here again.
and my total, was $15.50.

and now full, finished eating. and theres still enough for at least 2 or 3 people!!! I told them medium, but I doubt it, the sizes look like there's one size only.. I can't eat anymore.. so if you order, make sure to be specific, and say Over Rice, make it  as one. because they will send you TWO boxes, one chowmein, and once fried rice. we have left overs for tomorrows lunch and dinner! lol.

excerpts: A feast of sweet & sour pork, honey walnut prawns, broccoli beef, chicken chow mein, and steamed rice was at my doorstep less than 1/2 hour after I called.
{Note: you don't need this much food for two people.
I will have leftovers for weeks.
Hilariously, they included 5 fortune cookies, as if to say "no way this is for a couple.
steamed rice.author: Kelly B.

excerpts: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.
steamed rice.author: Ileana H.
steamed rice.review:
Formerly known as Hunan China, it feels as if there's been a lot of revamping.

From:
-a new green awning with white font
-the interior (now a mustard yellow type color with white trim)
-more indoor plants
-perhaps new tables and chairs
-new tea pots
I could go on...but...AN ALTOGETHER CLEANER FEEL. 

A new menu item I did see: Mango Chicken (decent). 

Lunch is only served until 3pm. I believe the lunch special is only for weekdays.

What you get for SIX BUCKS: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.

I did spot that they do serve Sierra Nevada for $3. Awesome.

excerpts: I enjoyed the steamed rice more than the main dish!!!
And when the check came with a fortune cookie there was a piece of METAL baked into the cookie.
The waitress saw I was looking at it in my hand took it from me showed her manager and that was it!!!
No apology or free meal or even another cookie (not that I would have eaten it after that)!!
NOTHING!!
THIS PLACE SUCKS!
I'm not picky about where I eat
and I like everything
so this just blew my mind!!
Save your money and go to Clement to get some real great tasting Chinese food for cheaper!!
steamed rice.author: MAC A.
steamed rice.review: I tried this place once and it was alright. So I thought I would give it another chance. AWFUL!!!! I enjoyed the steamed rice more than the main dish!!! And when the check came with a fortune cookie there was a piece of METAL baked into the cookie. The waitress saw I was looking at it in my hand took it from me showed her manager and that was it!!! No apology or free meal or even another cookie (not that I would have eaten it after that)!! NOTHING!! THIS PLACE SUCKS!! I'm not picky about where I eat and I like everything so this just blew my mind!! Save your money and go to Clement to get some real great tasting Chinese food for cheaper!!

excerpts: Sesame Chicken lunch special is the only thing I order from here so cant review much else food wise but give it a try, I bet you'll enjoy it!
sesame chicken lunch special.author: Sara C.
sesame chicken lunch special.review:
I LOVE this places Sesame Chicken!! It is to me, hands down, the best around. The meat has a nice batter around it, its nice and crispy and so flavorful and they don't give you tiny little pieces like some restaurants. You get nice full chunks of chicken. 

Sesame Chicken lunch special is the only thing I order from here so cant review much else food wise but give it a try, I bet you'll enjoy it! The service is super fast as well. 

SIDE NOTE: They did change their payment policy so if you want to dine in, I believe you must spend a minimum of $20.00 if you are going to pay with CREDIT/DEBIT card.

excerpts: Got the Garlic Chicken lunch special.
Hot and Sour soup was good, though not the best I've ever had.
Came with some fried won tons (no meat) which were nice, though a bit salty.
Sauce was very good and nice amount and quality of chicken.
Vegetables consisted of zucchini, red onion, green onion, and mushrooms (which I would ask to leave off next time.)
Place is very clean, water refill service was attentive, service fast, nice classy square plates.
Fairly uncrowded at 11:30 on a Wednesday.
I would return to try some of their other items.
Good fortune cookie and nice toothpick quality.
garlic chicken lunch special.author: Marc S.
garlic chicken lunch special.review: Got the Garlic Chicken lunch special.  Hot and Sour soup was good, though not the best I've ever had.  Came with some fried won tons (no meat) which were nice, though a bit salty.  Sauce was very good and nice amount and quality of chicken.  Vegetables consisted of zucchini, red onion, green onion, and mushrooms (which I would ask to leave off next time.)  Place is very clean, water refill service was attentive, service fast, nice classy square plates.  Fairly uncrowded at 11:30 on a Wednesday.  I would return to try some of their other items.  Good fortune cookie and nice toothpick quality.

excerpts: I particularly like the string bean chicken lunch special.
string bean chicken lunch special.author: STEVE L.
string bean chicken lunch special.review: I normally get take-out from here.  They're fast.  The food is normally ready within 10 minutes.  Like almost all Chinese restaurants, their food is made with lots of oil.  Everything is tasty.  I particularly like the string bean chicken lunch special.

excerpts: I had their Mongolian beef lunch special.
It came w/
an eggroll, nothing special, a hot n sour soup, bleh...
yuk...patuwee!
The beef was alright.
I like the fact that you have the option of brown or white rice; the brown rice needed more water.
I'd give the beef 3 stars, but overall it's a 2.
Extra credit:
Whenever the guy answers the phone, it sounds like he was hoping that it was "Yum Yum" on the other end, "Hello...
Yum Yum?
"  Lol.
mongolian beef lunch special.author: Jay M.
mongolian beef lunch special.review:
My 1st time...I had their Mongolian beef lunch special. It came w/ an eggroll, nothing special, a hot n sour soup, bleh... yuk...patuwee! The beef was alright. I like the fact that you have the option of brown or white rice; the brown rice needed more water. I'd give the beef 3 stars, but overall it's a 2.
Extra credit:
Whenever the guy answers the phone, it sounds like he was hoping that it was "Yum Yum" on the other end, "Hello...Yum Yum?"  Lol.

excerpts: i ordered Mongolian Beef Lunch Special, way too much pepper, and MSG!
I can normally tolerate MSG, but here my jaw stiffened and i started getting chest pains.
Luckily i stopped and after drinking lots of water
i was ok.
If you eat here, dont eat the mongolian beef and check that the amount on your credit card is correct.
mongolian beef lunch special.author: Shane J.
mongolian beef lunch special.review:
We ate here the other day and it was a bad experience. 

i ordered Mongolian Beef Lunch Special, way too much pepper, and MSG! I can normally tolerate MSG, but here my jaw stiffened and i started getting chest pains. Luckily i stopped and after drinking lots of water i was ok.  I think you can not see the MSG, but I could see the extreme amount of pepper in the beef. 

Today when looking at our credit card account online, we found that they added money on our credit card. They charged us more than we approved. We feel that we gave a good tip (30%) and no business should overcharge on people's credit cards. 

If you eat here, dont eat the mongolian beef and check that the amount on your credit card is correct.

excerpts: Had an order of the Basil Tofu lunch special ($7) in between appointments at UCSF: fried tofu, carrot, & red pepper with brown rice, a little salad, vegetarian hot & sour soup and an egg roll.
Food was delicious, staff was attentive, and an the ambiance was augmented with CNBC!
basil tofu lunch special.author: Rishi C.
basil tofu lunch special.review: Had an order of the Basil Tofu lunch special ($7) in between appointments at UCSF: fried tofu, carrot, & red pepper with brown rice, a little salad, vegetarian hot & sour soup and an egg roll.  Food was delicious, staff was attentive, and an the ambiance was augmented with CNBC!
